verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ म॒हीम॒रम॑तिं स॒जोषा॒ ग्नां दे॒वीं नम॑सा रा॒तह॑व्याम् मधो॒र्मदा॑य बृह॒तीमृ॑त॒ज्ञामाग्ने॑ वह प॒थिभि॑र्देव॒यानैः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ no mahī́m arámatiṃ sajóṣāḥ-  gnā́ṃ devī́ṃ námasā rātáhavyām  mádhor mádāya br̥hatī́m r̥tajñā́m  ā́gne vaha pathíbhir devayā́naiḥ

translation.text: Bring by God-traversed paths, accordant, Agni, the great Aramati, Celestial Lady, Exalted, worshipped with our gifts and homage, who knoweth holy Law, to drink sweet Soma.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ञ्जन्ति॒ यं प्र॒थय॑न्तो॒ न विप्रा॑ व॒पाव॑न्तं॒ नाग्निना॒ तप॑न्तः पि॒तुर्न पु॒त्र उ॒पसि॒ प्रेष्ठ॒ आ घ॒र्मो अ॒ग्निमृ॒तय॑न्नसादि
verses.transliteration: añjánti yám pratháyanto ná víprāḥ-  vapā́vantaṃ nā́gnínā tápantaḥ  pitúr ná putrá upási préṣṭhaḥ-  ā́ gharmó agním r̥táyann asādi

translation.text: As on his father's lap the son, the darling, so on the fire is set the sacred caldron, Which holy singers deck, as if extending and heating that which holds the fatty membrane.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अच्छा॑ म॒ही बृ॑ह॒ती शंत॑मा॒ गीर्दू॒तो न ग॑न्त्व॒श्विना॑ हु॒वध्यै॑ म॒यो॒भुवा॑ स॒रथा या॑तम॒र्वाग्ग॒न्तं नि॒धिं धुर॑मा॒णिर्न नाभि॑म्
verses.transliteration: áchā mahī́ br̥hatī́ śáṃtamā gī́r  dūtó ná gantv aśvínā huvádhyai  mayobhúvā saráthā́ yātam arvā́g  gantáṃ nidhíṃ dhúram āṇír ná nā́bhim

translation.text: Hither, as herald to invite the Aṣvins, come the great lofty song, most sweet and pleasant! Come in one car, joy-givers! to the banquet, like the bolt binding pole and nave, come hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र तव्य॑सो॒ नम॑उक्तिं तु॒रस्या॒हं पू॒ष्ण उ॒त वा॒योर॑दिक्षि या राध॑सा चोदि॒तारा॑ मती॒नां या वाज॑स्य द्रविणो॒दा उ॒त त्मन्
verses.transliteration: prá távyaso námaÅktiṃ turásya-  -ahám pūṣṇá utá vāyór adikṣi  yā́ rā́dhasā coditā́rā matīnā́ṃ  yā́ vā́jasya draviṇodā́ utá tmán

translation.text: I have declared this speech of adoration to mightiest Pûshan and victorious Vâyu, Who by their bounty are the hymns' inspirers, and of themselves give power as a possession.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नाम॑भिर्म॒रुतो॑ वक्षि॒ विश्वा॒ना रू॒पेभि॑र्जातवेदो हुवा॒नः य॒ज्ञं गिरो॑ जरि॒तुः सु॑ष्टु॒तिं च॒ विश्वे॑ गन्त मरुतो॒ विश्व॑ ऊ॒ती
verses.transliteration: ā́ nā́mabhir marúto vakṣi víśvān  ā́ rūpébhir jātavedo huvānáḥ  yajñáṃ gíro jaritúḥ suṣṭutíṃ ca  víśve ganta maruto víśva ūtī́

translation.text: Invoked by us bring hither, Jâtavedas the Maruts all under their names and figures. Come to the sacrifice with aid all Maruts, all to the songs and praises of the singer!

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ दि॒वो बृ॑ह॒तः पर्व॑ता॒दा सर॑स्वती यज॒ता ग॑न्तु य॒ज्ञम् हवं॑ दे॒वी जु॑जुषा॒णा घृ॒ताची॑ श॒ग्मां नो॒ वाच॑मुश॒ती शृ॑णोतु
verses.transliteration: ā́ no divó br̥hatáḥ párvatād ā́  sárasvatī yajatā́ gantu yajñám  hávaṃ devī́ jujuṣāṇā́ ghr̥tā́cī  śagmā́ṃ no vā́cam uśatī́ śr̥ṇotu

translation.text: From high heaven may Sarasvatî the Holy visit our sacrifice, and from the mountain. Eager, propitious, may the balmy Goddess hear our effectual speech, our invocation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वे॒धसं॒ नील॑पृष्ठं बृ॒हन्तं॒ बृह॒स्पतिं॒ सद॑ने सादयध्वम् सा॒दद्यो॑निं॒ दम॒ आ दी॑दि॒वांसं॒ हिर॑ण्यवर्णमरु॒षं स॑पेम
verses.transliteration: ā́ vedhásaṃ nī́lapr̥ṣṭham br̥hántam  bŕ̥haspátiṃ sádane sādayadhvam  sādádyoniṃ dáma ā́ dīdivā́ṃsaṃ  híraṇyavarṇam aruṣáṃ sapema

translation.text: Set in his seat the God whose back is dusky, Br̥ihaspati the lofty, the Disposer. Him let us worship, set within the dwelling, the red, the golden-hued, the allresplendent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ध॑र्ण॒सिर्बृ॒हद्दि॑वो॒ ररा॑णो॒ विश्वे॑भिर्ग॒न्त्वोम॑भिर्हुवा॒नः ग्ना वसा॑न॒ ओष॑धी॒रमृ॑ध्रस्त्रि॒धातु॑शृङ्गो वृष॒भो व॑यो॒धाः
verses.transliteration: ā́ dharṇasír br̥háddivo rárāṇo  víśvebhir gantv ómabhir huvānáḥ  gnā́ vásāna óṣadhīr ámr̥dhras  tridhā́tuśr̥ṅgo vr̥ṣabhó vayodhā́ḥ

translation.text: May the Sustainer, high in heaven, come hither, the Bounteous One, invoked, with all his favours, Dweller with Dames divine, with plants, unwearied, the Steer with triple horn, the life-bestower.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा॒तुष्प॒दे प॑र॒मे शु॒क्र आ॒योर्वि॑प॒न्यवो॑ रास्पि॒रासो॑ अग्मन् सु॒शेव्यं॒ नम॑सा रा॒तह॑व्याः॒ शिशुं॑ मृजन्त्या॒यवो॒ न वा॒से
verses.transliteration: mātúṣ padé paramé śukrá āyór  vipanyávo rāspirā́so agman  suśévyaṃ námasā rātáhavyāḥ  śíśum mr̥janty āyávo ná vāsé

translation.text: The tuneful eloquent priests of him who liveth have sought the Mother's bright and loftiest station. As living men, with offered gifts and homage they deck the most auspicious Child to clothe him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बृ॒हद्वयो॑ बृह॒ते तुभ्य॑मग्ने धिया॒जुरो॑ मिथु॒नासः॑ सचन्त दे॒वोदे॑वः सु॒हवो॑ भूतु॒ मह्यं॒ मा नो॑ मा॒ता पृ॑थि॒वी दु॑र्म॒तौ धा॑त्
verses.transliteration: br̥hád váyo br̥haté túbhyam agne  dhiyājúro mithunā́saḥ sacanta  devó-devaḥ suhávo bhūtu máhyam  mā́ no mātā́ pr̥thivī́ durmataú dhāt

translation.text: Agni, great vital power is thine, the mighty: pairs waxing old in their devotion seek thee. May every Deity be swift to listen, and Mother Earth with no ill thought regard me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒रौ दे॑वा अनिबा॒धे स्या॑म
verses.transliteration: uraú devā anibādhé syāma

translation.text: Gods, may we dwell in free untroubled bliss.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सम॒श्विनो॒रव॑सा॒ नूत॑नेन मयो॒भुवा॑ सु॒प्रणी॑ती गमेम आ नो॑ र॒यिं व॑हत॒मोत वी॒राना विश्वा॑न्यमृता॒ सौभ॑गानि
verses.transliteration: sám aśvínor ávasā nū́tanena  mayobhúvā supráṇītī gamema  ā́ no rayíṃ vahatam ótá vīrā́n  ā́ víśvāny amr̥tā saúbhagāni

translation.text: May we obtain the Aṣvins' newest favour, and gain their health-bestowing happy guidance. Bring riches hither unto us, and heroes, and all felicity and joy, Immortals!

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं प्र॒त्नथा॑ पू॒र्वथा॑ वि॒श्वथे॒मथा॑ ज्ये॒ष्ठता॑तिं बर्हि॒षदं॑ स्व॒र्विद॑म् प्र॒ती॒ची॒नं वृ॒जनं॑ दोहसे गि॒राशुं जय॑न्त॒मनु॒ यासु॒ वर्ध॑से
verses.transliteration: tám pratnáthā pūrváthā viśváthemáthā  jyeṣṭhátātim barhiṣádaṃ svarvídam  pratīcīnáṃ vr̥jánaṃ dohase girā́-  -āśúṃ jáyantam ánu yā́su várdhase

translation.text: As in the first old times, as all were wont, as now, he draweth forth the power turned hitherward with song, The Princedom throned on holy grass, who findeth light, swift, conquering in the' plants wherein he waxeth strong.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्रि॒ये सु॒दृशी॒रुप॑रस्य॒ याः स्व॑र्वि॒रोच॑मानः क॒कुभा॑मचो॒दते॑ सु॒गो॒पा अ॑सि॒ न दभा॑य सुक्रतो प॒रो मा॒याभि॑र्ऋ॒त आ॑स॒ नाम॑ ते
verses.transliteration: śriyé sudŕ̥śīr úparasya yā́ḥ svàr  virócamānaḥ kakúbhām acodáte  sugopā́ asi ná dábhāya sukrato  paró māyā́bhir r̥tá āsa nā́ma te

translation.text: Shining to him who leaves heaven's regions undisturbed, which to his sheen who is beneath show fair in light, Good guardian art thou, not to be deceived, Most Wise! Far from deceits thy name dwelleth in holy Law.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अत्यं॑ ह॒विः स॑चते॒ सच्च॒ धातु॒ चारि॑ष्टगातुः॒ स होता॑ सहो॒भरिः॑ प्र॒सर्स्रा॑णो॒ अनु॑ ब॒र्हिर्वृषा॒ शिशु॒र्मध्ये॒ युवा॒जरो॑ वि॒स्रुहा॑ हि॒तः
verses.transliteration: átyaṃ havíḥ sacate sác ca dhā́tu ca-  -áriṣṭagātuḥ sá hótā sahobháriḥ  prasársrāṇo ánu barhír vŕ̥ṣā śíśur  mádhye yúvājáro visrúhā hitáḥ

translation.text: Truth waits upon oblation present and to come: naught checks him in his way, this vic torybringing Priest: The Mighty Child who glides along the sacred grass, the undecaying Youth set in the midst of plants.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र व॑ ए॒ते सु॒युजो॒ याम॑न्नि॒ष्टये॒ नीची॑र॒मुष्मै॑ य॒म्य॑ ऋता॒वृधः॑ सु॒यन्तु॑भिः सर्वशा॒सैर॒भीशु॑भिः॒ क्रिवि॒र्नामा॑नि प्रव॒णे मु॑षायति
verses.transliteration: prá va eté suyújo yā́mann iṣṭáye  nī́cīr amúṣmai yamyà r̥tāvŕ̥dhaḥ  suyántubhiḥ sarvaśāsaír abhī́śubhiḥ  krívir nā́māni pravaṇé muṣāyati

translation.text: These come, well-yoked, to you for furtherance in the rite: down come the twinborn strengtheners of Law for him, With reins easily guided and commanding all. In the deep fall the hide stealeth away their names.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सं॒जर्भु॑राण॒स्तरु॑भिः सुते॒गृभं॑ वया॒किनं॑ चि॒त्तग॑र्भासु सु॒स्वरुः॑ धा॒र॒वा॒केष्वृ॑जुगाथ शोभसे॒ वर्ध॑स्व॒ पत्नी॑र॒भि जी॒वो अ॑ध्व॒रे
verses.transliteration: saṃjárbhurāṇas tárubhiḥ sutegŕ̥bhaṃ  vayākínaṃ cittágarbhāsu susváruḥ  dhāravākéṣv r̥jugātha śobhase  várdhasva pátnīr abhí jīvó adhvaré

translation.text: Thou, moving beauteously in visibly pregnant ones, snatching with trees the branching plant that grasps the juice, Shinest, true Singer! mid the upholders of the voice. Increase thy Consorts thou, lively at sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या॒दृगे॒व ददृ॑शे ता॒दृगु॑च्यते॒ सं छा॒यया॑ दधिरे सि॒ध्रया॒प्स्वा म॒हीम॒स्मभ्य॑मुरु॒षामु॒रु ज्रयो॑ बृ॒हत्सु॒वीर॒मन॑पच्युतं॒ सहः॑
verses.transliteration: yādŕ̥g evá dádr̥śe tādŕ̥g ucyate  sáṃ chāyáyā dadhire sidhráyāpsv ā́  mahī́m asmábhyam uruṣā́m urú jráyo  br̥hát suvī́ram ánapacyutaṃ sáhaḥ

translation.text: Like as he is beheld such is he said to be. They with effectual splendour in the floods have made Earth yield us room enough and amply wide extent, great might invincible, with store of hero sons.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वेत्यग्रु॒र्जनि॑वा॒न्वा अति॒ स्पृधः॑ समर्य॒ता मन॑सा॒ सूर्यः॑ क॒विः घ्रं॒सं रक्ष॑न्तं॒ परि॑ वि॒श्वतो॒ गय॑म॒स्माकं॒ शर्म॑ वनव॒त्स्वाव॑सुः
verses.transliteration: véty ágrur jánivān vā́ áti spŕ̥dhaḥ  samaryatā́ mánasā sū́ryaḥ kavíḥ  ghraṃsáṃ rákṣantam pári viśváto gáyam  asmā́kaṃ śárma vanavat svā́vasuḥ

translation.text: Sûrya the Sage, as if unwedded, with a Spouse, in battle-loving spirit moveth o'er the foes. May he, self-excellent, grant us a sheltering home, a house that wards the fierce heat off on every side.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज्यायां॑सम॒स्य य॒तुन॑स्य के॒तुन॑ ऋषिस्व॒रं च॑रति॒ यासु॒ नाम॑ ते या॒दृश्मि॒न्धायि॒ तम॑प॒स्यया॑ विद॒द्य उ॑ स्व॒यं वह॑ते॒ सो अरं॑ करत्
verses.transliteration: jyā́yāṃsam asyá yatúnasya ketúnā-  r̥ṣisvaráṃ carati yā́su nā́ma te  yādŕ̥śmin dhā́yi tám apasyáyā vidad  yá u svayáṃ váhate só áraṃ karat

translation.text: Thy name, sung forth by R̥ishis in these hymns of ours, goes to the loftier One with this swift mover's light. By skill he wins the boon whereon his heart is set: he who bestirs himself shall bring the thing to pass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒मु॒द्रमा॑सा॒मव॑ तस्थे अग्रि॒मा न रि॑ष्यति॒ सव॑नं॒ यस्मि॒न्नाय॑ता अत्रा॒ न हार्दि॑ क्रव॒णस्य॑ रेजते॒ यत्रा॑ म॒तिर्वि॒द्यते॑ पूत॒बन्ध॑नी
verses.transliteration: samudrám āsām áva tasthe agrimā́  ná riṣyati sávanaṃ yásminn ā́yatā  átrā ná hā́rdi kravaṇásya rejate  yátrā matír vidyáte pūtabándhanī

translation.text: The chief and best of these abideth in the sea, nor doth libation fail wherein it is prolonged. The heart of him who praiseth trembleth not in fear there where the hymn is found connected with the pure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स हि क्ष॒त्रस्य॑ मन॒सस्य॒ चित्ति॑भिरेवाव॒दस्य॑ यज॒तस्य॒ सध्रेः॑ अ॒व॒त्सा॒रस्य॑ स्पृणवाम॒ रण्व॑भिः॒ शवि॑ष्ठं॒ वाजं॑ वि॒दुषा॑ चि॒दर्ध्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: sá hí kṣatrásya manasásya cíttibhir  evāvadásya yajatásya sádhreḥ  avatsārásya spr̥ṇavāma ráṇvabhiḥ  śáviṣṭhaṃ vā́jaṃ vidúṣā cid árdhyam

translation.text: For it is he: with though to of Kshatra, Mânasa, of Yajata, and Sadhri, and Evâvada, With Avatsâra's sweet songs will we strive to win the mightiest strength which even he who knows should gain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: श्ये॒न आ॑सा॒मदि॑तिः क॒क्ष्यो॒३॒॑ मदो॑ वि॒श्ववा॑रस्य यज॒तस्य॑ मा॒यिनः॑ सम॒न्यम॑न्यमर्थय॒न्त्येत॑वे वि॒दुर्वि॒षाणं॑ परि॒पान॒मन्ति॒ ते
verses.transliteration: śyená āsām áditiḥ kakṣyò mádo  viśvávārasya yajatásya māyínaḥ  sám anyám-anyam arthayanty étave  vidúr viṣā́ṇam paripā́nam ánti té

translation.text: The Hawk is their full source, girth-stretching rapturous drink of Viṣvavâra, of Mayin, and Yajata. They ever seek a fresh draught so that they may come, know when thy time to halt and drink thy fill is near.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒दा॒पृ॒णो य॑ज॒तो वि द्विषो॑ वधीद्बाहुवृ॒क्तः श्रु॑त॒वित्तर्यो॑ वः॒ सचा॑ उ॒भा स वरा॒ प्रत्ये॑ति॒ भाति॑ च॒ यदीं॑ ग॒णं भज॑ते सुप्र॒याव॑भिः
verses.transliteration: sadāpr̥ṇó yajató ví dvíṣo vadhīd  bāhuvr̥ktáḥ śrutavít táryo vaḥ sácā  ubhā́ sá várā práty eti bhā́ti ca  yád īṃ gaṇám bhájate suprayā́vabhiḥ

translation.text: Sadâpr̥iṇa the holy, Tarya, Ṣrutavit, and Bâhuvr̥ikta, joined with you, have slain the foes. He gains his wish in both the worlds and brightly shines-when he adores the host with welladvancing steeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒त॒म्भ॒रो यज॑मानस्य॒ सत्प॑ति॒र्विश्वा॑सा॒मूधः॒ स धि॒यामु॒दञ्च॑नः भर॑द्धे॒नू रस॑वच्छिश्रिये॒ पयो॑ऽनुब्रुवा॒णो अध्ये॑ति॒ न स्व॒पन्
verses.transliteration: sutambharó yájamānasya sátpatir  víśvāsām ū́dhaḥ sá dhiyā́m udáñcanaḥ  bhárad dhenū́ rásavac chiśriye páyo  -anubruvāṇó ádhy eti ná svapán

translation.text: The worshipper's defender is Sutambhara, producer and uplifter of all holy thoughts. The milch-cow brought, sweet-flavoured milk was dealt around. Who speaks the bidding text knows this, not he who sleeps.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो जा॒गार॒ तमृचः॑ कामयन्ते॒ यो जा॒गार॒ तमु॒ सामा॑नि यन्ति यो जा॒गार॒ तम॒यं सोम॑ आह॒ तवा॒हम॑स्मि स॒ख्ये न्यो॑काः
verses.transliteration: yó jāgā́ra tám ŕ̥caḥ kāmayante  yó jāgā́ra tám u sā́māni yanti  yó jāgā́ra tám ayáṃ sóma āha  távāhám asmi sakhyé nyòkāḥ

translation.text: The sacred hymns love him who wakes and watches: to him who watches come the Sâma verses. This Soma saith unto the man who watches, I rest and have my dwelling in thy friendship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निर्जा॑गार॒ तमृचः॑ कामयन्ते॒ऽग्निर्जा॑गार॒ तमु॒ सामा॑नि यन्ति अ॒ग्निर्जा॑गार॒ तम॒यं सोम॑ आह॒ तवा॒हम॑स्मि स॒ख्ये न्यो॑काः
verses.transliteration: agnír jāgāra tám ŕ̥caḥ kāmayante  -agnír jāgāra tám u sā́māni yanti  agnír jāgāra tám ayáṃ sóma āha  távāhám asmi sakhyé nyòkāḥ

translation.text: Agni is watchful, and the gcas love him; Agni is watchful, Sâma verses seek him. Agni is watchful, to him saith this Soma, I rest and have my dwelling in thy friendship.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒दा दि॒वो वि॒ष्यन्नद्रि॑मु॒क्थैरा॑य॒त्या उ॒षसो॑ अ॒र्चिनो॑ गुः अपा॑वृत व्र॒जिनी॒रुत्स्व॑र्गा॒द्वि दुरो॒ मानु॑षीर्दे॒व आ॑वः
verses.transliteration: vidā́ divó viṣyánn ádrim ukthaír  āyatyā́ uṣáso arcíno guḥ  ápāvr̥ta vrajínīr út svàr gād  ví dúro mā́nuṣīr devá āvaḥ

translation.text: BARDS of approaching Dawn who know the heavens are come with hymns to throw the mountain open. The Sun hath risen and oped the stable portals: the doors of men, too, hath the God thrown open.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि सूर्यो॑ अ॒मतिं॒ न श्रियं॑ सा॒दोर्वाद्गवां॑ मा॒ता जा॑न॒ती गा॑त् धन्व॑र्णसो न॒द्य१॒॑ः खादो॑अर्णाः॒ स्थूणे॑व॒ सुमि॑ता दृंहत॒ द्यौः
verses.transliteration: ví sū́ryo amátiṃ ná śríyaṃ sād  órvā́d gávām mātā́ jānatī́ gāt  dhánvarṇaso nadyàḥ khā́doarṇāḥ-  sthū́ṇeva súmitā dr̥ṃhata dyaúḥ

translation.text: Sûrya hath spread his light as splendour: hither came the Cows' Mother, conscious, from the stable, To streams that flow with biting waves to deserts; and heaven is stablished like a firm-set pillar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मा उ॒क्थाय॒ पर्व॑तस्य॒ गर्भो॑ म॒हीनां॑ ज॒नुषे॑ पू॒र्व्याय॑ वि पर्व॑तो॒ जिही॑त॒ साध॑त॒ द्यौरा॒विवा॑सन्तो दसयन्त॒ भूम॑
verses.transliteration: asmā́ ukthā́ya párvatasya gárbho  mahī́nāṃ janúṣe pūrvyā́ya  ví párvato jíhīta sā́dhata dyaúr  āvívāsanto dasayanta bhū́ma

translation.text: This laud hath won the burden of the mountain. To aid the ancient birth of mighty waters The mountain parted, Heaven performed his office. The worshippers were worn with constant serving.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सू॒क्तेभि॑र्वो॒ वचो॑भिर्दे॒वजु॑ष्टै॒रिन्द्रा॒ न्व१॒॑ग्नी अव॑से हु॒वध्यै॑ उ॒क्थेभि॒र्हि ष्मा॑ क॒वयः॑ सुय॒ज्ञा आ॒विवा॑सन्तो म॒रुतो॒ यज॑न्ति
verses.transliteration: sūktébhir vo vácobhir devájuṣṭair  índrā nv àgnī́ ávase huvádhyai  ukthébhir hí ṣmā kaváyaḥ suyajñā́ḥ-  āvívāsanto marúto yájanti

translation.text: With hymns and God-loved words will I invoke you, Indra and Agni, to obtain your favour, For verily sages, skilled in sacrificing, worship the Maruts and with lauds invite them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एतो॒ न्व१॒॑द्य सु॒ध्यो॒३॒॑ भवा॑म॒ प्र दु॒च्छुना॑ मिनवामा॒ वरी॑यः आ॒रे द्वेषां॑सि सनु॒तर्द॑धा॒माया॑म॒ प्राञ्चो॒ यज॑मान॒मच्छ॑
verses.transliteration: éto nv àdyá sudhyò bhávāma  prá duchúnām inavāmā várīyaḥ  āré dvéṣāṃsi sanutár dadhāma-  -áyāma prā́ñco yájamānam ácha

translation.text: This day approach us: may our thoughts be holy, far from us let us cast away misfortune. Let us keep those who hate us at a distance, and haste to meet the man who sacrifices.

verses.sanskrit_deva: एता॒ धियं॑ कृ॒णवा॑मा सखा॒योऽप॒ या मा॒ताँ ऋ॑णु॒त व्र॒जं गोः यया॒ मनु॑र्विशिशि॒प्रं जि॒गाय॒ यया॑ व॒णिग्व॒ङ्कुरापा॒ पुरी॑षम्
verses.transliteration: étā dhíyaṃ kr̥ṇávāmā sakhāyaḥ-  -ápa yā́ mātā́m̐ r̥ṇutá vrajáṃ góḥ  yáyā mánur viśiśipráṃ jigā́ya  yáyā vaṇíg vaṅkúr ā́pā púrīṣam

translation.text: Come, let us carry out, O friends, the purpose wherewith the Mother threw the Cow's stall open, That wherewith Manu conquered Viṣiṣipra, wherewith the wandering merchant gained heaven's water.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अनू॑नो॒दत्र॒ हस्त॑यतो॒ अद्रि॒रार्च॒न्येन॒ दश॑ मा॒सो नव॑ग्वाः ऋ॒तं य॒ती स॒रमा॒ गा अ॑विन्द॒द्विश्वा॑नि स॒त्याङ्गि॑राश्चकार
verses.transliteration: ánūnod átra hástayato ádrir  ā́rcan yéna dáśa māsó návagvāḥ  r̥táṃ yatī́ sarámā gā́ avindad  víśvāni satyā́ṅgirāś cakāra

translation.text: Here, urged by hands, loudly hath rung the press-stone wherewith Navagvas through ten months sang praises. Saramâ went aright and found the cattle. Angiras gave effect to all their labours.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॑ अ॒स्या व्युषि॒ माहि॑नायाः॒ सं यद्गोभि॒रङ्गि॑रसो॒ नव॑न्त उत्स॑ आसां पर॒मे स॒धस्थ॑ ऋ॒तस्य॑ प॒था स॒रमा॑ विद॒द्गाः
verses.transliteration: víśve asyā́ vyúṣi mā́hināyāḥ  sáṃ yád góbhir áṅgiraso návanta  útsa āsām paramé sadhásthe-  r̥tásya pathā́ sarámā vidad gā́ḥ

translation.text: When at the dawning of this mighty Goddess, Angirases all sang forth with the cattle,– Their spring is in the loftiest place of meeting,– Saramâ found the kine by Order's pathway.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ सूर्यो॑ यातु स॒प्ताश्वः॒ क्षेत्रं॒ यद॑स्योर्वि॒या दी॑र्घया॒थे र॒घुः श्ये॒नः प॑तय॒दन्धो॒ अच्छा॒ युवा॑ क॒विर्दी॑दय॒द्गोषु॒ गच्छ॑न्
verses.transliteration: ā́ sū́ryo yātu saptā́śvaḥ  kṣétraṃ yád asyorviyā́ dīrghayāthé  raghúḥ śyenáḥ patayad ándho áchā  yúvā kavír dīdayad góṣu gáchan

translation.text: Borne by his Coursers Seven may Sûrya visit the field that spreadeth wide for his long journey. Down on the Soma swooped the rapid Falcon. Bright was the young Sage moving mid his cattle.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ सूर्यो॑ अरुहच्छु॒क्रमर्णोऽयु॑क्त॒ यद्ध॒रितो॑ वी॒तपृ॑ष्ठाः उ॒द्ना न नाव॑मनयन्त॒ धीरा॑ आशृण्व॒तीरापो॑ अ॒र्वाग॑तिष्ठन्
verses.transliteration: ā́ sū́ryo aruhac chukrám árṇaḥ-  -áyukta yád dharíto vītápr̥ṣṭhāḥ  udnā́ ná nā́vam anayanta dhī́rāḥ-  āśr̥ṇvatī́r ā́po arvā́g atiṣṭhan

translation.text: Sûrya hath mounted to the shining ocean when he hath yoked his fair-backed Tawny Horses. The wise have drawn him like a ship through water: the floods obedient have descended hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धियं॑ वो अ॒प्सु द॑धिषे स्व॒र्षां ययात॑र॒न्दश॑ मा॒सो नव॑ग्वाः अ॒या धि॒या स्या॑म दे॒वगो॑पा अ॒या धि॒या तु॑तुर्या॒मात्यंहः॑
verses.transliteration: dhíyaṃ vo apsú dadhiṣe svarṣā́ṃ  yáyā́taran dáśa māsó návagvāḥ  ayā́ dhiyā́ syāma devágopāḥ-  ayā́ dhiyā́ tuturyāmā́ty áṃhaḥ

translation.text: I lay upon the Floods your hymn, lightwinning, wherewith Navagvas their ten months completed. Through this our hymn may we have Gods to guard us: through this our hymn pass safe beyond affliction.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हयो॒ न वि॒द्वाँ अ॑युजि स्व॒यं धु॒रि तां व॑हामि प्र॒तर॑णीमव॒स्युव॑म् नास्या॑ वश्मि वि॒मुचं॒ नावृतं॒ पुन॑र्वि॒द्वान्प॒थः पु॑रए॒त ऋ॒जु ने॑षति
verses.transliteration: háyo ná vidvā́m̐ ayuji svayáṃ dhurí  tā́ṃ vahāmi pratáraṇīm avasyúvam  nā́syā vaśmi vimúcaṃ nā́vŕ̥tam púnar  vidvā́n patháḥ puraetá r̥jú neṣati

translation.text: WELL knowing I have bound me, horselike, to the pole: I carry that which bears as on and gives us help. I seek for no release, no turning back therefrom. May he who knows the way, the Leader, guide me straight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्न॒ इन्द्र॒ वरु॑ण॒ मित्र॒ देवाः॒ शर्धः॒ प्र य॑न्त॒ मारु॑तो॒त वि॑ष्णो उ॒भा नास॑त्या रु॒द्रो अध॒ ग्नाः पू॒षा भगः॒ सर॑स्वती जुषन्त
verses.transliteration: ágna índra váruṇa mítra dévāḥ  śárdhaḥ prá yanta mā́rutotá viṣṇo  ubhā́ nā́satyā rudró ádha gnā́ḥ  pūṣā́ bhágaḥ sárasvatī juṣanta

translation.text: O Agni, Indra, Varuṇa, and Mitra, give, O ye Gods, and Marut host, and Vishṇu. May both Nâsatyas, Rudra, heavenly Matrons, Pûshan, Sarasvatî, Bhaga, accept us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒न्द्रा॒ग्नी मि॒त्रावरु॒णादि॑तिं॒ स्वः॑ पृथि॒वीं द्यां म॒रुतः॒ पर्व॑ताँ अ॒पः हु॒वे विष्णुं॑ पू॒षणं॒ ब्रह्म॑ण॒स्पतिं॒ भगं॒ नु शंसं॑ सवि॒तार॑मू॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: indrāgnī́ mitrā́váruṇā́ditiṃ svàḥ  pr̥thivī́ṃ dyā́m marútaḥ párvatām̐ apáḥ  huvé víṣṇum pūṣáṇam bráhmaṇas pátim  bhágaṃ nú śáṃsaṃ savitā́ram ūtáye

translation.text: Indra and Agni, Mitra, Varuṇa, Aditi, the Waters, Mountains, Maruts, Sky, and Earth and Heaven, Vishṇu I call, Pûshan, and Brahmaṇaspati, and Bhaga, Ṣaṅsa, Savitar that they may help.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त नो॒ विष्णु॑रु॒त वातो॑ अ॒स्रिधो॑ द्रविणो॒दा उ॒त सोमो॒ मय॑स्करत् उ॒त ऋ॒भव॑ उ॒त रा॒ये नो॑ अ॒श्विनो॒त त्वष्टो॒त विभ्वानु॑ मंसते
verses.transliteration: utá no víṣṇur utá vā́to asrídho  draviṇodā́ utá sómo máyas karat  utá r̥bháva utá rāyé no aśvínā-  -utá tváṣṭotá víbhvā́nu maṃsate

translation.text: May Vishṇu also and Vâta who injures none, and Soma granter of possessions give us joy; And may the R̥ibhus and the Aṣvins, Tvashṭar and Vibhvan remember us so that we may have wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त त्यन्नो॒ मारु॑तं॒ शर्ध॒ आ ग॑मद्दिविक्ष॒यं य॑ज॒तं ब॒र्हिरा॒सदे॑ बृह॒स्पतिः॒ शर्म॑ पू॒षोत नो॑ यमद्वरू॒थ्यं१॒॑ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा
verses.transliteration: utá tyán no mā́rutaṃ śárdha ā́ gamad  divikṣayáṃ yajatám barhír āsáde  bŕ̥haspátiḥ śárma pūṣótá no yamad  varūthyàṃ váruṇo mitró aryamā́

translation.text: So may the band of Maruts dwelling in the sky, the holy, come to us to sit on sacred grass; Br̥ihaspati and Pûshan grant us sure defence, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman guard and shelter us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त त्ये नः॒ पर्व॑तासः सुश॒स्तयः॑ सुदी॒तयो॑ न॒द्य१॒॑स्त्राम॑णे भुवन् भगो॑ विभ॒क्ता शव॒साव॒सा ग॑मदुरु॒व्यचा॒ अदि॑तिः श्रोतु मे॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: utá tyé naḥ párvatāsaḥ suśastáyaḥ  sudītáyo nadyàs trā́maṇe bhuvan  bhágo vibhaktā́ śávasā́vasā́ gamad  uruvyácā áditiḥ śrotu me hávam

translation.text: And may the Mountains famed in noble eulogies, and the fair-gleaming Rivers keep us safe from harm. May Bhaga the Dispenser come with power and grace, and far-pervading Aditi listen to my call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वानां॒ पत्नी॑रुश॒तीर॑वन्तु नः॒ प्राव॑न्तु नस्तु॒जये॒ वाज॑सातये याः पार्थि॑वासो॒ या अ॒पामपि॑ व्र॒ते ता नो॑ देवीः सुहवाः॒ शर्म॑ यच्छत
verses.transliteration: devā́nām pátnīr uśatī́r avantu naḥ  prā́vantu nas tujáye vā́jasātaye  yā́ḥ pā́rthivāso yā́ apā́m ápi vraté  tā́ no devīḥ suhavāḥ śárma yachata

translation.text: May the Gods' Spouses aid us of their own freewill, aid us to offspring and the winning of the spoil. Grant us protection, O ye gracious Goddesses, ye who are on the earth or in the waters' realm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त ग्ना व्य॑न्तु दे॒वप॑त्नीरिन्द्रा॒ण्य१॒॑ग्नाय्य॒श्विनी॒ राट् आ रोद॑सी वरुणा॒नी शृ॑णोतु॒ व्यन्तु॑ दे॒वीर्य ऋ॒तुर्जनी॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: utá gnā́ vyantu devápatnīr  indrāṇy àgnā́yy aśvínī rā́ṭ  ā́ ródasī varuṇānī́ śr̥ṇotu  vyántu devī́r yá r̥túr jánīnām

translation.text: May the Dames, wives of Gods, enjoy our presents, Râṭ, Aṣvinî, Agnâyî, and Indrânî. May Rodasî and Varuṇânî hear us, and Goddesses come at the Matrons' season.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒यु॒ञ्ज॒ती दि॒व ए॑ति ब्रुवा॒णा म॒ही मा॒ता दु॑हि॒तुर्बो॒धय॑न्ती आ॒विवा॑सन्ती युव॒तिर्म॑नी॒षा पि॒तृभ्य॒ आ सद॑ने॒ जोहु॑वाना
verses.transliteration: prayuñjatī́ divá eti bruvāṇā́  mahī́ mātā́ duhitúr bodháyantī  āvívāsantī yuvatír manīṣā́  pitŕ̥bhya ā́ sádane jóhuvānā

translation.text: URGING to toil and making proclamation, seeking Heaven's Daughter comes the Mighty Mother: She comes, the youthful Hymn, unto the Fathers, inviting to her home and loudly calling.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒जि॒रास॒स्तद॑प॒ ईय॑माना आतस्थि॒वांसो॑ अ॒मृत॑स्य॒ नाभि॑म् अ॒न॒न्तास॑ उ॒रवो॑ वि॒श्वतः॑ सीं॒ परि॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी य॑न्ति॒ पन्थाः॑
verses.transliteration: ajirā́sas tádapa ī́yamānāḥ-  ātasthivā́ṃso amŕ̥tasya nā́bhim  anantā́sa urávo viśvátaḥ sīm  pári dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ yanti pánthāḥ

translation.text: Swift in their motion, hasting to their duty, reaching the central point of life immortal, On every side about the earth and heaven go forth the spacious paths without a limit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒क्षा स॑मु॒द्रो अ॑रु॒षः सु॑प॒र्णः पूर्व॑स्य॒ योनिं॑ पि॒तुरा वि॑वेश मध्ये॑ दि॒वो निहि॑तः॒ पृश्नि॒रश्मा॒ वि च॑क्रमे॒ रज॑सस्पा॒त्यन्तौ॑
verses.transliteration: ukṣā́ samudró aruṣáḥ suparṇáḥ  pū́rvasya yónim pitúr ā́ viveśa  mádhye divó níhitaḥ pŕ̥śnir áśmā  ví cakrame rájasas pāty ántau

translation.text: Steer, Sea, Red Bird with strong wings, he hath entered the dwelling-place of the Primeval Father. A gay-hued Stone set in the midst of heaven, he hath gone forth and guards mid-air's two limits.

verses.sanskrit_deva: च॒त्वार॑ ईं बिभ्रति क्षेम॒यन्तो॒ दश॒ गर्भं॑ च॒रसे॑ धापयन्ते त्रि॒धात॑वः पर॒मा अ॑स्य॒ गावो॑ दि॒वश्च॑रन्ति॒ परि॑ स॒द्यो अन्ता॑न्
verses.transliteration: catvā́ra īm bibhrati kṣemayánto  dáśa gárbhaṃ caráse dhāpayante  tridhā́tavaḥ paramā́ asya gā́vo  diváś caranti pári sadyó ántān

translation.text: Four bear him up and give him rest and quiet, and ten invigorate the Babe for travel. His kine most excellent, of threefold nature, pass swiftly round the boundaries of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दं वपु॑र्नि॒वच॑नं जनास॒श्चर॑न्ति॒ यन्न॒द्य॑स्त॒स्थुरापः॑ द्वे यदीं॑ बिभृ॒तो मा॒तुर॒न्ये इ॒हेह॑ जा॒ते य॒म्या॒३॒॑ सब॑न्धू
verses.transliteration: idáṃ vápur nivácanaṃ janāsaś  cáranti yán nadyàs tasthúr ā́paḥ  dvé yád īm bibhr̥tó mātúr anyé  ihéha jāté yamyā̀ sábandhū

translation.text: Wondrous, O people, is the mystic knowledge that while the waters stand the streams are flowing: That, separate from his Mother, Two support him, closely-united, twins, here made apparent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि त॑न्वते॒ धियो॑ अस्मा॒ अपां॑सि॒ वस्त्रा॑ पु॒त्राय॑ मा॒तरो॑ वयन्ति उ॒प॒प्र॒क्षे वृष॑णो॒ मोद॑माना दि॒वस्प॒था व॒ध्वो॑ य॒न्त्यच्छ॑
verses.transliteration: ví tanvate dhíyo asmā ápāṃsi  vástrā putrā́ya mātáro vayanti  upaprakṣé vŕ̥ṣaṇo módamānāḥ-  divás pathā́ vadhvò yanty ácha

translation.text: For him they lenghten prayers and acts of worship: the Mothers weave garments for him their offspring. Rejoicing, for the Steer's impregning contact, his Spouses move on paths or heaven to meet him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद॑स्तु मित्रावरुणा॒ तद॑ग्ने॒ शं योर॒स्मभ्य॑मि॒दम॑स्तु श॒स्तम् अ॒शी॒महि॑ गा॒धमु॒त प्र॑ति॒ष्ठां नमो॑ दि॒वे बृ॑ह॒ते साद॑नाय
verses.transliteration: tád astu mitrāvaruṇā tád agne  śáṃ yór asmábhyam idám astu śastám  aśīmáhi gādhám utá pratiṣṭhā́ṃ  námo divé br̥haté sā́danāya

translation.text: Be this our praise, O Varuṇa and Mitra may this be health and force to us, O Agni. May we obtain firm ground and room for resting: Glory to Heaven, the lofty habitation!

verses.sanskrit_deva: कदु॑ प्रि॒याय॒ धाम्ने॑ मनामहे॒ स्वक्ष॑त्राय॒ स्वय॑शसे म॒हे व॒यम् आ॒मे॒न्यस्य॒ रज॑सो॒ यद॒भ्र आँ अ॒पो वृ॑णा॒ना वि॑त॒नोति॑ मा॒यिनी॑
verses.transliteration: kád u priyā́ya dhā́mne manāmahe  svákṣatrāya sváyaśase mahé vayám  āmenyásya rájaso yád abhrá ā́m̐  apó vr̥ṇānā́ vitanóti māyínī

translation.text: WHAT may we meditate for the beloved Power, mighty in native strength and glorious in itself, Which as a magic energy seeking waters spreads even to theimmeasurable middle region's cloud?

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता अ॑त्नत व॒युनं॑ वी॒रव॑क्षणं समा॒न्या वृ॒तया॒ विश्व॒मा रजः॑ अपो॒ अपा॑ची॒रप॑रा॒ अपे॑जते॒ प्र पूर्वा॑भिस्तिरते देव॒युर्जनः॑
verses.transliteration: tā́ atnata vayúnaṃ vīrávakṣaṇaṃ  samānyā́ vr̥táyā víśvam ā́ rájaḥ  ápo ápācīr áparā ápejate  prá pū́rvābhis tirate devayúr jánaḥ

translation.text: O'er all the region with their uniform advance these have spread out the lore that giveth heroes strength. Back, with their course reversed, the others pass away: the pious lengthens life with those that are before.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ग्राव॑भिरह॒न्ये॑भिर॒क्तुभि॒र्वरि॑ष्ठं॒ वज्र॒मा जि॑घर्ति मा॒यिनि॑ श॒तं वा॒ यस्य॑ प्र॒चर॒न्त्स्वे दमे॑ संव॒र्तय॑न्तो॒ वि च॑ वर्तय॒न्नहा॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ grā́vabhir ahanyèbhir aktúbhir  váriṣṭhaṃ vájram ā́ jigharti māyíni  śatáṃ vā yásya pracáran své dáme  saṃvartáyanto ví ca vartayann áhā

translation.text: With pressing-stones and with the bright beams of the day he hurls his broadest bolt against the Guileful One. Even he whose hundred wander in his own abode, driving the days afar and bringing them again.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ताम॑स्य री॒तिं प॑र॒शोरि॑व॒ प्रत्यनी॑कमख्यं भु॒जे अ॑स्य॒ वर्प॑सः सचा॒ यदि॑ पितु॒मन्त॑मिव॒ क्षयं॒ रत्नं॒ दधा॑ति॒ भर॑हूतये वि॒शे
verses.transliteration: tā́m asya rītím paraśór iva práti-  ánīkam akhyam bhujé asya várpasaḥ  sácā yádi pitumántam iva kṣáyaṃ  rátnaṃ dádhāti bhárahūtaye viśé

translation.text: I, to enjoy the beauty of his form, behold that rapid rush of his as 'twere an axe's edge, What time he gives the man who calls on him in fight wealth like a dwelling-house filled full with store of food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स जि॒ह्वया॒ चतु॑रनीक ऋञ्जते॒ चारु॒ वसा॑नो॒ वरु॑णो॒ यत॑न्न॒रिम् न तस्य॑ विद्म पुरुष॒त्वता॑ व॒यं यतो॒ भगः॑ सवि॒ता दाति॒ वार्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: sá jihváyā cáturanīka r̥ñjate  cā́ru vásāno váruṇo yátann arím  ná tásya vidma puruṣatvátā vayáṃ  yáto bhágaḥ savitā́ dā́ti vā́ryam

translation.text: Four-faced and nobly clad, Varuṇa, urging on the pious to his task, stirs himself with the tongue. Naught by our human nature do we know of him, him from whom Bhaga Savitar bestows the boon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दे॒वं वो॑ अ॒द्य स॑वि॒तार॒मेषे॒ भगं॑ च॒ रत्नं॑ वि॒भज॑न्तमा॒योः आ वां॑ नरा पुरुभुजा ववृत्यां दि॒वेदि॑वे चिदश्विना सखी॒यन्
verses.transliteration: deváṃ vo adyá savitā́ram éṣe  bhágaṃ ca rátnaṃ vibhájantam āyóḥ  ā́ vāṃ narā purubhujā vavr̥tyāṃ  divé-dive cid aśvinā sakhīyán

translation.text: THIS day I bring God Savitar to meet you, and Bhaga who allots the wealth of mortals. You, Aṣvins, Heroes rich in treasures, daily seeking your friendship fain would I turn hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॑ प्र॒याण॒मसु॑रस्य वि॒द्वान्त्सू॒क्तैर्दे॒वं स॑वि॒तारं॑ दुवस्य उप॑ ब्रुवीत॒ नम॑सा विजा॒नञ्ज्येष्ठं॑ च॒ रत्नं॑ वि॒भज॑न्तमा॒योः
verses.transliteration: práti prayā́ṇam ásurasya vidvā́n  sūktaír deváṃ savitā́raṃ duvasya  úpa bruvīta námasā vijānáñ  jyéṣṭhaṃ ca rátnaṃ vibhájantam āyóḥ

translation.text: Knowing full well the Asura's time of coming, worship God Savitar with hymns and praises. Let him who rightly knoweth speak with homage to him who dealeth out man's noblest treasure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒द॒त्र॒या द॑यते॒ वार्या॑णि पू॒षा भगो॒ अदि॑ति॒र्वस्त॑ उ॒स्रः इन्द्रो॒ विष्णु॒र्वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॒ग्निरहा॑नि भ॒द्रा ज॑नयन्त द॒स्माः
verses.transliteration: adatrayā́ dayate vā́ryāṇi  pūṣā́ bhágo áditir vásta usráḥ  índro víṣṇur váruṇo mitró agnír  áhāni bhadrā́ janayanta dasmā́ḥ

translation.text: Not for reward doth Pûshan send his blessings, Bhaga, or Aditi: his garb is splendour. May Indra, Visniu, Varuṇa, Mitra, Agni produce auspicious days, the Wonder-Workers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तन्नो॑ अन॒र्वा स॑वि॒ता वरू॑थं॒ तत्सिन्ध॑व इ॒षय॑न्तो॒ अनु॑ ग्मन् उप॒ यद्वोचे॑ अध्व॒रस्य॒ होता॑ रा॒यः स्या॑म॒ पत॑यो॒ वाज॑रत्नाः
verses.transliteration: tán no anarvā́ savitā́ várūthaṃ  tát síndhava iṣáyanto ánu gman  úpa yád vóce adhvarásya hótā  rāyáḥ syāma pátayo vā́jaratnāḥ

translation.text: Sending the shelter which we ask, the foeless Savitar and the Rivers shall approach us. When I, the sacrifice's priest, invite them, may we he lords of wealth and rich possessions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ये वसु॑भ्य॒ ईव॒दा नमो॒ दुर्ये मि॒त्रे वरु॑णे सू॒क्तवा॑चः अवै॒त्वभ्वं॑ कृणु॒ता वरी॑यो दि॒वस्पृ॑थि॒व्योरव॑सा मदेम
verses.transliteration: prá yé vásubhya ī́vad ā́ námo dúr  yé mitré váruṇe sūktávācaḥ  ávaitv ábhvaṃ kr̥ṇutā́ várīyo  diváspr̥thivyór ávasā madema

translation.text: They who devote such worship to the Vasus, singing their hymns to Varuṇa and Mitra, Vouchsafe them ample room, far off be danger. Through grace of Heaven and Earth may we be happy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वो॑ दे॒वस्य॑ ने॒तुर्मर्तो॑ वुरीत स॒ख्यम् विश्वो॑ रा॒य इ॑षुध्यति द्यु॒म्नं वृ॑णीत पु॒ष्यसे॑
verses.transliteration: víśvo devásya netúr  márto vurīta sakhyám  víśvo rāyá iṣudhyati  dyumnáṃ vr̥ṇīta puṣyáse

translation.text: LET every mortal man elect the friendship of the guiding God. Each one solicits him for wealth and seeks renown to prosper him.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते ते॑ देव नेत॒र्ये चे॒माँ अ॑नु॒शसे॑ ते रा॒या ते ह्या॒३॒॑पृचे॒ सचे॑महि सच॒थ्यैः॑
verses.transliteration: té te deva netar  yé cemā́m̐ anuśáse  té rāyā́ té hy ā̀pŕ̥ce  sácemahi sacathyaìḥ

translation.text: These, leading God, are thine, and these here ready to speak after us. As such may we attain to wealth and wait with services on thee.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अतो॑ न॒ आ नॄनति॑थी॒नतः॒ पत्नी॑र्दशस्यत आ॒रे विश्वं॑ पथे॒ष्ठां द्वि॒षो यु॑योतु॒ यूयु॑विः
verses.transliteration: áto na ā́ nr̥̄́n átithīn  átaḥ pátnīr daśasyata  āré víśvam patheṣṭhā́ṃ  dviṣó yuyotu yū́yuviḥ

translation.text: So further honour as our guests the Hero Gods and then the Dames. May he remove and keep afar our foes and all who block our path.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्र॒ वह्नि॑र॒भिहि॑तो दु॒द्रव॒द्द्रोण्यः॑ प॒शुः नृ॒मणा॑ वी॒रप॒स्त्योऽर्णा॒ धीरे॑व॒ सनि॑ता
verses.transliteration: yátra váhnir abhíhito  dudrávad dróṇyaḥ paśúḥ  nr̥máṇā vīrápastyaḥ-  -árṇā dhī́reva sánitā

translation.text: Where fire is set, and swiftly runs the victim dwelling in the trough, He wins, with heroes in his home, friendly to man, like constant streams.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष ते॑ देव नेता॒ रथ॒स्पतिः॒ शं र॒यिः शं रा॒ये शं स्व॒स्तय॑ इषः॒स्तुतो॑ मनामहे देव॒स्तुतो॑ मनामहे
verses.transliteration: eṣá te deva netar-  ráthaspátiḥ śáṃ rayíḥ  śáṃ rāyé śáṃ svastáye  iṣastúto manāmahe  devastúto manāmahe

translation.text: May these thy riches, Leader God! that rule the car, be blest to us, Yea, blest to us for wealth and weal. This will we ponder praising strength, this ponder as we praise the God.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॑ सु॒तस्य॑ पी॒तये॒ विश्वै॒रूमे॑भि॒रा ग॑हि दे॒वेभि॑र्ह॒व्यदा॑तये
verses.transliteration: ágne sutásya pītáye  víśvair ū́mebhir ā́ gahi  devébhir havyádātaye

translation.text: WITH all assistants, Agni, come hither to drink the Soma-juice; With Gods unto our sacred gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋत॑धीतय॒ आ ग॑त॒ सत्य॑धर्माणो अध्व॒रम् अ॒ग्नेः पि॑बत जि॒ह्वया॑
verses.transliteration: ŕ̥tadhītaya ā́ gata  sátyadharmāṇo adhvarám  agnéḥ pibata jihváyā

translation.text: Come to the sacrifice, O ye whose ways are right, whose laws are true, And drink the draught with Agni's tongue.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विप्रे॑भिर्विप्र सन्त्य प्रात॒र्याव॑भि॒रा ग॑हि दे॒वेभिः॒ सोम॑पीतये
verses.transliteration: víprebhir vipra santya  prātaryā́vabhir ā́ gahi  devébhiḥ sómapītaye

translation.text: O Singer, with the singers, O Gracious, with those who move at dawn, Come to the Soma-draught with Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒यं सोम॑श्च॒मू सु॒तोऽम॑त्रे॒ परि॑ षिच्यते प्रि॒य इन्द्रा॑य वा॒यवे॑
verses.transliteration: ayáṃ sómaś camū́ sutó  -ámatre pári ṣicyate  priyá índrāya vāyáve

translation.text: To Indra and to Vâyu dear, this Soma, by the mortar pressed, Is now poured forth to fill the jar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वाय॒वा या॑हि वी॒तये॑ जुषा॒णो ह॒व्यदा॑तये पिबा॑ सु॒तस्यान्ध॑सो अ॒भि प्रयः॑
verses.transliteration: vā́yav ā́ yāhi vītáye  juṣāṇó havyádātaye  píbā sutásyā́ndhaso  abhí práyaḥ

translation.text: Vâyu, come hither to the feast, wellpleased unto our sacred gifts: Drink of the Soma juice effused come to the food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्र॑श्च वायवेषां सु॒तानां॑ पी॒तिम॑र्हथः ताञ्जु॑षेथामरे॒पसा॑व॒भि प्रयः॑
verses.transliteration: índraś ca vāyav eṣāṃ  sutā́nām pītím arhathaḥ  tā́ñ juṣethām arepásāv  abhí práyaḥ

translation.text: Ye, Indra, Vâyu, well deserve to drink the juices pressed by us. Gladly accept them, spotless Pair come to the food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒ता इन्द्रा॑य वा॒यवे॒ सोमा॑सो॒ दध्या॑शिरः नि॒म्नं न य॑न्ति॒ सिन्ध॑वो॒ऽभि प्रयः॑
verses.transliteration: sutā́ índrāya vāyáve  sómāso dádhyāśiraḥ  nimnáṃ ná yanti síndhavo  abhí práyaḥ

translation.text: For Indra and for Vâyu pressed are Soma juices blent with curd, As rivers to the lowland flow: come to the food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒जूर्विश्वे॑भिर्दे॒वेभि॑र॒श्विभ्या॑मु॒षसा॑ स॒जूः आ या॑ह्यग्ने अत्रि॒वत्सु॒ते र॑ण
verses.transliteration: sajū́r víśvebhir devébhir  -aśvíbhyām uṣásā sajū́ḥ  ā́ yāhy agne atrivát  suté raṇa

translation.text: Associate with all the Gods, come, with the Aṣvins and with Dawn, Agni, as erst with Atri, so enjoy the juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒जूर्मि॒त्रावरु॑णाभ्यां स॒जूः सोमे॑न॒ विष्णु॑ना आ या॑ह्यग्ने अत्रि॒वत्सु॒ते र॑ण
verses.transliteration: sajū́r mitrā́váruṇābhyāṃ  sajū́ḥ sómena víṣṇunā  ā́ yāhy agne atrivát  suté raṇa

translation.text: Associate with Varuṇa, with Mitra, Soma, Vishṇu, come, Agni, as erstwith Atri, so enjoy the juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒जूरा॑दि॒त्यैर्वसु॑भिः स॒जूरिन्द्रे॑ण वा॒युना॑ आ या॑ह्यग्ने अत्रि॒वत्सु॒ते र॑ण
verses.transliteration: sajū́r ādityaír vásubhiḥ  sajū́r índreṇa vāyúnā  ā́ yāhy agne atrivát  suté raṇa

translation.text: Associate with Vasus, with Âdityas, Indra, Viyu, come, Agni as erst with Atri, so enjoy the juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒स्ति नो॑ मिमीताम॒श्विना॒ भगः॑ स्व॒स्ति दे॒व्यदि॑तिरन॒र्वणः॑ स्व॒स्ति पू॒षा असु॑रो दधातु नः स्व॒स्ति द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी सु॑चे॒तुना॑
verses.transliteration: svastí no mimītām aśvínā bhágaḥ  svastí devy áditir anarváṇaḥ  svastí pūṣā́ ásuro dadhātu naḥ  svastí dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ sucetúnā

translation.text: May Bhaga and the Aṣvins grant us health and wealth, and Goddess Adid and he whom none resist. The Asura Pûshan grant us all prosperity, and Heaven and Earth most wise vouchsafe us happiness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒स्तये॑ वा॒युमुप॑ ब्रवामहै॒ सोमं॑ स्व॒स्ति भुव॑नस्य॒ यस्पतिः॑ बृह॒स्पतिं॒ सर्व॑गणं स्व॒स्तये॑ स्व॒स्तय॑ आदि॒त्यासो॑ भवन्तु नः
verses.transliteration: svastáye vāyúm úpa bravāmahai  sómaṃ svastí bhúvanasya yás pátiḥ  bŕ̥haspátiṃ sárvagaṇaṃ svastáye  svastáya ādityā́so bhavantu naḥ

translation.text: Let us solicit Vâyu for prosperity, and Soma who is Lord of all the world for weal; For weal Br̥ihaspati with all his company. May the Âdityas bring us health and happiness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॑ दे॒वा नो॑ अ॒द्या स्व॒स्तये॑ वैश्वान॒रो वसु॑र॒ग्निः स्व॒स्तये॑ दे॒वा अ॑वन्त्वृ॒भवः॑ स्व॒स्तये॑ स्व॒स्ति नो॑ रु॒द्रः पा॒त्वंह॑सः
verses.transliteration: víśve devā́ no adyā́ svastáye  vaiśvānaró vásur agníḥ svastáye  devā́ avantv r̥bhávaḥ svastáye  svastí no rudráḥ pātv áṃhasaḥ

translation.text: May all the Gods, may Agni the beneficent, God of all men, this day be with us for our weal. Help us the R̥ibhus, the Divine Ones, for our good. May Rudra bless and keep us from calamity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒स्ति मि॑त्रावरुणा स्व॒स्ति प॑थ्ये रेवति स्व॒स्ति न॒ इन्द्र॑श्चा॒ग्निश्च॑ स्व॒स्ति नो॑ अदिते कृधि
verses.transliteration: svastí mitrāvaruṇā  svastí pathye revati  svastí na índraś cāgníś ca  svastí no adite kr̥dhi

translation.text: Prosper us, Mitra, Varuṇa. O wealthy Pathyâ, prosper us. Indra and Agni, prosper us; prosper us thou, O Aditi.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒स्ति पन्था॒मनु॑ चरेम सूर्याचन्द्र॒मसा॑विव पुन॒र्दद॒ताघ्न॑ता जान॒ता सं ग॑मेमहि
verses.transliteration: svastí pánthām ánu carema  sūryācandramásāv iva  púnar dádatā́ghnatā  jānatā́ sáṃ gamemahi

translation.text: Like Sun and Moon may we pursue in full prosperity our path, And meet with one who gives again, -who knows us well and slays us not.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र श्या॑वाश्व धृष्णु॒यार्चा॑ म॒रुद्भि॒र्ऋक्व॑भिः ये अ॑द्रो॒घम॑नुष्व॒धं श्रवो॒ मद॑न्ति य॒ज्ञियाः॑
verses.transliteration: prá śyāvāśva dhr̥ṣṇuyā́-  -árcā marúdbhir ŕ̥kvabhiḥ  yé adroghám anuṣvadháṃ  śrávo mádanti yajñíyāḥ

translation.text: SING boldly forth, Ṣyâvâṣva, with the Maruts who are loud in song, Who, holy, as their wont is, joy in glory that is free from guile.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते हि स्थि॒रस्य॒ शव॑सः॒ सखा॑यः॒ सन्ति॑ धृष्णु॒या ते याम॒न्ना धृ॑ष॒द्विन॒स्त्मना॑ पान्ति॒ शश्व॑तः
verses.transliteration: té hí sthirásya śávasaḥ  sákhāyaḥ sánti dhr̥ṣṇuyā́  té yā́mann ā́ dhr̥ṣadvínas  tmánā pānti śáśvataḥ

translation.text: For in their boldness they are friends of firm and sure heroic strength. They in their course, bold-spirited, guard all men of their own accord.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते स्य॒न्द्रासो॒ नोक्षणोऽति॑ ष्कन्दन्ति॒ शर्व॑रीः म॒रुता॒मधा॒ महो॑ दि॒वि क्ष॒मा च॑ मन्महे
verses.transliteration: té syandrā́so nókṣáṇaḥ-  -áti ṣkandanti śárvarīḥ  marútām ádhā máho  diví kṣamā́ ca manmahe

translation.text: Like steers in rapid motion they advance and overtake the nights; And thus the Maruts' power in heaven and on the earth we celebrate.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒रुत्सु॑ वो दधीमहि॒ स्तोमं॑ य॒ज्ञं च॑ धृष्णु॒या विश्वे॒ ये मानु॑षा यु॒गा पान्ति॒ मर्त्यं॑ रि॒षः
verses.transliteration: marútsu vo dadhīmahi  stómaṃ yajñáṃ ca dhr̥ṣṇuyā́  víśve yé mā́nuṣā yugā́  pā́nti mártyaṃ riṣáḥ

translation.text: With boldness to your Maruts let us offer laud and sacrifice: Who all, through ages of mankind, guard mortal man from injury.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अर्ह॑न्तो॒ ये सु॒दान॑वो॒ नरो॒ असा॑मिशवसः प्र य॒ज्ञं य॒ज्ञिये॑भ्यो दि॒वो अ॑र्चा म॒रुद्भ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: árhanto yé sudā́navo  náro ásāmiśavasaḥ  prá yajñáṃ yajñíyebhyo  divó arcā marúdbhyaḥ

translation.text: Praiseworthy, givers of good gifts, Heroes with full and perfect strength – To Maruts, Holy Ones of heaven, will I extol the sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ रु॒क्मैरा यु॒धा नर॑ ऋ॒ष्वा ऋ॒ष्टीर॑सृक्षत अन्वे॑नाँ॒ अह॑ वि॒द्युतो॑ म॒रुतो॒ जज्झ॑तीरिव भा॒नुर॑र्त॒ त्मना॑ दि॒वः
verses.transliteration: ā́ rukmaír ā́ yudhā́ náraḥ-  r̥ṣvā́ r̥ṣṭī́r asr̥kṣata  ánv enām̐ áha vidyúto  marúto jájjhatīr iva  bhānúr arta tmánā diváḥ

translation.text: The lofty Heroes cast their spears and weapons bright with gleaming gold. After these Maruts followed close, like laughing lightning from the sky, a splendour of its own accord.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये वा॑वृ॒धन्त॒ पार्थि॑वा॒ य उ॒राव॒न्तरि॑क्ष॒ आ वृ॒जने॑ वा न॒दीनां॑ स॒धस्थे॑ वा म॒हो दि॒वः
verses.transliteration: yé vāvr̥dhánta pā́rthivāḥ-  yá urā́v antárikṣa ā́  vr̥jáne vā nadī́nāṃ  sadhásthe vā mahó diváḥ

translation.text: They who waxed mighty, of the earth, they who are in the wide mid-air, Or in the rivers' compass, or in the abode of ample heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शर्धो॒ मारु॑त॒मुच्छं॑स स॒त्यश॑वस॒मृभ्व॑सम् उ॒त स्म॒ ते शु॒भे नरः॒ प्र स्प॒न्द्रा यु॑जत॒ त्मना॑
verses.transliteration: śárdho mā́rutam úc chaṃsa  satyáśavasam ŕ̥bhvasam  utá sma té śubhé náraḥ  prá syandrā́ yujata tmánā

translation.text: Praise thou the Maruts' company, the valorous and truly strong, The Heroes, hasting, by themselves have yoked their deer for victory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्म॒ ते परु॑ष्ण्या॒मूर्णा॑ वसत शु॒न्ध्यवः॑ उ॒त प॒व्या रथा॑ना॒मद्रिं॑ भिन्द॒न्त्योज॑सा
verses.transliteration: utá sma té páruṣṇyām  ū́rṇā vasata śundhyávaḥ  utá pavyā́ ráthānām  ádrim bhindanty ójasā

translation.text: Fair-gleaming, on Parushṇî they have clothed themselves in robes of wool, And with their chariot tires they cleave the rock asunder in their might.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आप॑थयो॒ विप॑थ॒योऽन्त॑स्पथा॒ अनु॑पथाः ए॒तेभि॒र्मह्यं॒ नाम॑भिर्य॒ज्ञं वि॑ष्टा॒र ओ॑हते
verses.transliteration: ā́pathayo vípathayaḥ-  -ántaspathā ánupathāḥ  etébhir máhyaṃ nā́mabhir  yajñáṃ viṣṭārá ohate

translation.text: Whether as wanderers from the way or speeders on or to the path, Under these names the spreading band tend well the sacrifice for me.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधा॒ नरो॒ न्यो॑ह॒तेऽधा॑ नि॒युत॑ ओहते अधा॒ पारा॑वता॒ इति॑ चि॒त्रा रू॒पाणि॒ दर्श्या॑
verses.transliteration: ádhā náro ny òhate-  -ádhā niyúta ohate  ádhā pā́rāvatā íti  citrā́ rūpā́ṇi dárśyā

translation.text: To this the Heroes well attend, well do their teams attend to this. Visible are their varied forms. Behold, they are Pârâvatas.

verses.sanskrit_deva: छ॒न्दः॒स्तुभः॑ कुभ॒न्यव॒ उत्स॒मा की॒रिणो॑ नृतुः ते मे॒ के चि॒न्न ता॒यव॒ ऊमा॑ आसन्दृ॒शि त्वि॒षे
verses.transliteration: chandastúbhaḥ kubhanyávaḥ-  útsam ā́ kīríṇo nr̥tuḥ  té me ké cin ná tāyávaḥ-  ū́mā āsan dr̥śí tviṣé

translation.text: Hymn-singing, seeking water, they, praising, have danced about the spring. What are they unto me? No thieves, but helpers, splendid to behold.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य ऋ॒ष्वा ऋ॒ष्टिवि॑द्युतः क॒वयः॒ सन्ति॑ वे॒धसः॑ तमृ॑षे॒ मारु॑तं ग॒णं न॑म॒स्या र॒मया॑ गि॒रा
verses.transliteration: yá r̥ṣvā́ r̥ṣṭívidyutaḥ  kaváyaḥ sánti vedhásaḥ  tám r̥ṣe mā́rutaṃ gaṇáṃ  namasyā́ ramáyā girā́

translation.text: Sublime, with lightnings for their spears, Sages and Orderers are they. R̥ishi, adore that Marut host, and make them happy with thy song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अच्छ॑ ऋषे॒ मारु॑तं ग॒णं दा॒ना मि॒त्रं न यो॒षणा॑ दि॒वो वा॑ धृष्णव॒ ओज॑सा स्तु॒ता धी॒भिरि॑षण्यत
verses.transliteration: ácha r̥ṣe mā́rutaṃ gaṇáṃ  dānā́ mitráṃ ná yoṣáṇā  divó vā dhr̥ṣṇava ójasā  stutā́ dhībhír iṣaṇyata

translation.text: R̥ishi, invite the Marut band with offerings, as a maid her friend. From heaven, too, Bold Ones, in your might haste hither glorified with songs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नू म॑न्वा॒न ए॑षां दे॒वाँ अच्छा॒ न व॒क्षणा॑ दा॒ना स॑चेत सू॒रिभि॒र्याम॑श्रुतेभिर॒ञ्जिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: nū́ manvāná eṣāṃ  devā́m̐ áchā ná vakṣáṇā  dānā́ saceta sūríbhir  yā́maśrutebhir añjíbhiḥ

translation.text: Thinking of these now let him come, as with the escort of the Gods, And with the splendid Princes, famed for rapid courses, to the gifts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ये मे॑ बन्ध्वे॒षे गां वोच॑न्त सू॒रयः॒ पृश्निं॑ वोचन्त मा॒तर॑म् अधा॑ पि॒तर॑मि॒ष्मिणं॑ रु॒द्रं वो॑चन्त॒ शिक्व॑सः
verses.transliteration: prá yé me bandhveṣé  gā́ṃ vócanta sūráyaḥ  pŕ̥śniṃ vocanta mātáram  ádhā pitáram iṣmíṇaṃ  rudráṃ vocanta śíkvasaḥ

translation.text: Princes, who, when I asked their kin, named Pr̥iṣni as their Mother-cow, And the impetuous Rudra they, the Mighty Ones, declared their Sire.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒प्त मे॑ स॒प्त शा॒किन॒ एक॑मेका श॒ता द॑दुः य॒मुना॑या॒मधि॑ श्रु॒तमुद्राधो॒ गव्यं॑ मृजे॒ नि राधो॒ अश्व्यं॑ मृजे
verses.transliteration: saptá me saptá śākínaḥ-  ékam-ekā śatā́ daduḥ  yamúnāyām ádhi śrutám  úd rā́dho gávyam mr̥je  ní rā́dho áśvyam mr̥je

translation.text: The mighty ones, the seven times seven, have singly given me hundred gifts. I have obtained on Yamunâ famed wealth in kine and wealth in steeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: को वे॑द॒ जान॑मेषां॒ को वा॑ पु॒रा सु॒म्नेष्वा॑स म॒रुता॑म् यद्यु॑यु॒ज्रे कि॑ला॒स्यः॑
verses.transliteration: kó veda jā́nam eṣāṃ  kó vā purā́ sumnéṣv āsa marútām  yád yuyujré kilāsyàḥ

translation.text: Who knows the birth of these, or who lived in the Maruts' favour in the days of old What time their spotted deer were yoked?

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऐतान्रथे॑षु त॒स्थुषः॒ कः शु॑श्राव क॒था य॑युः कस्मै॑ सस्रुः सु॒दासे॒ अन्वा॒पय॒ इळा॑भिर्वृ॒ष्टयः॑ स॒ह
verses.transliteration: aítā́n rátheṣu tasthúṣaḥ  káḥ śuśrāva kathā́ yayuḥ  kásmai sasruḥ sudā́se ánv āpáyaḥ-  íḷābhir vr̥ṣṭáyaḥ sahá

translation.text: Who, when they stood upon their cars, hath heard them tell the way they went? Who was the bounteous man to whom their kindred rains flowed down with food of sacrifice?

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते म॑ आहु॒र्य आ॑य॒युरुप॒ द्युभि॒र्विभि॒र्मदे॑ नरो॒ मर्या॑ अरे॒पस॑ इ॒मान्पश्य॒न्निति॑ ष्टुहि
verses.transliteration: té ma āhur yá āyayúr  úpa dyúbhir víbhir máde  náro máryā arepásaḥ-  imā́n páśyann íti ṣṭuhi

translation.text: To me they told it, and they came with winged steeds radiant to the draught, Youths, Heroes free from spot or stain: Behold us here and praise thou us;

verses.sanskrit_deva: ये अ॒ञ्जिषु॒ ये वाशी॑षु॒ स्वभा॑नवः स्र॒क्षु रु॒क्मेषु॑ खा॒दिषु॑ श्रा॒या रथे॑षु॒ धन्व॑सु
verses.transliteration: yé añjíṣu yé vā́śīṣu svábhānavaḥ  srakṣú rukméṣu khādíṣu  śrāyā́ rátheṣu dhánvasu

translation.text: Who shine self-luminous with ornaments and swords, with breastplates, armlets, and with wreaths, Arrayed on chariots and with bows.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒ष्माकं॑ स्मा॒ रथाँ॒ अनु॑ मु॒दे द॑धे मरुतो जीरदानवः वृ॒ष्टी द्यावो॑ य॒तीरि॑व
verses.transliteration: yuṣmā́kaṃ smā ráthām̐ ánu  mudé dadhe maruto jīradānavaḥ  vr̥ṣṭī́ dyā́vo yatī́r iva

translation.text: O swift to pour your bounties down, ye Maruts, with delight I look upon your cars, Like splendours coming through the rain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यं नरः॑ सु॒दान॑वो ददा॒शुषे॑ दि॒वः कोश॒मचु॑च्यवुः वि प॒र्जन्यं॑ सृजन्ति॒ रोद॑सी॒ अनु॒ धन्व॑ना यन्ति वृ॒ष्टयः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ yáṃ náraḥ sudā́navo dadāśúṣe  diváḥ kóśam ácucyavuḥ  ví parjányaṃ sr̥janti ródasī ánu  dhánvanā yanti vr̥ṣṭáyaḥ

translation.text: Munificent Heroes, they have cast heaven's treasury down for the worshipper's behoof: They set the storm-cloud free tostream through both the worlds, and rainfloods flow o'er desert spots.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त॒तृ॒दा॒नाः सिन्ध॑वः॒ क्षोद॑सा॒ रजः॒ प्र स॑स्रुर्धे॒नवो॑ यथा स्य॒न्ना अश्वा॑ इ॒वाध्व॑नो वि॒मोच॑ने॒ वि यद्वर्त॑न्त ए॒न्यः॑
verses.transliteration: tatr̥dānā́ḥ síndhavaḥ kṣódasā rájaḥ  prá sasrur dhenávo yathā  syannā́ áśvā ivā́dhvano vimócane  ví yád vártanta enyàḥ

translation.text: The bursting streams m billowy flood have spread abroad, like milch-kine, o'er the firmament. Like swift steeds hasting to their journey's resting-place, to every side run glittering brooks.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ या॑त मरुतो दि॒व आन्तरि॑क्षाद॒मादु॒त माव॑ स्थात परा॒वतः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ yāta maruto diváḥ-  ā́ntárikṣād amā́d utá  mā́va sthāta parāvátaḥ

translation.text: Hither, O Maruts, come from heaven, from mid-air, or from near at hand Tarry not far away from us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा वो॑ र॒सानि॑तभा॒ कुभा॒ क्रुमु॒र्मा वः॒ सिन्धु॒र्नि री॑रमत् मा वः॒ परि॑ ष्ठात्स॒रयुः॑ पुरी॒षिण्य॒स्मे इत्सु॒म्नम॑स्तु वः
verses.transliteration: mā́ vo rasā́nitabhā kúbhā krúmur  mā́ vaḥ síndhur ní rīramat  mā́ vaḥ pári ṣṭhāt saráyuḥ purīṣíṇī-  asmé ít sumnám astu vaḥ

translation.text: So let not Rasâ, Krumu, or Anitabhâ, Kubhâ, or Sindhu hold you back. Let not the watery Sarayti obstruct your way. With us be all the bliss ye give.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं वः॒ शर्धं॒ रथा॑नां त्वे॒षं ग॒णं मारु॑तं॒ नव्य॑सीनाम् अनु॒ प्र य॑न्ति वृ॒ष्टयः॑
verses.transliteration: táṃ vaḥ śárdhaṃ ráthānāṃ  tveṣáṃ gaṇám mā́rutaṃ návyasīnām  ánu prá yanti vr̥ṣṭáyaḥ

translation.text: That brilliant gathering of your cars, the company of Maruts, of the Youthful Ones, The rain-showers, speeding on, attend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शर्धं॑शर्धं व एषां॒ व्रातं॑व्रातं ग॒णंग॑णं सुश॒स्तिभिः॑ अनु॑ क्रामेम धी॒तिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: śárdhaṃ-śardhaṃ va eṣāṃ  vrā́taṃ-vrātaṃ gaṇáṃ-gaṇaṃ suśastíbhir  ánu krāmema dhītíbhiḥ

translation.text: With eulogies and hymns may we follow your army, troop by troop, and band by band, And company by company.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कस्मा॑ अ॒द्य सुजा॑ताय रा॒तह॑व्याय॒ प्र य॑युः ए॒ना यामे॑न म॒रुतः॑
verses.transliteration: kásmā adyá sújātāya  rātáhavyāya prá yayuḥ  enā́ yā́mena marútaḥ

translation.text: To what oblation-giver, sprung of noble ancestry, have sped The Maruts on this course to-day?

verses.sanskrit_deva: येन॑ तो॒काय॒ तन॑याय धा॒न्यं१॒॑ बीजं॒ वह॑ध्वे॒ अक्षि॑तम् अ॒स्मभ्यं॒ तद्ध॑त्तन॒ यद्व॒ ईम॑हे॒ राधो॑ वि॒श्वायु॒ सौभ॑गम्
verses.transliteration: yéna tokā́ya tánayāya dhānyàm  bī́jaṃ váhadhve ákṣitam  asmábhyaṃ tád dhattana yád va ī́mahe  rā́dho viśvā́yu saúbhagam

translation.text: Vouchsafe to us the bounty, that which we implore, through which, for child and progeny, Ye give the seed of corn that wasteth not away, and bliss that reacheth to all life.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अती॑याम नि॒दस्ति॒रः स्व॒स्तिभि॑र्हि॒त्वाव॒द्यमरा॑तीः वृ॒ष्ट्वी शं योराप॑ उ॒स्रि भे॑ष॒जं स्याम॑ मरुतः स॒ह
verses.transliteration: átīyāma nidás tiráḥ svastíbhir  hitvā́vadyám árātīḥ  vr̥ṣṭvī́ śáṃ yór ā́pa usrí bheṣajáṃ  syā́ma marutaḥ sahá

translation.text: May we in safety pass by those who slander us, leaving behind disgrace and hate. Maruts, may we be there when ye, at dawn, in rest and toil, rain waters down and balm.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒दे॒वः स॑महासति सु॒वीरो॑ नरो मरुतः॒ स मर्त्यः॑ यं त्राय॑ध्वे॒ स्याम॒ ते
verses.transliteration: sudeváḥ samahāsati  suvī́ro naro marutaḥ sá mártyaḥ  yáṃ trā́yadhve syā́ma té

translation.text: Favoured by Gods shall he the man, O Heroes, Marutr! and possessed of noble sons, Whom ye protect. Such may we be.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्तु॒हि भो॒जान्त्स्तु॑व॒तो अ॑स्य॒ याम॑नि॒ रण॒न्गावो॒ न यव॑से य॒तः पूर्वाँ॑ इव॒ सखीँ॒रनु॑ ह्वय गि॒रा गृ॑णीहि का॒मिनः॑
verses.transliteration: stuhí bhojā́n stuvató asya yā́mani  ráṇan gā́vo ná yávase  yatáḥ pū́rvām̐ iva sákhīm̐r ánu hvaya  girā́ gr̥ṇīhi kāmínaḥ

translation.text: Praise the Free-givers. At this liberal patron's rite they joy like cattle in the mead. So call thou unto them who come as ancient Friends: hymn those who love thee with a song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र शर्धा॑य॒ मारु॑ताय॒ स्वभा॑नव इ॒मां वाच॑मनजा पर्वत॒च्युते॑ घ॒र्म॒स्तुभे॑ दि॒व आ पृ॑ष्ठ॒यज्व॑ने द्यु॒म्नश्र॑वसे॒ महि॑ नृ॒म्णम॑र्चत
verses.transliteration: prá śárdhāya mā́rutāya svábhānave-  imā́ṃ vā́cam anajā parvatacyúte  gharmastúbhe divá ā́ pr̥ṣṭhayájvane  dyumnáśravase máhi nr̥mṇám arcata

translation.text: THIS hymn will I make for the Marut host who bright in native splendour cast the mountains down. Sing the great strength of those illustrious in renown, who stay the heat, who sacrifice on heights of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वो॑ मरुतस्तवि॒षा उ॑द॒न्यवो॑ वयो॒वृधो॑ अश्व॒युजः॒ परि॑ज्रयः सं वि॒द्युता॒ दध॑ति॒ वाश॑ति त्रि॒तः स्वर॒न्त्यापो॒ऽवना॒ परि॑ज्रयः
verses.transliteration: prá vo marutas taviṣā́ udanyávo  vayovŕ̥dho aśvayújaḥ párijrayaḥ  sáṃ vidyútā dádhati vā́śati tritáḥ  sváranty ā́po 'vánā párijrayaḥ

translation.text: O Maruts, rich in water, strengtheners of life are your strong bands with harnessed steeds, that wander far. Trita roars out at him who aims the lightning-flash. The waters sweeping round are thundering on their way.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि॒द्युन्म॑हसो॒ नरो॒ अश्म॑दिद्यवो॒ वात॑त्विषो म॒रुतः॑ पर्वत॒च्युतः॑ अ॒ब्द॒या चि॒न्मुहु॒रा ह्रा॑दुनी॒वृतः॑ स्त॒नय॑दमा रभ॒सा उदो॑जसः
verses.transliteration: vidyúnmahaso náro áśmadidyavo  vā́tatviṣo marútaḥ parvatacyútaḥ  abdayā́ cin múhur ā́ hrādunīvŕ̥taḥ-  stanáyadamā rabhasā́ údojasaḥ

translation.text: They gleam with lightning, Heroes, Casters of the Stone, wind-rapid Maruts, overthrowers of the bills, Oft through desire to rain coming with storm of hail, roaring in onset, violent and exceeding strong.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व्य१॒॑क्तून्रु॑द्रा॒ व्यहा॑नि शिक्वसो॒ व्य१॒॑न्तरि॑क्षं॒ वि रजां॑सि धूतयः वि यदज्राँ॒ अज॑थ॒ नाव॑ ईं यथा॒ वि दु॒र्गाणि॑ मरुतो॒ नाह॑ रिष्यथ
verses.transliteration: vy àktū́n rudrā vy áhāni śikvaso  vy àntárikṣaṃ ví rájāṃsi dhūtayaḥ  ví yád ájrām̐ ájatha nā́va īṃ yathā  ví durgā́ṇi maruto nā́ha riṣyatha

translation.text: When, mighty Rudras, through the nights and through the days, when through the sky and realms of air, shakers of all, When over the broad fields ye drive along like ships, e'en to strongholds ye come, Maruts, but are not harmed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद्वी॒र्यं॑ वो मरुतो महित्व॒नं दी॒र्घं त॑तान॒ सूर्यो॒ न योज॑नम् एता॒ न यामे॒ अगृ॑भीतशोचि॒षोऽन॑श्वदां॒ यन्न्यया॑तना गि॒रिम्
verses.transliteration: tád vīryàṃ vo maruto mahitvanáṃ  dīrgháṃ tatāna sū́ryo ná yójanam  étā ná yā́me ágr̥bhītaśociṣaḥ-  -ánaśvadāṃ yán ny áyātanā girím

translation.text: Maruts, this hero strength and majesty of yours hath, like the Sun, extended o'er a lengthened way, When in your course like deer with splendour unsubdued ye bowed the hill that gives imperishable rain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अभ्रा॑जि॒ शर्धो॑ मरुतो॒ यद॑र्ण॒सं मोष॑था वृ॒क्षं क॑प॒नेव॑ वेधसः अध॑ स्मा नो अ॒रम॑तिं सजोषस॒श्चक्षु॑रिव॒ यन्त॒मनु॑ नेषथा सु॒गम्
verses.transliteration: ábhrāji śárdho maruto yád arṇasám  móṣathā vr̥kṣáṃ kapanéva vedhasaḥ  ádha smā no arámatiṃ sajoṣasaś  cákṣur iva yántam ánu neṣathā sugám

translation.text: Bright shone your host, ye Sages, Maruts, when ye smote the waving tree as when the worm consumeth it. Accordant, as the eye guides him who walks, have ye led our devotion onward by an easy path.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न स जी॑यते मरुतो॒ न ह॑न्यते॒ न स्रे॑धति॒ न व्य॑थते॒ न रि॑ष्यति नास्य॒ राय॒ उप॑ दस्यन्ति॒ नोतय॒ ऋषिं॑ वा॒ यं राजा॑नं वा॒ सुषू॑दथ
verses.transliteration: ná sá jīyate maruto ná hanyate  ná sredhati ná vyathate ná riṣyati  nā́sya rā́ya úpa dasyanti nótáyaḥ-  ŕ̥ṣiṃ vā yáṃ rā́jānaṃ vā súṣūdatha

translation.text: Never is he, O Maruts, slain or overcome, never doth he decay ne'er is distressed or harmed; His treasures, his resources, never waste away, whom. whether he be prince or R̥ishi, ye direct.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि॒युत्व॑न्तो ग्राम॒जितो॒ यथा॒ नरो॑ऽर्य॒मणो॒ न म॒रुतः॑ कब॒न्धिनः॑ पिन्व॒न्त्युत्सं॒ यदि॒नासो॒ अस्व॑र॒न्व्यु॑न्दन्ति पृथि॒वीं मध्वो॒ अन्ध॑सा
verses.transliteration: niyútvanto grāmajíto yáthā náro  -aryamáṇo ná marútaḥ kabandhínaḥ  pínvanty útsaṃ yád inā́so ásvaran  vy ùndanti pr̥thivī́m mádhvo ándhasā

translation.text: With harnessed team like heroes overcoming troops, the friendly Maruts, laden with their watercasks, Let the spring flow, and when impetuous' they roar they inundate the earth with floods of pleasant meath.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र॒वत्व॑ती॒यं पृ॑थि॒वी म॒रुद्भ्यः॑ प्र॒वत्व॑ती॒ द्यौर्भ॑वति प्र॒यद्भ्यः॑ प्र॒वत्व॑तीः प॒थ्या॑ अ॒न्तरि॑क्ष्याः प्र॒वत्व॑न्तः॒ पर्व॑ता जी॒रदा॑नवः
verses.transliteration: pravátvatīyám pr̥thivī́ marúdbhyaḥ  pravátvatī dyaúr bhavati prayádbhyaḥ  pravátvatīḥ pathyā̀ antárikṣyāḥ  pravátvantaḥ párvatā jīrádānavaḥ

translation.text: Free for the Maruts is the earth with sloping ways, free for the rushing Ones is heaven with steep descents. The paths of air's mid-region are precipitous, precipitous the mountains with their running streams.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यन्म॑रुतः सभरसः स्वर्णरः॒ सूर्य॒ उदि॑ते॒ मद॑था दिवो नरः न वोऽश्वाः॑ श्रथय॒न्ताह॒ सिस्र॑तः स॒द्यो अ॒स्याध्व॑नः पा॒रम॑श्नुथ
verses.transliteration: yán marutaḥ sabharasaḥ svarṇaraḥ  sū́rya údite mádathā divo naraḥ  ná vó 'śvāḥ śrathayantā́ha sísrataḥ  sadyó asyā́dhvanaḥ pārám aśnutha

translation.text: When, as the Sun hath risen up, ye take delight, O bounteous radiant Maruts, Heroes of the sky, Your coursers weary not when speeding on.their way, and rapidly ye reach the end of this your path.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अंसे॑षु व ऋ॒ष्टयः॑ प॒त्सु खा॒दयो॒ वक्षः॑सु रु॒क्मा म॑रुतो॒ रथे॒ शुभः॑ अ॒ग्निभ्रा॑जसो वि॒द्युतो॒ गभ॑स्त्योः॒ शिप्राः॑ शी॒र्षसु॒ वित॑ता हिर॒ण्ययीः॑
verses.transliteration: áṃseṣu va r̥ṣṭáyaḥ patsú khādáyo  vákṣassu rukmā́ maruto ráthe śúbhaḥ  agníbhrājaso vidyúto gábhastyoḥ  śíprāḥ śīrṣásu vítatā hiraṇyáyīḥ

translation.text: Lances are on your shoulders, anklets on your feet, gold chains are on your breasts, gems, Maruts, on your car. Lightnings aglow with flame are flashing in your hands, and visors wroughtof gold are laid upon your heads.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं नाक॑म॒र्यो अगृ॑भीतशोचिषं॒ रुश॒त्पिप्प॑लं मरुतो॒ वि धू॑नुथ सम॑च्यन्त वृ॒जनाति॑त्विषन्त॒ यत्स्वर॑न्ति॒ घोषं॒ वित॑तमृता॒यवः॑
verses.transliteration: táṃ nā́kam aryó ágr̥bhītaśociṣaṃ  rúśat píppalam maruto ví dhūnutha  sám acyanta vr̥jánā́titviṣanta yát  sváranti ghóṣaṃ vítatam r̥tāyávaḥ

translation.text: Maruts, in eager stir ye shake the vault of heaven, splendid beyond conception, for its shining fruit. They gathered when they let their deeds of might flash forth. The Pious Ones send forth a farresounding shout.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒ष्माद॑त्तस्य मरुतो विचेतसो रा॒यः स्या॑म र॒थ्यो॒३॒॑ वय॑स्वतः न यो युच्छ॑ति ति॒ष्यो॒३॒॑ यथा॑ दि॒वो॒३॒॑ऽस्मे रा॑रन्त मरुतः सह॒स्रिण॑म्
verses.transliteration: yuṣmā́dattasya maruto vicetaso  rāyáḥ syāma rathyò váyasvataḥ  ná yó yúchati tiṣyò yáthā diváḥ-  -asmé rāranta marutaḥ sahasríṇam

translation.text: Sage Maruts, may we be the drivers of the car of riches ful I of life that have been given by you. O Maruts, let that wealth in thousands dwell with us which never vanishes like Tisya from the sky.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यू॒यं र॒यिं म॑रुतः स्पा॒र्हवी॑रं यू॒यमृषि॑मवथ॒ साम॑विप्रम् यू॒यमर्व॑न्तं भर॒ताय॒ वाजं॑ यू॒यं ध॑त्थ॒ राजा॑नं श्रुष्टि॒मन्त॑म्
verses.transliteration: yūyáṃ rayím maruta spārhávīraṃ  yūyám ŕ̥ṣim avatha sā́mavipram  yūyám árvantam bharatā́ya vā́jaṃ  yūyáṃ dhattha rā́jānaṃ śruṣṭimántam

translation.text: Maruts, ye further wealth with longedfor heroes, further the R̥ishi skilled in chanted verses. Ye give the Bharata as his strength, a charger, and ye bestow a king who quickly listens.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तद्वो॑ यामि॒ द्रवि॑णं सद्यऊतयो॒ येना॒ स्व१॒॑र्ण त॒तना॑म॒ नॄँर॒भि इ॒दं सु मे॑ मरुतो हर्यता॒ वचो॒ यस्य॒ तरे॑म॒ तर॑सा श॒तं हिमाः॑
verses.transliteration: tád vo yāmi dráviṇaṃ sadyaūtayo  yénā svàr ṇá tatánāma nr̥̄́m̐r abhí  idáṃ sú me maruto haryatā váco  yásya tárema tárasā śatáṃ hímāḥ

translation.text: Of you, most swift to succour! I solicit wealth wherewith we may spread forth mid men like as the Sun. Accept, O Maruts, graciously this hymn of mine that we may live a hundred winters through its power.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रय॑ज्यवो म॒रुतो॒ भ्राज॑दृष्टयो बृ॒हद्वयो॑ दधिरे रु॒क्मव॑क्षसः ईय॑न्ते॒ अश्वैः॑ सु॒यमे॑भिरा॒शुभिः॒ शुभं॑ या॒तामनु॒ रथा॑ अवृत्सत
verses.transliteration: práyajyavo marúto bhrā́jadr̥ṣṭayo  br̥hád váyo dadhire rukmávakṣasaḥ  ī́yante áśvaiḥ suyámebhir āśúbhiḥ  śúbhaṃ yātā́m ánu ráthā avr̥tsata

translation.text: WITH gleaming lances, with their breasts adorned with gold, the Maruts, rushing onward, hold high power of life. They hasten with swift steeds easy to be controlled. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒यं द॑धिध्वे॒ तवि॑षीं॒ यथा॑ वि॒द बृ॒हन्म॑हान्त उर्वि॒या वि रा॑जथ उ॒तान्तरि॑क्षं ममिरे॒ व्योज॑सा॒ शुभं॑ या॒तामनु॒ रथा॑ अवृत्सत
verses.transliteration: svayáṃ dadhidhve táviṣīṃ yáthā vidá  br̥hán mahānta urviyā́ ví rājatha  utā́ntárikṣam mamire vy ójasā  śúbhaṃ yātā́m ánu ráthā avr̥tsata

translation.text: Ye, as ye wist, have gained of your own selves your power: high, O ye Mighty Ones, and wide ye shine abroad. They with their strength have even measured out the sky. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सा॒कं जा॒ताः सु॒भ्वः॑ सा॒कमु॑क्षि॒ताः श्रि॒ये चि॒दा प्र॑त॒रं वा॑वृधु॒र्नरः॑ वि॒रो॒किणः॒ सूर्य॑स्येव र॒श्मयः॒ शुभं॑ या॒तामनु॒ रथा॑ अवृत्सत
verses.transliteration: sākáṃ jātā́ḥ subhvàḥ sākám ukṣitā́ḥ  śriyé cid ā́ prataráṃ vāvr̥dhur náraḥ  virokíṇaḥ sū́ryasyeva raśmáyaḥ  śúbhaṃ yātā́m ánu ráthā avr̥tsata

translation.text: Strong, born together, they together have waxed great: the Heroes more and more have grown to majesty Resplendent as the Sun's beams in their light are they. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ॒भू॒षेण्यं॑ वो मरुतो महित्व॒नं दि॑दृ॒क्षेण्यं॒ सूर्य॑स्येव॒ चक्ष॑णम् उ॒तो अ॒स्माँ अ॑मृत॒त्वे द॑धातन॒ शुभं॑ या॒तामनु॒ रथा॑ अवृत्सत
verses.transliteration: ābhūṣéṇyaṃ vo maruto mahitvanáṃ  didr̥kṣéṇyaṃ sū́ryasyeva cákṣaṇam  utó asmā́m̐ amr̥tatvé dadhātana  śúbhaṃ yātā́m ánu ráthā avr̥tsata

translation.text: Maruts, your mightiness deserves to be adored, sight to be longed for like the shining of the Sun. So lead us with your aid to immortality. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उदी॑रयथा मरुतः समुद्र॒तो यू॒यं वृ॒ष्टिं व॑र्षयथा पुरीषिणः न वो॑ दस्रा॒ उप॑ दस्यन्ति धे॒नवः॒ शुभं॑ या॒तामनु॒ रथा॑ अवृत्सत
verses.transliteration: úd īrayathā marutaḥ samudrató  yūyáṃ vr̥ṣṭíṃ varṣayathā purīṣiṇaḥ  ná vo dasrā úpa dasyanti dhenávaḥ  śúbhaṃ yātā́m ánu ráthā avr̥tsata

translation.text: O Maruts, from the Ocean ye uplift the rain, and fraught with vaporous moisture pour the torrents down. Never, ye Wonder-Workers, are your Milch-kine dry. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदश्वा॑न्धू॒र्षु पृष॑ती॒रयु॑ग्ध्वं हिर॒ण्यया॒न्प्रत्यत्काँ॒ अमु॑ग्ध्वम् विश्वा॒ इत्स्पृधो॑ मरुतो॒ व्य॑स्यथ॒ शुभं॑ या॒तामनु॒ रथा॑ अवृत्सत
verses.transliteration: yád áśvān dhūrṣú pŕ̥ṣatīr áyugdhvaṃ  hiraṇyáyān práty átkām̐ ámugdhvam  víśvā ít spŕ̥dho maruto vy àsyatha  śúbhaṃ yātā́m ánu ráthā avr̥tsata

translation.text: When to your car-poles ye have yoked your spotted deer to be your steeds, and put your golden mantles on, O Maruts, ye disperse all enemies abroad. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न पर्व॑ता॒ न न॒द्यो॑ वरन्त वो॒ यत्राचि॑ध्वं मरुतो॒ गच्छ॒थेदु॒ तत् उ॒त द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी या॑थना॒ परि॒ शुभं॑ या॒तामनु॒ रथा॑ अवृत्सत
verses.transliteration: ná párvatā ná nadyò varanta vo  yátrā́cidhvam maruto gáchathéd u tát  utá dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ yāthanā pári  śúbhaṃ yātā́m ánu ráthā avr̥tsata

translation.text: Neither the mountains nor the rivers keep you back: whither ye have resolved thither ye, Maruts, go. Ye compass round about even the heaven and earth. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory. Whate'er is ancient, Maruts, what of recent time, whate'er is spoken, Vasus, what is chanted forth, They who take cognizance of all of this are ye. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्पू॒र्व्यं म॑रुतो॒ यच्च॒ नूत॑नं॒ यदु॒द्यते॑ वसवो॒ यच्च॑ श॒स्यते॑ विश्व॑स्य॒ तस्य॑ भवथा॒ नवे॑दसः॒ शुभं॑ या॒तामनु॒ रथा॑ अवृत्सत
verses.transliteration: yát pūrvyám maruto yác ca nū́tanaṃ  yád udyáte vasavo yác ca śasyáte  víśvasya tásya bhavathā návedasaḥ  śúbhaṃ yātā́m ánu ráthā avr̥tsata

translation.text: Whate'er is ancient, Maruts, what of recent time, whate'er is spoken, Vasus, what is chanted forth, They who take cognizance of all of this are ye. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मृ॒ळत॑ नो मरुतो॒ मा व॑धिष्टना॒स्मभ्यं॒ शर्म॑ बहु॒लं वि य॑न्तन अधि॑ स्तो॒त्रस्य॑ स॒ख्यस्य॑ गातन॒ शुभं॑ या॒तामनु॒ रथा॑ अवृत्सत
verses.transliteration: mr̥ḷáta no maruto mā́ vadhiṣṭana-  -asmábhyaṃ śárma bahuláṃ ví yantana  ádhi stotrásya sakhyásya gātana  śúbhaṃ yātā́m ánu ráthā avr̥tsata

translation.text: Be gracious unto us, ye Maruts, slay us not extend ye unto us shelter of many a sort. Pay due regard unto our friendship and our praise. Their cars moved onward as they went to victory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यू॒यम॒स्मान्न॑यत॒ वस्यो॒ अच्छा॒ निरं॑ह॒तिभ्यो॑ मरुतो गृणा॒नाः जु॒षध्वं॑ नो ह॒व्यदा॑तिं यजत्रा व॒यं स्या॑म॒ पत॑यो रयी॒णाम्
verses.transliteration: yūyám asmā́n nayata vásyo áchā  nír aṃhatíbhyo maruto gr̥ṇānā́ḥ  juṣádhvaṃ no havyádātiṃ yajatrāḥ-  vayáṃ syāma pátayo rayīṇā́m

translation.text: O Maruts, lead us on to higher fortune deliver us, when lauded, from afflictions. Accept, ye Holy Ones, the gifts we bring you. May we be masters of abundant riches.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॒ शर्ध॑न्त॒मा ग॒णं पि॒ष्टं रु॒क्मेभि॑र॒ञ्जिभिः॑ विशो॑ अ॒द्य म॒रुता॒मव॑ ह्वये दि॒वश्चि॑द्रोच॒नादधि॑
verses.transliteration: ágne śárdhantam ā́ gaṇám  piṣṭáṃ rukmébhir añjíbhiḥ  víśo adyá marútām áva hvaye  diváś cid rocanā́d ádhi

translation.text: AGNI, that valorous company adorned with ornaments of gold, The people of the Maruts, I call down to-day even from the luminous realm of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथा॑ चि॒न्मन्य॑से हृ॒दा तदिन्मे॑ जग्मुरा॒शसः॑ ये ते॒ नेदि॑ष्ठं॒ हव॑नान्या॒गम॒न्तान्व॑र्ध भी॒मसं॑दृशः
verses.transliteration: yáthā cin mányase hr̥dā́  tád ín me jagmur āśásaḥ  yé te nédiṣṭhaṃ hávanāny āgáman  tā́n vardha bhīmásaṃdr̥śaḥ

translation.text: Even as thou thinkest in thy heart, thither my wishes also tend. Those who have come most near to thine invoking calls, strengthen them fearful to behold.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मी॒ळ्हुष्म॑तीव पृथि॒वी परा॑हता॒ मद॑न्त्येत्य॒स्मदा ऋक्षो॒ न वो॑ मरुतः॒ शिमी॑वाँ॒ अमो॑ दु॒ध्रो गौरि॑व भीम॒युः
verses.transliteration: mīḷhúṣmatīva pr̥thivī́ párāhatā  mádanty ety asmád ā́  ŕ̥kṣo ná vo marutaḥ śímīvām̐ ámo  dudhró gaúr iva bhīmayúḥ

translation.text: Earth, like a bounteous lady, liberal of her gifts, struck down and shaken, yet exultant, comes to us. Impetuous as a bear, O Maruts, is youi rush terrible as a dreadful bull..

verses.sanskrit_deva: नि ये रि॒णन्त्योज॑सा॒ वृथा॒ गावो॒ न दु॒र्धुरः॑ अश्मा॑नं चित्स्व॒र्यं१॒॑ पर्व॑तं गि॒रिं प्र च्या॑वयन्ति॒ याम॑भिः
verses.transliteration: ní yé riṇánty ójasā  vŕ̥thā gā́vo ná durdhúraḥ  áśmānaṃ cit svaryàm párvataṃ girím  prá cyāvayanti yā́mabhiḥ

translation.text: They who with mighty strength o'erthrow like oxen difficult to yoke, Cause e'en the heavenly stone to shake ' yea, shake the rocky mountain as they race along.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उत्ति॑ष्ठ नू॒नमे॑षां॒ स्तोमैः॒ समु॑क्षितानाम् म॒रुतां॑ पुरु॒तम॒मपू॑र्व्यं॒ गवां॒ सर्ग॑मिव ह्वये
verses.transliteration: út tiṣṭha nūnám eṣāṃ  stómaiḥ sámukṣitānām  marútām purutámam ápūrvyaṃ  gávāṃ sárgam iva hvaye

translation.text: Rise up! even now with lauds I call the very numerous company, Unequalled, of these Maruts, like a herd of kine, grown up together in their strength.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒ङ्ग्ध्वं ह्यरु॑षी॒ रथे॑ यु॒ङ्ग्ध्वं रथे॑षु रो॒हितः॑ यु॒ङ्ग्ध्वं हरी॑ अजि॒रा धु॒रि वोळ्ह॑वे॒ वहि॑ष्ठा धु॒रि वोळ्ह॑वे
verses.transliteration: yuṅgdhváṃ hy áruṣī ráthe  yuṅgdhváṃ rátheṣu rohítaḥ  yuṅgdhváṃ hárī ajirā́ dhurí vóḷhave  váhiṣṭhā dhurí vóḷhave

translation.text: Bind to your car the bright red mares, yoke the red coursers to your car. Bind to the pole, to draw, the fleet-foot tawny steeds, the best at drawing, to the pole.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त स्य वा॒ज्य॑रु॒षस्तु॑वि॒ष्वणि॑रि॒ह स्म॑ धायि दर्श॒तः मा वो॒ यामे॑षु मरुतश्चि॒रं क॑र॒त्प्र तं रथे॑षु चोदत
verses.transliteration: utá syá vājy àruṣás tuviṣváṇir  ihá sma dhāyi darśatáḥ  mā́ vo yā́meṣu marutaś ciráṃ karat  prá táṃ rátheṣu codata

translation.text: Yea, and this loudly-neighing bright red vigorous horse who hath been sutioned, fair to see, Let him not cause delay, O Maruts,, in your course, urge ye him onward in your cars.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रथं॒ नु मारु॑तं व॒यं श्र॑व॒स्युमा हु॑वामहे आ यस्मि॑न्त॒स्थौ सु॒रणा॑नि॒ बिभ्र॑ती॒ सचा॑ म॒रुत्सु॑ रोद॒सी
verses.transliteration: ráthaṃ nú mā́rutaṃ vayáṃ  śravasyúm ā́ huvāmahe  ā́ yásmin tasthaú suráṇāni bíbhratī  sácā marútsu rodasī́

translation.text: The Maruts' chariot, ever fain to gather glory, we invoke, Which Rodasî hath mounted, bringing pleasant gifts, with Maruts in her company.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तं वः॒ शर्धं॑ रथे॒शुभं॑ त्वे॒षं प॑न॒स्युमा हु॑वे यस्मि॒न्त्सुजा॑ता सु॒भगा॑ मही॒यते॒ सचा॑ म॒रुत्सु॑ मीळ्हु॒षी
verses.transliteration: táṃ vaḥ śárdhaṃ ratheśúbhaṃ  tveṣám panasyúm ā́ huve  yásmin sújātā subhágā mahīyáte  sácā marútsu mīḷhuṣī́

translation.text: I call that brilliant band of yours, adorable, rapid on the car Whereon the bounteous Dame, auspicious, nobly born, shows glorious with the Marut host.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ रु॑द्रास॒ इन्द्र॑वन्तः स॒जोष॑सो॒ हिर॑ण्यरथाः सुवि॒ताय॑ गन्तन इ॒यं वो॑ अ॒स्मत्प्रति॑ हर्यते म॒तिस्तृ॒ष्णजे॒ न दि॒व उत्सा॑ उद॒न्यवे॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ rudrāsa índravantaḥ sajóṣaso  híraṇyarathāḥ suvitā́ya gantana  iyáṃ vo asmát práti haryate matís  tr̥ṣṇáje ná divá útsā udanyáve

translation.text: OF one accord, with Indra, O ye Rudras, come borne on your golden car for our prosperity. An offering from us, this hymn is brought to you, as, unto one who th irsts for water, heavenly springs.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वाशी॑मन्त ऋष्टि॒मन्तो॑ मनी॒षिणः॑ सु॒धन्वा॑न॒ इषु॑मन्तो निष॒ङ्गिणः॑ स्वश्वाः॑ स्थ सु॒रथाः॑ पृश्निमातरः स्वायु॒धा म॑रुतो याथना॒ शुभ॑म्
verses.transliteration: vā́śīmanta r̥ṣṭimánto manīṣíṇaḥ  sudhánvāna íṣumanto niṣaṅgíṇaḥ  sváśvā stha suráthāḥ pr̥śnimātaraḥ  svāyudhā́ maruto yāthanā śúbham

translation.text: Armed with your daggers, full of wisdom, armed with spears, armed with your quivers, armed with arrows, with good bows, Good horses and good cars have ye, O Pr̥iṣni's Sons: ye, Maruts, with good weapons go to victory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धू॒नु॒थ द्यां पर्व॑तान्दा॒शुषे॒ वसु॒ नि वो॒ वना॑ जिहते॒ याम॑नो भि॒या को॒पय॑थ पृथि॒वीं पृ॑श्निमातरः शु॒भे यदु॑ग्राः॒ पृष॑ती॒रयु॑ग्ध्वम्
verses.transliteration: dhūnuthá dyā́m párvatān dāśúṣe vásu  ní vo vánā jihate yā́mano bhiyā́  kopáyatha pr̥thivī́m pr̥śnimātaraḥ  śubhé yád ugrāḥ pŕ̥ṣatīr áyugdhvam

translation.text: From hills and heaven ye shake wealth for the worshipper: in terror at your coming low the woods bow down. Ye make the earth to tremble, Sons of Pr̥iṣni, when for victory ye have yoked, fierce Ones! your spotted deer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वात॑त्विषो म॒रुतो॑ व॒र्षनि॑र्णिजो य॒मा इ॑व॒ सुस॑दृशः सु॒पेश॑सः पि॒शङ्गा॑श्वा अरु॒णाश्वा॑ अरे॒पसः॒ प्रत्व॑क्षसो महि॒ना द्यौरि॑वो॒रवः॑
verses.transliteration: vā́tatviṣo marúto varṣánirṇijo  yamā́ iva súsadr̥śaḥ supéśasaḥ  piśáṅgāśvā aruṇā́śvā arepásaḥ  prátvakṣaso mahinā́ dyaúr ivorávaḥ

translation.text: Bright with the blasts of wind, wrapped in their robes of rain, like twins of noble aspect and of lovely form, The Maruts, spotless, with steeds tawnyhued and red, strong in their mightiness and spreading wide like heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रु॒द्र॒प्सा अ॑ञ्जि॒मन्तः॑ सु॒दान॑वस्त्वे॒षसं॑दृशो अनव॒भ्ररा॑धसः सु॒जा॒तासो॑ ज॒नुषा॑ रु॒क्मव॑क्षसो दि॒वो अ॒र्का अ॒मृतं॒ नाम॑ भेजिरे
verses.transliteration: purudrapsā́ añjimántaḥ sudā́navas  tveṣásaṃdr̥śo anavabhrárādhasaḥ  sujātā́so janúṣā rukmávakṣaso  divó arkā́ amŕ̥taṃ nā́ma bhejire

translation.text: Rich in adornment, rich in drops, munificent, bright in their aspect, yielding bounties that endure, Noble by birth, adorned with gold upon their breasts, the Singers of the sky have won immortal fame.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒ष्टयो॑ वो मरुतो॒ अंस॑यो॒रधि॒ सह॒ ओजो॑ बा॒ह्वोर्वो॒ बलं॑ हि॒तम् नृ॒म्णा शी॒र्षस्वायु॑धा॒ रथे॑षु वो॒ विश्वा॑ वः॒ श्रीरधि॑ त॒नूषु॑ पिपिशे
verses.transliteration: r̥ṣṭáyo vo maruto áṃsayor ádhi  sáha ójo bāhvór vo bálaṃ hitám  nr̥mṇā́ śīrṣásv ā́yudhā rátheṣu vo  víśvā vaḥ śrī́r ádhi tanū́ṣu pipiśe

translation.text: Borne on both shoulders, O ye Maruts, are your spears: within your arms is laid your energy and

verses.sanskrit_deva: गोम॒दश्वा॑व॒द्रथ॑वत्सु॒वीरं॑ च॒न्द्रव॒द्राधो॑ मरुतो ददा नः प्रश॑स्तिं नः कृणुत रुद्रियासो भक्षी॒य वोऽव॑सो॒ दैव्य॑स्य
verses.transliteration: gómad áśvāvad ráthavat suvī́raṃ  candrávad rā́dho maruto dadā naḥ  práśastiṃ naḥ kr̥ṇuta rudriyāso  bhakṣīyá vó 'vaso daívyasya

translation.text: Vouchsafe to us, O Maruts, splendid bounty in cattle and in steeds, in cars and heroes. Children of Rudra, give us high distinction: may I enjoy your Godlike help and favour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ह॒ये नरो॒ मरु॑तो मृ॒ळता॑ न॒स्तुवी॑मघासो॒ अमृ॑ता॒ ऋत॑ज्ञाः सत्य॑श्रुतः॒ कव॑यो॒ युवा॑नो॒ बृह॑द्गिरयो बृ॒हदु॒क्षमा॑णाः
verses.transliteration: hayé náro máruto mr̥ḷátā nas  túvīmaghāso ámr̥tā ŕ̥tajñāḥ  sátyaśrutaḥ kávayo yúvāno  bŕ̥hadgirayo br̥hád ukṣámāṇāḥ

translation.text: Ho! Maruts, Heroes, skilled in Law, immortal, be gracious unto us, ye rich in treasures, Ye hearers of the truth, ye sage and youthful, grown mighty, dwelling on the lofty mountains.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तमु॑ नू॒नं तवि॑षीमन्तमेषां स्तु॒षे ग॒णं मारु॑तं॒ नव्य॑सीनाम् य आ॒श्व॑श्वा॒ अम॑व॒द्वह॑न्त उ॒तेशि॑रे अ॒मृत॑स्य स्व॒राजः॑
verses.transliteration: tám u nūnáṃ táviṣīmantam eṣāṃ  stuṣé gaṇám mā́rutaṃ návyasīnām  yá āśvàśvā ámavad váhante-  utéśire amŕ̥tasya svarā́jaḥ

translation.text: Now do I glorify their mighty cohort, the company of these the youthful Maruts, Who ride impetuous on with rapid horses, and radiant in themselves, are Lords of Amrit.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्वे॒षं ग॒णं त॒वसं॒ खादि॑हस्तं॒ धुनि॑व्रतं मा॒यिनं॒ दाति॑वारम् म॒यो॒भुवो॒ ये अमि॑ता महि॒त्वा वन्द॑स्व विप्र तुवि॒राध॑सो॒ नॄन्
verses.transliteration: tveṣáṃ gaṇáṃ tavásaṃ khā́dihastaṃ  dhúnivratam māyínaṃ dā́tivāram  mayobhúvo yé ámitā mahitvā́  vándasva vipra tuvirā́dhaso nr̥̄́n

translation.text: The mighty glittering band, arm-bound with bracelets, givers of bliss, unmeasured in their greatness, With magical powers, bountiful, ever-roaring,– these, liberal Heroes, venerate thou singer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वो॑ यन्तूदवा॒हासो॑ अ॒द्य वृ॒ष्टिं ये विश्वे॑ म॒रुतो॑ जु॒नन्ति॑ अ॒यं यो अ॒ग्निर्म॑रुतः॒ समि॑द्ध ए॒तं जु॑षध्वं कवयो युवानः
verses.transliteration: ā́ vo yantūdavāhā́so adyá  vr̥ṣṭíṃ yé víśve marúto junánti  ayáṃ yó agnír marutaḥ sámiddhaḥ-  etáṃ juṣadhvaṃ kavayo yuvānaḥ

translation.text: This day may all your water-bringers, Maruts, they who impel the falling rain, approach us. This fire, O Maruts, hath been duly kindled; let it find favour with you, youthful Sages.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यू॒यं राजा॑न॒मिर्यं॒ जना॑य विभ्वत॒ष्टं ज॑नयथा यजत्राः यु॒ष्मदे॑ति मुष्टि॒हा बा॒हुजू॑तो यु॒ष्मत्सद॑श्वो मरुतः सु॒वीरः॑
verses.transliteration: yūyáṃ rā́jānam íryaṃ jánāya  vibhvataṣṭáṃ janayathā yajatrāḥ  yuṣmád eti muṣṭihā́ bāhújūto  yuṣmád sádaśvo marutaḥ suvī́raḥ

translation.text: Ye raise up for the folk an active ruler whom, Holy Ones! a Master's hand hath fashioned. Ye send the fighter hand to hand, armmighty, and the brave hero, Maruts with good horses.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒रा इ॒वेदच॑रमा॒ अहे॑व॒ प्रप्र॑ जायन्ते॒ अक॑वा॒ महो॑भिः पृश्नेः॑ पु॒त्रा उ॑प॒मासो॒ रभि॑ष्ठाः॒ स्वया॑ म॒त्या म॒रुतः॒ सं मि॑मिक्षुः
verses.transliteration: arā́ ivéd ácaramā áheva  prá-pra jāyante ákavā máhobhiḥ  pŕ̥śneḥ putrā́ upamā́so rábhiṣṭhāḥ  sváyā matyā́ marútaḥ sám mimikṣuḥ

translation.text: They spring forth more and more, strong in their glories, like days, like spokes where none are last in order. Highest and mightiest are the Sons of Pr̥iṣni. Firm to their own intention cling the Maruts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्प्राया॑सिष्ट॒ पृष॑तीभि॒रश्वै॑र्वीळुप॒विभि॑र्मरुतो॒ रथे॑भिः क्षोद॑न्त॒ आपो॑ रिण॒ते वना॒न्यवो॒स्रियो॑ वृष॒भः क्र॑न्दतु॒ द्यौः
verses.transliteration: yát prā́yāsiṣṭa pŕ̥ṣatībhir áśvair  vīḷupavíbhir maruto ráthebhiḥ  kṣódanta ā́po riṇaté vánāni-  ávosríyo vr̥ṣabháḥ krandatu dyaúḥ

translation.text: When ye have hastened on with spotted coursers, O Maruts, on your cars with strong-wrought fellies, The waters are disturbed, the woods are shattered. Let Dyaus the Red Steer send his thunder downward.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रथि॑ष्ट॒ याम॑न्पृथि॒वी चि॑देषां॒ भर्ते॑व॒ गर्भं॒ स्वमिच्छवो॑ धुः वाता॒न्ह्यश्वा॑न्धु॒र्या॑युयु॒ज्रे व॒र्षं स्वेदं॑ चक्रिरे रु॒द्रिया॑सः
verses.transliteration: práthiṣṭa yā́man pr̥thivī́ cid eṣām  bhárteva gárbhaṃ svám íc chávo dhuḥ  vā́tān hy áśvān dhury ā̀yuyujré  varṣáṃ svédaṃ cakrire rudríyāsaḥ

translation.text: Even Earth hath spread herself wide at their coming, and they as husbands have with power impregned her. They to the pole have yoked the winds for coursers: their sweat have they made rain, these Sons of Rudra.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ह॒ये नरो॒ मरु॑तो मृ॒ळता॑ न॒स्तुवी॑मघासो॒ अमृ॑ता॒ ऋत॑ज्ञाः सत्य॑श्रुतः॒ कव॑यो॒ युवा॑नो॒ बृह॑द्गिरयो बृ॒हदु॒क्षमा॑णाः
verses.transliteration: hayé náro máruto mr̥ḷátā nas  túvīmaghāso ámr̥tā ŕ̥tajñāḥ  sátyaśrutaḥ kávayo yúvāno  bŕ̥hadgirayo br̥hád ukṣámāṇāḥ

translation.text: Ho! Maruts, Heroes, skilled in Law, immortal, be gracious unto us, ye rich in treasures, Ye hearers of the truth, ye sage and youthful, grown mighty, dwelling on the lofty mountains.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वः॒ स्पळ॑क्रन्त्सुवि॒ताय॑ दा॒वनेऽर्चा॑ दि॒वे प्र पृ॑थि॒व्या ऋ॒तं भ॑रे उ॒क्षन्ते॒ अश्वा॒न्तरु॑षन्त॒ आ रजोऽनु॒ स्वं भा॒नुं श्र॑थयन्ते अर्ण॒वैः
verses.transliteration: prá va spáḷ akran suvitā́ya dāváne-  -árcā divé prá pr̥thivyā́ r̥tám bhare  ukṣánte áśvān táruṣanta ā́ rájaḥ-  -ánu svám bhānúṃ śrathayante arṇavaíḥ

translation.text: YOUR spy hath called to you to give prosperity. I sing to Heaven and Earth and offer sacrifice. They bathe their steeds and hasten through the firmament: they spread abroad their radiance through the sea of cloud.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अमा॑देषां भि॒यसा॒ भूमि॑रेजति॒ नौर्न पू॒र्णा क्ष॑रति॒ व्यथि॑र्य॒ती दू॒रे॒दृशो॒ ये चि॒तय॑न्त॒ एम॑भिर॒न्तर्म॒हे वि॒दथे॑ येतिरे॒ नरः॑
verses.transliteration: ámād eṣām bhiyásā bhū́mir ejati  naúr ná pūrṇā́ kṣarati vyáthir yatī́  dūredŕ̥śo yé citáyanta émabhir  antár mahé vidáthe yetire náraḥ

translation.text: Earth shakes and reels in terror at their onward rush, like a full ship which, quivering, lets the water in. Marked on their ways are they, visible from afar: the Heroes press between in mighty armament.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गवा॑मिव श्रि॒यसे॒ शृङ्ग॑मुत्त॒मं सूर्यो॒ न चक्षू॒ रज॑सो वि॒सर्ज॑ने अत्या॑ इव सु॒भ्व१॒॑श्चार॑वः स्थन॒ मर्या॑ इव श्रि॒यसे॑ चेतथा नरः
verses.transliteration: gávām iva śriyáse śŕ̥ṅgam uttamáṃ  sū́ryo ná cákṣū rájaso visárjane  átyā iva subhvàś cā́rava sthana  máryā iva śriyáse cetathā naraḥ
