translation.text: As the exalted horn of bulls for splendid might, as the Sun's eye set in the firmament's expanse, Like vigorous horses ye are beauteous to behold, and for your glory show like bridegrooms, O ye Men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: को वो॑ म॒हान्ति॑ मह॒तामुद॑श्नव॒त्कस्काव्या॑ मरुतः॒ को ह॒ पौंस्या॑ यू॒यं ह॒ भूमिं॑ कि॒रणं॒ न रे॑जथ॒ प्र यद्भर॑ध्वे सुवि॒ताय॑ दा॒वने॑
verses.transliteration: kó vo mahā́nti mahatā́m úd aśnavat  kás kā́vyā marutaḥ kó ha paúṃsyā  yūyáṃ ha bhū́miṃ kiráṇaṃ ná rejatha  prá yád bháradhve suvitā́ya dāváne

translation.text: Who, O ye Maruts, may attain the mighty lore of you the mighty, who may reach your manly deeds? Ye, verily, make earth tremble like a ray of light what time ye bring your boons to give prosperity,

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वा॑ इ॒वेद॑रु॒षासः॒ सब॑न्धवः॒ शूरा॑ इव प्र॒युधः॒ प्रोत यु॑युधुः मर्या॑ इव सु॒वृधो॑ वावृधु॒र्नरः॒ सूर्य॑स्य॒ चक्षुः॒ प्र मि॑नन्ति वृ॒ष्टिभिः॑
verses.transliteration: áśvā ivéd aruṣā́saḥ sábandhavaḥ  śū́rā iva prayúdhaḥ prótá yuyudhuḥ  máryā iva suvŕ̥dho vāvr̥dhur náraḥ  sū́ryasya cákṣuḥ prá minanti vr̥ṣṭíbhiḥ

translation.text: Like steeds of ruddy colour, scions of one race, as foremost champions they have battled in the van. The Heroes have waxed strong like well-grown manly youths; with floods of rain they make the Sun's eye fade away,

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते अ॑ज्ये॒ष्ठा अक॑निष्ठास उ॒द्भिदोऽम॑ध्यमासो॒ मह॑सा॒ वि वा॑वृधुः सु॒जा॒तासो॑ ज॒नुषा॒ पृश्नि॑मातरो दि॒वो मर्या॒ आ नो॒ अच्छा॑ जिगातन
verses.transliteration: té ajyeṣṭhā́ ákaniṣṭhāsa udbhídaḥ-  -ámadhyamāso máhasā ví vāvr̥dhuḥ  sujātā́so janúṣā pŕ̥śnimātaro  divó máryā ā́ no áchā jigātana

translation.text: Having no eldest and no youngest in their band, no middlemost, preeminent they have waxed in might, These Sons of Pr̥iṣni, sprung of noble ancestry: come hitherward to us, ye bridegrooms of the sky.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वयो॒ न ये श्रेणीः॑ प॒प्तुरोज॒सान्ता॑न्दि॒वो बृ॑ह॒तः सानु॑न॒स्परि॑ अश्वा॑स एषामु॒भये॒ यथा॑ वि॒दुः प्र पर्व॑तस्य नभ॒नूँर॑चुच्यवुः
verses.transliteration: váyo ná yé śréṇīḥ paptúr ójasā-  -ántān divó br̥hatáḥ sā́nunas pári  áśvāsa eṣām ubháye yáthā vidúḥ  prá párvatasya nabhanū́m̐r acucyavuḥ

translation.text: Like birds of air they flew with might in lengthened lines from heaven's high ridges to the borders of the sky. The steeds who carry them, as Gods and mortals know, have caused the waters of the mounuains to desGend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मिमा॑तु॒ द्यौरदि॑तिर्वी॒तये॑ नः॒ सं दानु॑चित्रा उ॒षसो॑ यतन्ताम् आचु॑च्यवुर्दि॒व्यं कोश॑मे॒त ऋषे॑ रु॒द्रस्य॑ म॒रुतो॑ गृणा॒नाः
verses.transliteration: mímātu dyaúr áditir vītáye naḥ  sáṃ dā́nucitrā uṣáso yatantām  ā́cucyavur divyáṃ kóśam eté  ŕ̥ṣe rudrásya marúto gr̥ṇānā́ḥ

translation.text: May Dyaus, the Infinite, roar for our banquet: may Dawns toil for us, glittering with moisture. Lauded by thee, these Maruts, Sons o Rudra, O R̥ishi, have sent down the heavenly treasure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ईळे॑ अ॒ग्निं स्वव॑सं॒ नमो॑भिरि॒ह प्र॑स॒त्तो वि च॑यत्कृ॒तं नः॑ रथै॑रिव॒ प्र भ॑रे वाज॒यद्भिः॑ प्रदक्षि॒णिन्म॒रुतां॒ स्तोम॑मृध्याम्
verses.transliteration: ī́ḷe agníṃ svávasaṃ námobhir  ihá prasattó ví cayat kr̥táṃ naḥ  ráthair iva prá bhare vājayádbhiḥ  pradakṣiṇín marútāṃ stómam r̥dhyām

translation.text: I LAUD with reverence the gracious Agni: here may he sit and part our meed among us. As with spoil-seeking cars I bring oblation: turned rightward I will swell the Marut's, praise-song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ ये त॒स्थुः पृष॑तीषु श्रु॒तासु॑ सु॒खेषु॑ रु॒द्रा म॒रुतो॒ रथे॑षु वना॑ चिदुग्रा जिहते॒ नि वो॑ भि॒या पृ॑थि॒वी चि॑द्रेजते॒ पर्व॑तश्चित्
verses.transliteration: ā́ yé tasthúḥ pŕ̥ṣatīṣu śrutā́su  sukhéṣu rudrā́ marúto rátheṣu  vánā cid ugrā jihate ní vo bhiyā́  pr̥thivī́ cid rejate párvataś cit

translation.text: The Maruts, yea, the Rudras, who have mounted their famous spotted deer and cars swift-moving,– Before you, fierce Ones! woods bow down in terror: Earth, even the mountain, trembles at your coming.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पर्व॑तश्चि॒न्महि॑ वृ॒द्धो बि॑भाय दि॒वश्चि॒त्सानु॑ रेजत स्व॒ने वः॑ यत्क्रीळ॑थ मरुत ऋष्टि॒मन्त॒ आप॑ इव स॒ध्र्य॑ञ्चो धवध्वे
verses.transliteration: párvataś cin máhi vr̥ddhó bibhāya  diváś cit sā́nu rejata svané vaḥ  yát krī́ḷatha maruta r̥ṣṭimántaḥ-  ā́pa iva sadhryàñco dhavadhve

translation.text: Though vast and tall, the mountain is affrighted, the height of heaven is shaken at your roaring When, armed with lances, ye are sporting, Maruts, and rush along together like the waters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒रा इ॒वेद्रै॑व॒तासो॒ हिर॑ण्यैर॒भि स्व॒धाभि॑स्त॒न्वः॑ पिपिश्रे श्रि॒ये श्रेयां॑सस्त॒वसो॒ रथे॑षु स॒त्रा महां॑सि चक्रिरे त॒नूषु॑
verses.transliteration: varā́ ivéd raivatā́so híraṇyair  abhí svadhā́bhis tanvàḥ pipiśre  śriyé śréyāṃsas taváso rátheṣu  satrā́ máhāṃsi cakrire tanū́ṣu

translation.text: They, like young suitors, sons of wealthy houses, have with their golden natures decked their bodies. Strong on their cars, the lordly Ones, for glory, have set their splendours on their forms for ever.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ज्ये॒ष्ठासो॒ अक॑निष्ठास ए॒ते सं भ्रात॑रो वावृधुः॒ सौभ॑गाय युवा॑ पि॒ता स्वपा॑ रु॒द्र ए॑षां सु॒दुघा॒ पृश्निः॑ सु॒दिना॑ म॒रुद्भ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: ajyeṣṭhā́so ákaniṣṭhāsa eté  sám bhrā́taro vāvr̥dhuḥ saúbhagāya  yúvā pitā́ svápā rudrá eṣāṃ  sudúghā pŕ̥śniḥ sudínā marúdbhyaḥ

translation.text: None being eldest, none among them youngest, as brothers they have grown to happy fortune. May their Sire Rudra, young and deft, and Pr̥iṣni pouring much milk, bring fair days to the Maruts.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यदु॑त्त॒मे म॑रुतो मध्य॒मे वा॒ यद्वा॑व॒मे सु॑भगासो दि॒वि ष्ठ अतो॑ नो रुद्रा उ॒त वा॒ न्व१॒॑स्याग्ने॑ वि॒त्ताद्ध॒विषो॒ यद्यजा॑म
verses.transliteration: yád uttamé maruto madhyamé vā  yád vāvamé subhagāso diví ṣṭhá  áto no rudrā utá vā nv àsya-  -ágne vittā́d dhavíṣo yád yájāma

translation.text: Whether, O blessed Maruts, ye be dwelling in highest, midmost, or in lowest heaven, Thence, O ye Rudras, and thou also, Agni, notice the sacrificial food we offer.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒ग्निश्च॒ यन्म॑रुतो विश्ववेदसो दि॒वो वह॑ध्व॒ उत्त॑रा॒दधि॒ ष्णुभिः॑ ते म॑न्दसा॒ना धुन॑यो रिशादसो वा॒मं ध॑त्त॒ यज॑मानाय सुन्व॒ते
verses.transliteration: agníś ca yán maruto viśvavedaso  divó váhadhva úttarād ádhi ṣṇúbhiḥ  té mandasānā́ dhúnayo riśādaso  vāmáṃ dhatta yájamānāya sunvaté

translation.text: O Maruts, Lords of all, when Agni and when ye drive downward from sublimest heaven along the heights, Shakers of all, rejoicing, slayers of the foe, give riches to the Soma-pressing worshipper.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अग्ने॑ म॒रुद्भिः॑ शु॒भय॑द्भि॒र्ऋक्व॑भिः॒ सोमं॑ पिब मन्दसा॒नो ग॑ण॒श्रिभिः॑ पा॒व॒केभि॑र्विश्वमि॒न्वेभि॑रा॒युभि॒र्वैश्वा॑नर प्र॒दिवा॑ के॒तुना॑ स॒जूः
verses.transliteration: ágne marúdbhiḥ śubháyadbhir ŕ̥kvabhiḥ  sómam piba mandasānó gaṇaśríbhiḥ  pāvakébhir viśvaminvébhir āyúbhir  vaíśvānara pradívā ketúnā sajū́ḥ

translation.text: O Agni, with the Maruts as they gleam and sing, gathered in troop, rejoicing drink the Soma juice; With these the living ones who cleanse and further all, joined with thy banner, O Vaiṣvânara, from of old.

verses.sanskrit_deva: के ष्ठा॑ नरः॒ श्रेष्ठ॑तमा॒ य एक॑एक आय॒य प॒र॒मस्याः॑ परा॒वतः॑
verses.transliteration: ké ṣṭhā naraḥ śréṣṭhatamāḥ-  yá éka-eka āyayá  paramásyāḥ parāvátaḥ

translation.text: O HEROES lordliest of all, who are ye that have singly come Forth from a region most remote?

verses.sanskrit_deva: क्व१॒॑ वोऽश्वाः॒ क्वा॒३॒॑भीश॑वः क॒थं शे॑क क॒था य॑य पृ॒ष्ठे सदो॑ न॒सोर्यमः॑
verses.transliteration: kvà vó 'śvāḥ kvā̀bhī́śavaḥ  katháṃ śeka kathā́ yaya  pr̥ṣṭhé sádo nasór yámaḥ

translation.text: Where are your horses, where the reins? How came ye? how had ye the power? Rein was on nose and seat on back.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ज॒घने॒ चोद॑ एषां॒ वि स॒क्थानि॒ नरो॑ यमुः पु॒त्र॒कृ॒थे न जन॑यः
verses.transliteration: jagháne códa eṣāṃ  ví sakthā́ni náro yamuḥ  putrakr̥thé ná jánayaḥ

translation.text: The whip is laid upon the flank. The heroes stretch their thighs apart, Like women when the babe is born.

verses.sanskrit_deva: परा॑ वीरास एतन॒ मर्या॑सो॒ भद्र॑जानयः अ॒ग्नि॒तपो॒ यथास॑थ
verses.transliteration: párā vīrāsa etana  máryāso bhádrajānayaḥ  agnitápo yáthā́satha

translation.text: Go ye, O Heroes, far away, ye bridegrooms with a lovely Spouse That ye may warm you at the fire.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सन॒त्साश्व्यं॑ प॒शुमु॒त गव्यं॑ श॒ताव॑यम् श्या॒वाश्व॑स्तुताय॒ या दोर्वी॒रायो॑प॒बर्बृ॑हत्
verses.transliteration: sánat sā́śvyam paśúm  utá gávyaṃ śatā́vayam  śyāvā́śvastutāya yā́  dór vīrā́yopabárbr̥hat

translation.text: May she gain cattle for her meed, hundreds of sheep and steeds and kine, Who threw embracing arms around the hero whom gyavaiva praised.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त त्वा॒ स्त्री शशी॑यसी पुं॒सो भ॑वति॒ वस्य॑सी अदे॑वत्रादरा॒धसः॑
verses.transliteration: utá tvā strī́ śáśīyasī  puṃsó bhavati vásyasī  ádevatrād arādhásaḥ

translation.text: Yea, many a woman is more firm and better than the man who turns Away from Gods, andoffers not.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि या जा॒नाति॒ जसु॑रिं॒ वि तृष्य॑न्तं॒ वि का॒मिन॑म् दे॒व॒त्रा कृ॑णु॒ते मनः॑
verses.transliteration: ví yā́ jānā́ti jásuriṃ  ví tŕ̥ṣyantaṃ ví kāmínam  devatrā́ kr̥ṇuté mánaḥ

translation.text: She who discerns the weak and worn, the man who thirsts and is in want She sets her mind upon the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त घा॒ नेमो॒ अस्तु॑तः॒ पुमाँ॒ इति॑ ब्रुवे प॒णिः स वैर॑देय॒ इत्स॒मः
verses.transliteration: utá ghā némo ástutaḥ  púmām̐ íti bruve paṇíḥ  sá vaíradeya ít samáḥ

translation.text: And yet full many a one, unpraised, mean niggard, is entitled man: Only in weregild is he such.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त मे॑ऽरपद्युव॒तिर्म॑म॒न्दुषी॒ प्रति॑ श्या॒वाय॑ वर्त॒निम् वि रोहि॑ता पुरुमी॒ळ्हाय॑ येमतु॒र्विप्रा॑य दी॒र्घय॑शसे
verses.transliteration: utá me 'rapad yuvatír mamandúṣī  práti śyāvā́ya vartaním  ví róhitā purumīḷhā́ya yematur  víprāya dīrgháyaśase

translation.text: And she, the young, the joyous-spirited, divulged the path to Ṣyâva, yea, to me. Two red steeds carried me to Purumîḷha's side, that sage of far-extended fame,

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो मे॑ धेनू॒नां श॒तं वैद॑दश्वि॒र्यथा॒ दद॑त् त॒र॒न्त इ॑व मं॒हना॑
verses.transliteration: yó me dhenūnā́ṃ śatáṃ  vaídadaśvir yáthā dádat  tarantá iva maṃhánā

translation.text: Him who, like Vaidadaṣvi, like Taranta, hath bestowed on me A hundred cows in liberal gift.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य ईं॒ वह॑न्त आ॒शुभिः॒ पिब॑न्तो मदि॒रं मधु॑ अत्र॒ श्रवां॑सि दधिरे
verses.transliteration: yá īṃ váhanta āśúbhiḥ  píbanto madirám mádhu  átra śrávāṃsi dadhire

translation.text: They who are borne by rapid steeds, drinking the meath that gives delight, They have attained high glories here.

verses.sanskrit_deva: येषां॑ श्रि॒याधि॒ रोद॑सी वि॒भ्राज॑न्ते॒ रथे॒ष्वा दि॒वि रु॒क्म इ॑वो॒परि॑
verses.transliteration: yéṣāṃ śriyā́dhi ródasī  vibhrā́jante rátheṣv ā́  diví rukmá ivopári

translation.text: They by whose splendour both the worlds are over-spread they shine on cars As the gold gleams above in heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: युवा॒ स मारु॑तो ग॒णस्त्वे॒षर॑थो॒ अने॑द्यः शु॒भं॒यावाप्र॑तिष्कुतः
verses.transliteration: yúvā sá mā́ruto gaṇás  tveṣáratho ánedyaḥ  śubhaṃyā́vā́pratiṣkutaḥ

translation.text: That Marut band is ever young, borne on bright cars, unblamable, Moving to victory, checked by none.

verses.sanskrit_deva: को वे॑द नू॒नमे॑षां॒ यत्रा॒ मद॑न्ति॒ धूत॑यः ऋ॒तजा॑ता अरे॒पसः॑
verses.transliteration: kó veda nūnám eṣāṃ  yátrā mádanti dhū́tayaḥ  r̥tájātā arepásaḥ

translation.text: Who knoweth, verily, of these where the All-shakers take delight, Born, spotless, after sacred Law?

verses.sanskrit_deva: यू॒यं मर्तं॑ विपन्यवः प्रणे॒तार॑ इ॒त्था धि॒या श्रोता॑रो॒ याम॑हूतिषु
verses.transliteration: yūyám mártaṃ vipanyavaḥ  praṇetā́ra itthā́ dhiyā́  śrótāro yā́mahūtiṣu

translation.text: Guides are ye, lovers of the song to mortal man through holy hymn, And hearers when he cries for help.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते नो॒ वसू॑नि॒ काम्या॑ पुरुश्च॒न्द्रा रि॑शादसः आ य॑ज्ञियासो ववृत्तन
verses.transliteration: té no vásūni kā́myā  puruścandrā́ riśādasaḥ  ā́ yajñiyāso vavr̥ttana

translation.text: Do ye, destroyers of the foe, worshipful and exceeding bright, Send down the treasures that we crave.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒तं मे॒ स्तोम॑मूर्म्ये दा॒र्भ्याय॒ परा॑ वह गिरो॑ देवि र॒थीरि॑व
verses.transliteration: etám me stómam ūrmye  dārbhyā́ya párā vaha  gíro devi rathī́r iva

translation.text: OUrmya, bear thou far away to Dârbhya this my hymn of praise, Songs, Goddess, as if chariot-borne.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त मे॑ वोचता॒दिति॑ सु॒तसो॑मे॒ रथ॑वीतौ न कामो॒ अप॑ वेति मे
verses.transliteration: utá me vocatād íti  sutásome ráthavītau  ná kā́mo ápa veti me

translation.text: From me to Rathavîti say, when he hath pressed the Soma juice, The wish I had departeth not.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ष क्षे॑ति॒ रथ॑वीतिर्म॒घवा॒ गोम॑ती॒रनु॑ पर्व॑ते॒ष्वप॑श्रितः
verses.transliteration: eṣá kṣeti ráthavītir  maghávā gómatīr ánu  párvateṣv ápaśritaḥ

translation.text: This wealthy Rathavîti dwells among the people rich in kine, Among the mountains, far withdrawn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तेन॑ ऋ॒तमपि॑हितं ध्रु॒वं वां॒ सूर्य॑स्य॒ यत्र॑ विमु॒चन्त्यश्वा॑न् दश॑ श॒ता स॒ह त॑स्थु॒स्तदेकं॑ दे॒वानां॒ श्रेष्ठं॒ वपु॑षामपश्यम्
verses.transliteration: r̥téna r̥tám ápihitaṃ dhruváṃ vāṃ  sū́ryasya yátra vimucánty áśvān  dáśa śatā́ sahá tasthus tád ékaṃ  devā́nāṃ śréṣṭhaṃ vápuṣām apaśyam

translation.text: BY your high Law firm order is established there where they loose for travel Sûrya's horses. Ten hundred stood together: there I looked on this the most marvellous Deities' one chief glory.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तत्सु वां॑ मित्रावरुणा महि॒त्वमी॒र्मा त॒स्थुषी॒रह॑भिर्दुदुह्रे विश्वाः॑ पिन्वथः॒ स्वस॑रस्य॒ धेना॒ अनु॑ वा॒मेकः॑ प॒विरा व॑वर्त
verses.transliteration: tát sú vām mitrāvaruṇā mahitvám  īrmā́ tasthúṣīr áhabhir duduhre  víśvāḥ pinvathaḥ svásarasya dhénāḥ-  ánu vām ékaḥ pavír ā́ vavarta

translation.text: This, Mitra-Varuṇa, is your special greatness: floods that stood there they with the days attracted. Ye cause to flow all voices of the cowpen: your single chariotfelly hath rolled hither.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधा॑रयतं पृथि॒वीमु॒त द्यां मित्र॑राजाना वरुणा॒ महो॑भिः व॒र्धय॑त॒मोष॑धीः॒ पिन्व॑तं॒ गा अव॑ वृ॒ष्टिं सृ॑जतं जीरदानू
verses.transliteration: ádhārayatam pr̥thivī́m utá dyā́m  mítrarājānā varuṇā máhobhiḥ  vardháyatam óṣadhīḥ pínvataṃ gā́ḥ-  áva vr̥ṣṭíṃ sr̥jataṃ jīradānū

translation.text: O Mitra-Varuṇa, ye by your greatness, both Kings, have firmly stablished earth and heaven, Ye caused the cows to stream, the plants to flourish, and, scattering swift drops, sent down the rainflood.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वा॒मश्वा॑सः सु॒युजो॑ वहन्तु य॒तर॑श्मय॒ उप॑ यन्त्व॒र्वाक् घृ॒तस्य॑ नि॒र्णिगनु॑ वर्तते वा॒मुप॒ सिन्ध॑वः प्र॒दिवि॑ क्षरन्ति
verses.transliteration: ā́ vām áśvāsaḥ suyújo vahantu  yatáraśmaya úpa yantv arvā́k  ghr̥tásya nirṇíg ánu vartate vām  úpa síndhavaḥ pradívi kṣaranti

translation.text: Let your well-harnessed horses bear you hither: hitherward let them come with reins drawn tightly. A covering cloud of sacred oil attends you, and your streams flow to us from days aforetime.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अनु॑ श्रु॒ताम॒मतिं॒ वर्ध॑दु॒र्वीं ब॒र्हिरि॑व॒ यजु॑षा॒ रक्ष॑माणा नम॑स्वन्ता धृतद॒क्षाधि॒ गर्ते॒ मित्रासा॑थे वरु॒णेळा॑स्व॒न्तः
verses.transliteration: ánu śrutā́m amátiṃ várdhad urvī́m  barhír iva yájuṣā rákṣamāṇā  námasvantā dhr̥tadakṣā́dhi gárte  mítrā́sāthe varuṇéḷāsv antáḥ

translation.text: To make the lustre wider and more famous, guarding the sacred grass with veneration, Ye, Mitra-Varuṇa, firm, strong, awe-inspiring, are seated on a throne amid oblations.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अक्र॑विहस्ता सु॒कृते॑ पर॒स्पा यं त्रासा॑थे वरु॒णेळा॑स्व॒न्तः राजा॑ना क्ष॒त्रमहृ॑णीयमाना स॒हस्र॑स्थूणं बिभृथः स॒ह द्वौ
verses.transliteration: ákravihastā sukŕ̥te paraspā́  yáṃ trā́sāthe varuṇéḷāsv antáḥ  rā́jānā kṣatrám áhr̥ṇīyamānā  sahásrasthūṇam bibhr̥thaḥ sahá dvaú

translation.text: With hands that shed no blood, guarding the pious, whom, Varuni3, ye save amid oblations. Ye Twain, together, Kings of willing spirit, uphold dominion based on thousand pillars.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हिर॑ण्यनिर्णि॒गयो॑ अस्य॒ स्थूणा॒ वि भ्रा॑जते दि॒व्य१॒॑श्वाज॑नीव भ॒द्रे क्षेत्रे॒ निमि॑ता॒ तिल्वि॑ले वा स॒नेम॒ मध्वो॒ अधि॑गर्त्यस्य
verses.transliteration: híraṇyanirṇig áyo asya sthū́ṇā  ví bhrājate divy àśvā́janīva  bhadré kṣétre nímitā tílvile  vā sanéma mádhvo ádhigartyasya

translation.text: Adorned with gold, its columns are of iron. in heaven it glitters like a whip for horses; Or stablished on a field deep-spoiled and fruitful. So may we share the meath that loads your carseat.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हिर॑ण्यरूपमु॒षसो॒ व्यु॑ष्टा॒वयः॑स्थूण॒मुदि॑ता॒ सूर्य॑स्य आ रो॑हथो वरुण मित्र॒ गर्त॒मत॑श्चक्षाथे॒ अदि॑तिं॒ दितिं॑ च
verses.transliteration: híraṇyarūpam uṣáso vyùṣṭāv  áyasthūṇam úditā sū́ryasya  ā́ rohatho varuṇa mitra gártam  átaś cakṣāthe áditiṃ dítiṃ ca

translation.text: Ye mount your car gold-hued at break of morning, and iron-pillared when the Sun is setting, And from that place, O Varuṇa and Mitra, behold infinity and limit~tion.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद्बंहि॑ष्ठं॒ नाति॒विधे॑ सुदानू॒ अच्छि॑द्रं॒ शर्म॑ भुवनस्य गोपा तेन॑ नो मित्रावरुणावविष्टं॒ सिषा॑सन्तो जिगी॒वांसः॑ स्याम
verses.transliteration: yád báṃhiṣṭhaṃ nā́tivídhe sudānū  áchidraṃ śárma bhuvanasya gopā  téna no mitrāvaruṇāv aviṣṭaṃ  síṣāsanto jigīvā́ṃsaḥ syāma

translation.text: Bountiful guardians of the world! the shelter that is impenetrable, strongest, flawless, Aid us with that, O Varuṇa and Mitra, and when we long to win may we be victors.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋत॑स्य गोपा॒वधि॑ तिष्ठथो॒ रथं॒ सत्य॑धर्माणा पर॒मे व्यो॑मनि यमत्र॑ मित्रावरु॒णाव॑थो यु॒वं तस्मै॑ वृ॒ष्टिर्मधु॑मत्पिन्वते दि॒वः
verses.transliteration: ŕ̥tasya gopāv ádhi tiṣṭhatho ráthaṃ  sátyadharmāṇā paramé vyòmani  yám átra mitrāvaruṇā́vatho yuváṃ  tásmai vr̥ṣṭír mádhumat pinvate diváḥ

translation.text: GUARDIANS of Order, ye whose Laws are ever true, in the sublimest heaven your chariot ye ascend. O Mitra-Varuṇa whomsoe'er ye: favour, here, to him the rain with sweetness streameth down from heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒म्राजा॑व॒स्य भुव॑नस्य राजथो॒ मित्रा॑वरुणा वि॒दथे॑ स्व॒र्दृशा॑ वृ॒ष्टिं वां॒ राधो॑ अमृत॒त्वमी॑महे॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी वि च॑रन्ति त॒न्यवः॑
verses.transliteration: samrā́jāv asyá bhúvanasya rājatho  mítrāvaruṇā vidáthe svardŕ̥śā  vr̥ṣṭíṃ vāṃ rā́dho amr̥tatvám īmahe  dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ ví caranti tanyávaḥ

translation.text: This world's imperial Kings, O Mitra-Varuṇa, ye rule in holy synod, looking on the light. We pray for rain, your boon, and immortality. Through heaven and over earth the thunderers take their way.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒म्राजा॑ उ॒ग्रा वृ॑ष॒भा दि॒वस्पती॑ पृथि॒व्या मि॒त्रावरु॑णा॒ विच॑र्षणी चि॒त्रेभि॑र॒भ्रैरुप॑ तिष्ठथो॒ रवं॒ द्यां व॑र्षयथो॒ असु॑रस्य मा॒यया॑
verses.transliteration: samrā́jā ugrā́ vr̥ṣabhā́ divás pátī  pr̥thivyā́ mitrā́váruṇā vícarṣaṇī  citrébhir abhraír úpa tiṣṭhatho rávaṃ  dyā́ṃ varṣayatho ásurasya māyáyā

translation.text: Imperial Kings, strong, Heroes, Lords of earth and heaven, Mitra and Varuṇa, ye ever active Ones, Ye wait on thunder with the many-tinted clouds, and by the Asura's magic power cause Heaven to rain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा॒या वां॑ मित्रावरुणा दि॒वि श्रि॒ता सूर्यो॒ ज्योति॑श्चरति चि॒त्रमायु॑धम् तम॒भ्रेण॑ वृ॒ष्ट्या गू॑हथो दि॒वि पर्ज॑न्य द्र॒प्सा मधु॑मन्त ईरते
verses.transliteration: māyā́ vām mitrāvaruṇā diví śritā́  sū́ryo jyótiś carati citrám ā́yudham  tám abhréṇa vr̥ṣṭyā́ gūhatho diví  párjanya drapsā́ mádhumanta īrate

translation.text: Your magic, Mitra-Varuṇa, resteth in the heaven. The Sun, the wondrous weapon, cometh forth as light. Ye hide him in the sky with cloud and flood of rain, and water-drops, Parjanya! full of sweetness flow.

verses.sanskrit_deva: रथं॑ युञ्जते म॒रुतः॑ शु॒भे सु॒खं शूरो॒ न मि॑त्रावरुणा॒ गवि॑ष्टिषु रजां॑सि चि॒त्रा वि च॑रन्ति त॒न्यवो॑ दि॒वः स॑म्राजा॒ पय॑सा न उक्षतम्
verses.transliteration: ráthaṃ yuñjate marútaḥ śubhé sukháṃ  śū́ro ná mitrāvaruṇā gáviṣṭiṣu  rájāṃsi citrā́ ví caranti tanyávo  diváḥ samrājā páyasā na ukṣatam

translation.text: The Maruts yoke their easy car for victory, O Mitra-Varuṇa, as a hero in the wars. The thunderers roam through regions varied in their hues. Imperial Kings, bedew us with the milk of heaven.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वाचं॒ सु मि॑त्रावरुणा॒विरा॑वतीं प॒र्जन्य॑श्चि॒त्रां व॑दति॒ त्विषी॑मतीम् अ॒भ्रा व॑सत म॒रुतः॒ सु मा॒यया॒ द्यां व॑र्षयतमरु॒णाम॑रे॒पस॑म्
verses.transliteration: vā́caṃ sú mitrāvaruṇāv írāvatīm  parjányaś citrā́ṃ vadati tvíṣīmatīm  abhrā́ vasata marútaḥ sú māyáyā  dyā́ṃ varṣayatam aruṇā́m arepásam

translation.text: Refreshing is your voice, O Mitra-Varuṇa: Parjanya sendeth out a wondrous mighty voice. With magic power the Maruts clothe them with the clouds. Ye Two cause Heaven to rain, the red, the spotless One.

verses.sanskrit_deva: धर्म॑णा मित्रावरुणा विपश्चिता व्र॒ता र॑क्षेथे॒ असु॑रस्य मा॒यया॑ ऋ॒तेन॒ विश्वं॒ भुव॑नं॒ वि रा॑जथः॒ सूर्य॒मा ध॑त्थो दि॒वि चित्र्यं॒ रथ॑म्
verses.transliteration: dhármaṇā mitrāvaruṇā vipaścitā  vratā́ rakṣethe ásurasya māyáyā  r̥téna víśvam bhúvanaṃ ví rājathaḥ  sū́ryam ā́ dhattho diví cítryaṃ rátham

translation.text: Wise, with your Law and through the Asura's magic power ye guard the ordinances, Mitra-Varuṇa. Ye by eternal Order govern all the world. Ye set the Sun in heaven as a refulgent car.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वरु॑णं वो रि॒शाद॑समृ॒चा मि॒त्रं ह॑वामहे परि॑ व्र॒जेव॑ बा॒ह्वोर्ज॑ग॒न्वांसा॒ स्व॑र्णरम्
verses.transliteration: váruṇaṃ vo riśā́dasam  r̥cā́ mitráṃ havāmahe  pári vrajéva bāhvór  jaganvā́ṃsā svàrṇaram

translation.text: You, foeman-slaying Varuṇa and Mitra, we invoke with song, Who, as with penfold of your arms, encompass round the realm of light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता बा॒हवा॑ सुचे॒तुना॒ प्र य॑न्तमस्मा॒ अर्च॑ते शेवं॒ हि जा॒र्यं॑ वां॒ विश्वा॑सु॒ क्षासु॒ जोगु॑वे
verses.transliteration: tā́ bāhávā sucetúnā  prá yantam asmā árcate  śévaṃ hí jāryàṃ vāṃ  víśvāsu kṣā́su jóguve

translation.text: Stretch out your arms with favouring love unto this man who singeth hymns, For in all places is sung forth your evergracious friendliness.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यन्नू॒नम॒श्यां गतिं॑ मि॒त्रस्य॑ यायां प॒था अस्य॑ प्रि॒यस्य॒ शर्म॒ण्यहिं॑सानस्य सश्चिरे
verses.transliteration: yán nūnám aśyā́ṃ gátim  mitrásya yāyām pathā́  ásya priyásya śármaṇi-  áhiṃsānasya saścire

translation.text: That I may gain a refuge now, may my steps be on Mitra's path. Men go protected in the charge of this dear Friend who harms us not.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वाभ्यां॑ मित्रावरुणोप॒मं धे॑यामृ॒चा यद्ध॒ क्षये॑ म॒घोनां॑ स्तोतॄ॒णां च॑ स्पू॒र्धसे॑
verses.transliteration: yuvā́bhyām mitrāvaruṇā-  -upamáṃ dheyām r̥cā́  yád dha kṣáye maghónāṃ  stotr̥̄ṇā́ṃ ca spūrdháse

translation.text: Mitra and Varuṇa, from you may I, by song, win noblest meed. That shall stir envy in the homes of wealthy chiefs and those who praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ मित्र सुदी॒तिभि॒र्वरु॑णश्च स॒धस्थ॒ आ स्वे क्षये॑ म॒घोनां॒ सखी॑नां च वृ॒धसे॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ no mitra sudītíbhir  váruṇaś ca sadhástha ā́  své kṣáye maghónāṃ  sákhīnāṃ ca vr̥dháse

translation.text: With your fair splendours, Varuṇa and Mitra, to our gathering come, That in their homes the wealthy chiefs and they who are your friends may thrive.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं नो॒ येषु॑ वरुण क्ष॒त्रं बृ॒हच्च॑ बिभृ॒थः उ॒रु णो॒ वाज॑सातये कृ॒तं रा॒ये स्व॒स्तये॑
verses.transliteration: yuváṃ no yéṣu varuṇa  kṣatrám br̥hác ca bibhr̥tháḥ  urú ṇo vā́jasātaye  kr̥táṃ rāyé svastáye

translation.text: With those, moreover, among whom ye hold your high supremacy, Vouchsafe us room that we may win strength for prosperity and wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒च्छन्त्यां॑ मे यज॒ता दे॒वक्ष॑त्रे॒ रुश॑द्गवि सु॒तं सोमं॒ न ह॒स्तिभि॒रा प॒ड्भिर्धा॑वतं नरा॒ बिभ्र॑तावर्च॒नान॑सम्
verses.transliteration: uchántyām me yajatā́  devákṣatre rúśadgavi  sutáṃ sómaṃ ná hastíbhir  ā́ paḍbhír dhāvataṃ narā  bíbhratāv arcanā́nasam

translation.text: When morning flushes, Holy Ones! in the Gods' realm where white Cows shine, Supporting Archanânas, speed, ye Heroes, with your active feet hither to my pressed Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यश्चि॒केत॒ स सु॒क्रतु॑र्देव॒त्रा स ब्र॑वीतु नः वरु॑णो॒ यस्य॑ दर्श॒तो मि॒त्रो वा॒ वन॑ते॒ गिरः॑
verses.transliteration: yáś cikéta sá sukrátur  devatrā́ sá bravītu naḥ  váruṇo yásya darśató  mitró vā vánate gíraḥ

translation.text: FULL wise is he who hath discerned: let him speak to us of the Gods,– The man whose praise-songs Varuṇa the beautiful, or Mitra, loves.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता हि श्रेष्ठ॑वर्चसा॒ राजा॑ना दीर्घ॒श्रुत्त॑मा ता सत्प॑ती ऋता॒वृध॑ ऋ॒तावा॑ना॒ जने॑जने
verses.transliteration: tā́ hí śréṣṭhavarcasā  rā́jānā dīrghaśrúttamā  tā́ sátpatī r̥tāvŕ̥dhā-  r̥tā́vānā jáne-jane

translation.text: For they are Kings of noblest might, of glorious fame most widely spread; Lords of the brave, who strengthen Law, the Holy Ones with every race.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता वा॑मिया॒नोऽव॑से॒ पूर्वा॒ उप॑ ब्रुवे॒ सचा॑ स्वश्वा॑सः॒ सु चे॒तुना॒ वाजाँ॑ अ॒भि प्र दा॒वने॑
verses.transliteration: tā́ vām iyānó 'vase  pū́rvā úpa bruve sácā  sváśvāsaḥ sú cetúnā  vā́jām̐ abhí prá dāváne

translation.text: Approaching you with prayer for aid, together I address you first We who have good steeds call on you, Most Sage, to give us strength besides.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मि॒त्रो अं॒होश्चि॒दादु॒रु क्षया॑य गा॒तुं व॑नते मि॒त्रस्य॒ हि प्र॒तूर्व॑तः सुम॒तिरस्ति॑ विध॒तः
verses.transliteration: mitró aṃhóś cid ā́d urú  kṣáyāya gātúṃ vanate  mitrásya hí pratū́rvataḥ  sumatír ásti vidhatáḥ

translation.text: E'en out of misery Mitra gives a way to dwelling at our case, For he who worships hath the grace of Mitra, fighter in the van. '

verses.sanskrit_deva: व॒यं मि॒त्रस्याव॑सि॒ स्याम॑ स॒प्रथ॑स्तमे अ॒ने॒हस॒स्त्वोत॑यः स॒त्रा वरु॑णशेषसः
verses.transliteration: vayám mitrásyā́vasi  syā́ma sapráthastame  anehásas tvótayaḥ  satrā́ váruṇaśeṣasaḥ

translation.text: In Mitra's shelter that extends to utmost distance may we dwell, Unmenaced, guarded by the care, ever as sons of Varuṇa.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वं मि॑त्रे॒मं जनं॒ यत॑थः॒ सं च॑ नयथः मा म॒घोनः॒ परि॑ ख्यतं॒ मो अ॒स्माक॒मृषी॑णां गोपी॒थे न॑ उरुष्यतम्
verses.transliteration: yuvám mitremáṃ jánaṃ  yátathaḥ sáṃ ca nayathaḥ  mā́ maghónaḥ pári khyatam  mó asmā́kam ŕ̥ṣīṇāṃ  gopīthé na uruṣyatam

translation.text: Ye, Mitra, urge this people on, and to one end direct their ways. Neglect not ye the wealthy chiefs, neglect not us the R̥ishis: be our guardians when ye quaff the milk.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ चि॑कितान सु॒क्रतू॑ दे॒वौ म॑र्त रि॒शाद॑सा वरु॑णाय ऋ॒तपे॑शसे दधी॒त प्रय॑से म॒हे
verses.transliteration: ā́ cikitāna sukrátū  devaú marta riśā́dasā  váruṇāya r̥tápeśase  dadhītá práyase mahé

translation.text: O SAPIENT man, call the Two Gods, the very wise, who slay the foe. For Varuṇa, whose form is Law, place offerings for his great delight.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता हि क्ष॒त्रमवि॑ह्रुतं स॒म्यग॑सु॒र्य१॒॑माशा॑ते अध॑ व्र॒तेव॒ मानु॑षं॒ स्व१॒॑र्ण धा॑यि दर्श॒तम्
verses.transliteration: tā́ hí kṣatrám ávihrutaṃ  samyág asuryàm ā́śāte  ádha vratéva mā́nuṣaṃ  svàr ṇá dhāyi darśatám

translation.text: For they have won unbroken sway in full perfection, power divine. And, like high laws, the world of man hath been made beautiful as light.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता वा॒मेषे॒ रथा॑नामु॒र्वीं गव्यू॑तिमेषाम् रा॒तह॑व्यस्य सुष्टु॒तिं द॒धृक्स्तोमै॑र्मनामहे
verses.transliteration: tā́ vām éṣe ráthānām  urvī́ṃ gávyūtim eṣām  rātáhavyasya suṣṭutíṃ  dadhŕ̥k stómair manāmahe

translation.text: Therefore we praise you that your cars may travel far in front of ours- You who accept the eulogy of Râtahavya with his hymns.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अधा॒ हि काव्या॑ यु॒वं दक्ष॑स्य पू॒र्भिर॑द्भुता नि के॒तुना॒ जना॑नां चि॒केथे॑ पूतदक्षसा
verses.transliteration: ádhā hí kā́vyā yuváṃ  dákṣasya pūrbhír adbhutā  ní ketúnā jánānāṃ  cikéthe pūtadakṣasā

translation.text: And ye show wMom, Wondrous Gods with fulness of intellIgence. By men's discernment are Ve marked, O ye whose might is purified.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तदृ॒तं पृ॑थिवि बृ॒हच्छ्र॑वए॒ष ऋषी॑णाम् ज्र॒य॒सा॒नावरं॑ पृ॒थ्वति॑ क्षरन्ति॒ याम॑भिः
verses.transliteration: tád r̥tám pr̥thivi br̥hác  -śravaeṣá ŕ̥ṣīṇām  jrayasānā́v áram pr̥thú-  áti kṣaranti yā́mabhiḥ

translation.text: This is the Law sublime, O Earth: to aid the R̥ishis' toil for fame The Two, wide-spreading, are prepared. They come with ample overflow.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यद्वा॑मीयचक्षसा॒ मित्र॑ व॒यं च॑ सू॒रयः॑ व्यचि॑ष्ठे बहु॒पाय्ये॒ यते॑महि स्व॒राज्ये॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ yád vām īyacakṣasā  mítra vayáṃ ca sūráyaḥ  vyáciṣṭhe bahupā́yye  yátemahi svarā́jye

translation.text: Mitra, ye Gods with wandering eyes, would that the worshippers and we Might strive to reach the realm ye rule, most spacious and protected well,

verses.sanskrit_deva: बळि॒त्था दे॑व निष्कृ॒तमादि॑त्या यज॒तं बृ॒हत् वरु॑ण॒ मित्रार्य॑म॒न्वर्षि॑ष्ठं क्ष॒त्रमा॑शाथे
verses.transliteration: báḷ itthā́ deva niṣkr̥tám  ā́dityā yajatám br̥hát  váruṇa mítrā́ryaman  várṣiṣṭhaṃ kṣatrám āśāthe

translation.text: YE Gods, Âdityas, Varuṇa, Aryaman, Mitra, verily Have here obtained supremest sway, high, holy, set apart for you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यद्योनिं॑ हिर॒ण्ययं॒ वरु॑ण॒ मित्र॒ सद॑थः ध॒र्तारा॑ चर्षणी॒नां य॒न्तं सु॒म्नं रि॑शादसा
verses.transliteration: ā́ yád yóniṃ hiraṇyáyaṃ  váruṇa mítra sádathaḥ  dhartā́rā carṣaṇīnā́m  yantáṃ sumnáṃ riśādasā

translation.text: When, Varuṇa and Mitra, ye sit in your golden dwelling-place, Ye Twain, supporters of mankind, foeslayers, give felicity.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वे॒ हि वि॒श्ववे॑दसो॒ वरु॑णो मि॒त्रो अ॑र्य॒मा व्र॒ता प॒देव॑ सश्चिरे॒ पान्ति॒ मर्त्यं॑ रि॒षः
verses.transliteration: víśve hí viśvávedaso  váruṇo mitró aryamā́  vratā́ padéva saścire  pā́nti mártyaṃ riṣáḥ

translation.text: All these, possessors of all wealth, Varuṇa, Mitra, Aryaman, Follow their ways, as if with feet, and guard from injury mortal man.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते हि स॒त्या ऋ॑त॒स्पृश॑ ऋ॒तावा॑नो॒ जने॑जने सु॒नी॒थासः॑ सु॒दान॑वों॒ऽहोश्चि॑दुरु॒चक्र॑यः
verses.transliteration: té hí satyā́ r̥taspŕ̥śaḥ-  r̥tā́vāno jáne-jane  sunīthā́saḥ sudā́navo  -aṃhóś cid urucákrayaḥ

translation.text: For they are true, they cleave to Law, held holy among every race, Good leaders, bounteous in their gifts, deliverers even from distress.

verses.sanskrit_deva: को नु वां॑ मि॒त्रास्तु॑तो॒ वरु॑णो वा त॒नूना॑म् तत्सु वा॒मेष॑ते म॒तिरत्रि॑भ्य॒ एष॑ते म॒तिः
verses.transliteration: kó nú vām mitrā́stuto  váruṇo vā tanū́nām  tát sú vām éṣate matír  átribhya éṣate matíḥ

translation.text: Which of your persons, Varuṇa or Mitra, merits not our praise? Therefore our thought is turned to you, the Atris' thought is turned to you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वो॑ मि॒त्राय॑ गायत॒ वरु॑णाय वि॒पा गि॒रा महि॑क्षत्रावृ॒तं बृ॒हत्
verses.transliteration: prá vo mitrā́ya gāyata  váruṇāya vipā́ girā́  máhikṣatrāv r̥tám br̥hát

translation.text: SING forth unto your Varuṇa and Mitra with a song inspired. They, Mighty Lords, are lofty Law

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒म्राजा॒ या घृ॒तयो॑नी मि॒त्रश्चो॒भा वरु॑णश्च दे॒वा दे॒वेषु॑ प्रश॒स्ता
verses.transliteration: samrā́jā yā́ ghr̥táyonī  mitráś cobhā́ váruṇaś ca  devā́ devéṣu praśastā́

translation.text: Full springs of fatness, Sovran Kings, Mitra. and Varuṇa, the Twain, Gods glorified among the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता नः॑ शक्तं॒ पार्थि॑वस्य म॒हो रा॒यो दि॒व्यस्य॑ महि॑ वां क्ष॒त्रं दे॒वेषु॑
verses.transliteration: tā́ naḥ śaktam pā́rthivasya  mahó rāyó divyásya  máhi vāṃ kṣatráṃ devéṣu

translation.text: So help ye us to riches, great terrestrial and celestial wealth: Vast is your sway among the Gods.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऋ॒तमृ॒तेन॒ सप॑न्तेषि॒रं दक्ष॑माशाते अ॒द्रुहा॑ दे॒वौ व॑र्धेते
verses.transliteration: r̥tám r̥téna sápantā-  -iṣiráṃ dákṣam āśāte  adrúhā devaú vardhete

translation.text: Carefully tending Law with Law they have attained their vigorous might. The two Gods wax devoid of guile.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वृ॒ष्टिद्या॑वा री॒त्या॑पे॒षस्पती॒ दानु॑मत्याः बृ॒हन्तं॒ गर्त॑माशाते
verses.transliteration: vr̥ṣṭídyāvā rītyā̀pā-  -iṣás pátī dā́numatyāḥ  br̥hántaṃ gártam āśāte

translation.text: With rainy skies and streaming floods, Lords of the strength that bringeth gifts, A lofty seat have they attained.

verses.sanskrit_deva: त्री रो॑च॒ना व॑रुण॒ त्रीँरु॒त द्यून्त्रीणि॑ मित्र धारयथो॒ रजां॑सि वा॒वृ॒धा॒नाव॒मतिं॑ क्ष॒त्रिय॒स्यानु॑ व्र॒तं रक्ष॑माणावजु॒र्यम्
verses.transliteration: trī́ rocanā́ varuṇa trī́m̐r utá dyū́n  trī́ṇi mitra dhārayatho rájāṃsi  vāvr̥dhānā́v amátiṃ kṣatríyasya-  -ánu vratáṃ rákṣamāṇāv ajuryám

translation.text: THREE spheres of light, O Varuṇa, three heavens, three firmaments ye comprehend, O Mitra: Waxed strong, ye keep the splendour of dominion, guarding the Ordinance that lasts for ever.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इरा॑वतीर्वरुण धे॒नवो॑ वां॒ मधु॑मद्वां॒ सिन्ध॑वो मित्र दुह्रे त्रय॑स्तस्थुर्वृष॒भास॑स्तिसृ॒णां धि॒षणा॑नां रेतो॒धा वि द्यु॒मन्तः॑
verses.transliteration: írāvatīr varuṇa dhenávo vām  mádhumad vāṃ síndhavo mitra duhre  tráyas tasthur vr̥ṣabhā́sas tisr̥ṇā́ṃ  dhiṣáṇānāṃ retodhā́ ví dyumántaḥ

translation.text: Ye, Varuṇa, have kine who yield refreshment; Mitra, your floods pour water full of sweetness. There stand the Three Steers, splendid in their brightness, who fill the three world-bowls with genial moisture.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रा॒तर्दे॒वीमदि॑तिं जोहवीमि म॒ध्यंदि॑न॒ उदि॑ता॒ सूर्य॑स्य रा॒ये मि॑त्रावरुणा स॒र्वता॒तेळे॑ तो॒काय॒ तन॑याय॒ शं योः
verses.transliteration: prātár devī́m áditiṃ johavīmi  madhyáṃdina úditā sū́ryasya  rāyé mitrāvaruṇā sarvátātā-  -ī́ḷe tokā́ya tánayāya śáṃ yóḥ

translation.text: I call at dawn on Aditi the Goddess, I call at noon and when the Sun is setting. I pray, O Mitra-Varuṇa, for safety, for wealth and progeny, in rest and trouble.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या ध॒र्तारा॒ रज॑सो रोच॒नस्यो॒तादि॒त्या दि॒व्या पार्थि॑वस्य न वां॑ दे॒वा अ॒मृता॒ आ मि॑नन्ति व्र॒तानि॑ मित्रावरुणा ध्रु॒वाणि॑
verses.transliteration: yā́ dhartā́rā rájaso rocanásya-  -utā́dityā́ divyā́ pā́rthivasya  ná vāṃ devā́ amŕ̥tā ā́ minanti  vratā́ni mitrāvaruṇā dhruvā́ṇi

translation.text: Ye who uphold the region, sphere of brightness, ye who support earth's realm Divine Âdityas, The Immortal Gods, O Varuṇa and Mitra, never impair your everlasting statutes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पु॒रू॒रुणा॑ चि॒द्ध्यस्त्यवो॑ नू॒नं वां॑ वरुण मित्र॒ वंसि॑ वां सुम॒तिम्
verses.transliteration: purūrúṇā cid dhy ásti-  ávo nūnáṃ vāṃ varuṇa  mítra váṃsi vāṃ sumatím

translation.text: EVEN far and wide, O Varuṇa and Mitra, doth your grace extend. May I obtain your kind good-will.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता वां॑ स॒म्यग॑द्रुह्वा॒णेष॑मश्याम॒ धाय॑से व॒यं ते रु॑द्रा स्याम
verses.transliteration: tā́ vāṃ samyág adruhvāṇā-  -íṣam aśyāma dhā́yase  vayáṃ té rudrā syāma

translation.text: From you, benignant Gods, may we gain fully food for sustenance. Such, O ye Rudras, my we be.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पा॒तं नो॑ रुद्रा पा॒युभि॑रु॒त त्रा॑येथां सुत्रा॒त्रा तु॒र्याम॒ दस्यू॑न्त॒नूभिः॑
verses.transliteration: pātáṃ no rudrā pāyúbhir  utá trāyethāṃ sutrātrā́  turyā́ma dásyūn tanū́bhiḥ

translation.text: Guard us, O Rudras. with your guar4 save us, ye skilled to save, my we Subdue the Dasyus, we ourselves,

verses.sanskrit_deva: मा कस्या॑द्भुतक्रतू य॒क्षं भु॑जेमा त॒नूभिः॑ मा शेष॑सा॒ मा तन॑सा
verses.transliteration: mā́ kásyādbhutakratū  yakṣám bhujemā tanū́bhiḥ  mā́ śéṣasā mā́ tánasā

translation.text: Or ne'er may we, O Wondrous Strong, enjoy another's solemn feast, Ourselves, our sons, or progeny.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॑ गन्तं रिशादसा॒ वरु॑ण॒ मित्र॑ ब॒र्हणा॑ उपे॒मं चारु॑मध्व॒रम्
verses.transliteration: ā́ no gantaṃ riśādasā  váruṇa mítra barháṇā  úpemáṃ cā́rum adhvarám

translation.text: O Varuṇa and Mitra, ye who slay the foemen, come with might To this our goodly sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्व॑स्य॒ हि प्र॑चेतसा॒ वरु॑ण॒ मित्र॒ राज॑थः ई॒शा॒ना पि॑प्यतं॒ धियः॑
verses.transliteration: víśvasya hí pracetasā  váruṇa mítra rā́jathaḥ  īśānā́ pipyataṃ dhíyaḥ

translation.text: For, Varuṇa and Mitra, ye Sages are Rulers over all. Fill full our songs, for this ye can.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उप॑ नः सु॒तमा ग॑तं॒ वरु॑ण॒ मित्र॑ दा॒शुषः॑ अ॒स्य सोम॑स्य पी॒तये॑
verses.transliteration: úpa naḥ sutám ā́ gataṃ  váruṇa mítra dāśúṣaḥ  asyá sómasya pītáye

translation.text: Come to the juice that we have pressed. Varuṇa, Mitra, come to drink This Soma of the worshipper.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ मि॒त्रे वरु॑णे व॒यं गी॒र्भिर्जु॑हुमो अत्रि॒वत् नि ब॒र्हिषि॑ सदतं॒ सोम॑पीतये
verses.transliteration: ā́ mitré váruṇe vayáṃ  gīrbhír juhumo atrivát  ní barhíṣi sadataṃ sómapītaye

translation.text: To Varuṇa and Mitra we offerwith songs, as Atri did. Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: व्र॒तेन॑ स्थो ध्रु॒वक्षे॑मा॒ धर्म॑णा यात॒यज्ज॑ना नि ब॒र्हिषि॑ सदतं॒ सोम॑पीतये
verses.transliteration: vraténa stho dhruvákṣemā  dhármaṇā yātayájjanā  ní barhíṣi sadataṃ sómapītaye

translation.text: By Ordinance and Law ye dwell in peace secure, bestirring men. Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मि॒त्रश्च॑ नो॒ वरु॑णश्च जु॒षेतां॑ य॒ज्ञमि॒ष्टये॑ नि ब॒र्हिषि॑ सदतां॒ सोम॑पीतये
verses.transliteration: mitráś ca no váruṇaś ca  juṣétāṃ yajñám iṣṭáye  ní barhíṣi sadatāṃ sómapītaye

translation.text: May Varuṇa and Mitra, for our help, accept the sacrifice. Sit on the sacred grass to drink the Soma juice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यद॒द्य स्थः प॑रा॒वति॒ यद॑र्वा॒वत्य॑श्विना यद्वा॑ पु॒रू पु॑रुभुजा॒ यद॒न्तरि॑क्ष॒ आ ग॑तम्
verses.transliteration: yád adyá stháḥ parāváti  yád arvāváty aśvinā  yád vā purū́ purubhujā  yád antárikṣa ā́ gatam

translation.text: WHETHER, O Aṣvins, ye this day be far remote or near at hand, In many spots or in mid-air, come hither, Lords of ample wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒ह त्या पु॑रु॒भूत॑मा पु॒रू दंसां॑सि॒ बिभ्र॑ता व॒र॒स्या या॒म्यध्रि॑गू हु॒वे तु॒विष्ट॑मा भु॒जे
verses.transliteration: ihá tyā́ purubhū́tamā  purū́ dáṃsāṃsi bíbhratā  varasyā́ yāmy ádhrigū  huvé tuvíṣṭamā bhujé

translation.text: These here, who show o'er widest space, bringing full many a wondrous act, Resistless, lovingly I seek, I call the Mightiest to enjoy.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ई॒र्मान्यद्वपु॑षे॒ वपु॑श्च॒क्रं रथ॑स्य येमथुः पर्य॒न्या नाहु॑षा यु॒गा म॒ह्ना रजां॑सि दीयथः
verses.transliteration: īrmā́nyád vápuṣe vápuś  cakráṃ ráthasya yemathuḥ  páry anyā́ nā́huṣā yugā́  mahnā́ rájāṃsi dīyathaḥ

translation.text: Another beauteous wheel have ye fixed there to decorate your car. With others through the realms ye roam in might unto the neighbouring tribes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तदू॒ षु वा॑मे॒ना कृ॒तं विश्वा॒ यद्वा॒मनु॒ ष्टवे॑ नाना॑ जा॒ताव॑रे॒पसा॒ सम॒स्मे बन्धु॒मेय॑थुः
verses.transliteration: tád ū ṣú vām enā́ kr̥táṃ  víśvā yád vām ánu ṣṭáve  nā́nā jātā́v arepásā  sám asmé bándhum éyathuḥ

translation.text: That deed of yours that is extolled, Viṣvas! hath all been done with this. Born otherwise, and spotless, ye have entered kinship's bonds with us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ यद्वां॑ सू॒र्या रथं॒ तिष्ठ॑द्रघु॒ष्यदं॒ सदा॑ परि॑ वामरु॒षा वयो॑ घृ॒णा व॑रन्त आ॒तपः॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ yád vāṃ sūryā́ ráthaṃ  tíṣṭhad raghuṣyádaṃ sádā  pári vām aruṣā́ váyo  ghr̥ṇā́ varanta ātápaḥ

translation.text: When Sûryâ mounted on your car that rolls for ever rapidly, Birds of red hue were round about and burning splendours compassed you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒वोरत्रि॑श्चिकेतति॒ नरा॑ सु॒म्नेन॒ चेत॑सा घ॒र्मं यद्वा॑मरे॒पसं॒ नास॑त्या॒स्ना भु॑र॒ण्यति॑
verses.transliteration: yuvór átriś ciketati  nárā sumnéna cétasā  gharmáṃ yád vām arepásaṃ  nā́satyāsnā́ bhuraṇyáti

translation.text: Atri bethinks himself of you, O Heroes, with a friendly mind, What time, Nâsatyas, with his mouth he stirs the spotless flame for you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒ग्रो वां॑ ककु॒हो य॒यिः शृ॒ण्वे यामे॑षु संत॒निः यद्वां॒ दंसो॑भिरश्वि॒नात्रि॑र्नराव॒वर्त॑ति
verses.transliteration: ugró vāṃ kakuhó yayíḥ  śr̥ṇvé yā́meṣu saṃtaníḥ  yád vāṃ dáṃsobhir aśvinā́-  -átrir narāvavártati

translation.text: Strong is your swiftly moving steed, famed his exertion in the course When by your great deeds, Atyins, Chiefs, Atri is brought to us again.

verses.sanskrit_deva: मध्व॑ ऊ॒ षु म॑धूयुवा॒ रुद्रा॒ सिष॑क्ति पि॒प्युषी॑ यत्स॑मु॒द्राति॒ पर्ष॑थः प॒क्वाः पृक्षो॑ भरन्त वाम्
verses.transliteration: mádhva ū ṣú madhūyuvā  rúdrā síṣakti pipyúṣī  yát samudrā́ti párṣathaḥ  pakvā́ḥ pŕ̥kṣo bharanta vām

translation.text: Lovers of sweetness, Rudras, she who streams with sweetness waits on you. When ye have travelled through the seas men bring you gifts of well-dressed food.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स॒त्यमिद्वा उ॑ अश्विना यु॒वामा॑हुर्मयो॒भुवा॑ ता याम॑न्याम॒हूत॑मा॒ याम॒न्ना मृ॑ळ॒यत्त॑मा
verses.transliteration: satyám íd vā́ u aśvinā  yuvā́m āhur mayobhúvā  tā́ yā́man yāmahū́tamā  yā́mann ā́ mr̥ḷayáttamā

translation.text: Aṣvins, with truth they call you Twain bestowers of felicity; At sacrifice most prompt to hear, most gracious ye at sacrifice.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मा ब्रह्मा॑णि॒ वर्ध॑ना॒श्विभ्यां॑ सन्तु॒ शंत॑मा या तक्षा॑म॒ रथाँ॑ इ॒वावो॑चाम बृ॒हन्नमः॑
verses.transliteration: imā́ bráhmāṇi várdhanā-  -aśvíbhyāṃ santu śáṃtamā  yā́ tákṣāma ráthām̐ iva-  -ávocāma br̥hán námaḥ

translation.text: Most pleasing to the Aṣvins be these prayers which magnify their might, Which we have fashioned, even as cars high reverence have we spoken forth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कूष्ठो॑ देवावश्विना॒द्या दि॒वो म॑नावसू तच्छ्र॑वथो वृषण्वसू॒ अत्रि॑र्वा॒मा वि॑वासति
verses.transliteration: kū́ ṣṭho devāv aśvinā-  -adyā́ divó manāvasū  tác chravatho vr̥ṣaṇvasū  átrir vām ā́ vivāsati

translation.text: WHERE in the heavens are ye to-day, Gods, Aṣvins, rich in constancy? Hear this, ye excellent as Steers: Atri inviteth you to come.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कुह॒ त्या कुह॒ नु श्रु॒ता दि॒वि दे॒वा नास॑त्या कस्मि॒न्ना य॑तथो॒ जने॒ को वां॑ न॒दीनां॒ सचा॑
verses.transliteration: kúha tyā́ kúha nú śrutā́  diví devā́ nā́satyā  kásminn ā́ yatatho jáne  kó vāṃ nadī́nāṃ sácā

translation.text: Where are they now? Where are the Twain, the famed Nâsatyas, Gods in heaven? Who is the man ye strive to reach? Who of your suppliants is with you?

verses.sanskrit_deva: कं या॑थः॒ कं ह॑ गच्छथः॒ कमच्छा॑ युञ्जाथे॒ रथ॑म् कस्य॒ ब्रह्मा॑णि रण्यथो व॒यं वा॑मुश्मसी॒ष्टये॑
verses.transliteration: káṃ yāthaḥ káṃ ha gachathaḥ  kám áchā yuñjāthe rátham  kásya bráhmāṇi raṇyatho  vayáṃ vām uśmasīṣṭáye

translation.text: Whom do ye visit, whom approach? to whom direct your harnessed car? With whose devotions are ye pleased? We long for you to further us.

verses.sanskrit_deva: पौ॒रं चि॒द्ध्यु॑द॒प्रुतं॒ पौर॑ पौ॒राय॒ जिन्व॑थः यदीं॑ गृभी॒तता॑तये सिं॒हमि॑व द्रु॒हस्प॒दे
verses.transliteration: pauráṃ cid dhy ùdaprútam  paúra paurā́ya jínvathaḥ  yád īṃ gr̥bhītátātaye  siṃhám iva druhás padé

translation.text: Ye, Strengtheners, for Paura stir the filler swimming in the flood, Advancing to be captured like a lion to the ambuscade.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र च्यवा॑नाज्जुजु॒रुषो॑ व॒व्रिमत्कं॒ न मु॑ञ्चथः युवा॒ यदी॑ कृ॒थः पुन॒रा काम॑मृण्वे व॒ध्वः॑
verses.transliteration: prá cyávānāj jujurúṣo  vavrím átkaṃ ná muñcathaḥ  yúvā yádī kr̥tháḥ púnar  ā́ kā́mam r̥ṇve vadhvàḥ

translation.text: Ye from Chyavâna worn with age removed his skin as 'twere a robe. So, when ye made him young again, he stirred the longing of a dame.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस्ति॒ हि वा॑मि॒ह स्तो॒ता स्मसि॑ वां सं॒दृशि॑ श्रि॒ये नू श्रु॒तं म॒ आ ग॑त॒मवो॑भिर्वाजिनीवसू
verses.transliteration: ásti hí vām ihá stotā́  smási vāṃ saṃdŕ̥śi śriyé  nū́ śrutám ma ā́ gatam  ávobhir vājinīvasū

translation.text: Here is the man who lauds you both: to see your glory are we here. Now bear me, come with saving help, ye who are rich in store of wealth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: को वा॑म॒द्य पु॑रू॒णामा व॑व्ने॒ मर्त्या॑नाम् को विप्रो॑ विप्रवाहसा॒ को य॒ज्ञैर्वा॑जिनीवसू
verses.transliteration: kó vām adyá purūṇā́m  ā́ vavne mártyānām  kó vípro vipravāhasā  kó yajñaír vājinīvasū

translation.text: Who among many mortal men this day hath won you to himself? What bard, accepters of the bard? Who, rich in wealth! with sacrifice?

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वां॒ रथो॒ रथा॑नां॒ येष्ठो॑ यात्वश्विना पु॒रू चि॑दस्म॒युस्ति॒र आ॑ङ्गू॒षो मर्त्ये॒ष्वा
verses.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ rátho ráthānāṃ  yéṣṭho yātv aśvinā  purū́ cid asmayús tiráḥ-  āṅgūṣó mártyeṣv ā́

translation.text: O Aṣvins, may your car approach, most excellent of cars for speed. Through many regions may our praise pass onward among mortal men.

verses.sanskrit_deva: शमू॒ षु वां॑ मधूयुवा॒स्माक॑मस्तु चर्कृ॒तिः अ॒र्वा॒ची॒ना वि॑चेतसा॒ विभिः॑ श्ये॒नेव॑ दीयतम्
verses.transliteration: śám ū ṣú vām madhūyuvā-  -asmā́kam astu carkr̥tíḥ  arvācīnā́ vicetasā  víbhiḥ śyenéva dīyatam

translation.text: May our laudation of you Twain, lovers of meath! be sweet to you. Fly hitherward, ye wise of heart, like falcons with your winged steeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वि॑ना॒ यद्ध॒ कर्हि॑ चिच्छुश्रू॒यात॑मि॒मं हव॑म् वस्वी॑रू॒ षु वां॒ भुजः॑ पृ॒ञ्चन्ति॒ सु वां॒ पृचः॑
verses.transliteration: áśvinā yád dha kárhi cic  -śuśrūyā́tam imáṃ hávam  vásvīr ū ṣú vām bhújaḥ  pr̥ñcánti sú vām pŕ̥caḥ

translation.text: O Aṣvins, when at any time ye listen to this call of mine, For you is dainty food prepared: they mix refreshing food for you.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रति॑ प्रि॒यत॑मं॒ रथं॒ वृष॑णं वसु॒वाह॑नम् स्तो॒ता वा॑मश्विना॒वृषिः॒ स्तोमे॑न॒ प्रति॑ भूषति॒ माध्वी॒ मम॑ श्रुतं॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: práti priyátamaṃ ráthaṃ  vŕ̥ṣaṇaṃ vasuvā́hanam  stotā́ vām aśvināv ŕ̥ṣiḥ-  stómena práti bhūṣati  mā́dhvī máma śrutaṃ hávam

translation.text: To meet your treasure-bringing car, the mighty car most dear to us, Aṣvins, the R̥ishi is prepared, your raiser, with his song of praise. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒त्याया॑तमश्विना ति॒रो विश्वा॑ अ॒हं सना॑ दस्रा॒ हिर॑ण्यवर्तनी॒ सुषु॑म्ना॒ सिन्धु॑वाहसा॒ माध्वी॒ मम॑ श्रुतं॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: atyā́yātam aśvinā  tiró víśvā aháṃ sánā  dásrā híraṇyavartanī  súṣumnā síndhuvāhasā  mā́dhvī máma śrutaṃ hávam

translation.text: Pass, O ye Aṣvins, pass away beyond all tribes of selfish men, Wonderful, with your golden paths, most gracious, bringers of the flood. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ नो॒ रत्ना॑नि॒ बिभ्र॑ता॒वश्वि॑ना॒ गच्छ॑तं यु॒वम् रुद्रा॒ हिर॑ण्यवर्तनी जुषा॒णा वा॑जिनीवसू॒ माध्वी॒ मम॑ श्रुतं॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ no rátnāni bíbhratāv  áśvinā gáchataṃ yuvám  rúdrā híraṇyavartanī  juṣāṇā́ vājinīvasū  mā́dhvī máma śrutaṃ hávam

translation.text: Come to us, O ye Aṣvin Pair, bringing your precious treasures, come Ye Rudras, on your paths of gold, rejoicing, rich in store of wealth. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सु॒ष्टुभो॑ वां वृषण्वसू॒ रथे॒ वाणी॒च्याहि॑ता उ॒त वां॑ ककु॒हो मृ॒गः पृक्षः॑ कृणोति वापु॒षो माध्वी॒ मम॑ श्रुतं॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: suṣṭúbho vāṃ vr̥ṣaṇvasū  ráthe vā́ṇīcy ā́hitā  utá vāṃ kakuhó mr̥gáḥ  pŕ̥kṣaḥ kr̥ṇoti vāpuṣó  mā́dhvī máma śrutaṃ hávam

translation.text: O strong and Good, the voice of him who lauds you well cleaves to your car. And that great beast, your chariot-steed, fair, wonderful, makes dainty food. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बो॒धिन्म॑नसा र॒थ्ये॑षि॒रा ह॑वन॒श्रुता॑ विभि॒श्च्यवा॑नमश्विना॒ नि या॑थो॒ अद्व॑याविनं॒ माध्वी॒ मम॑ श्रुतं॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: bodhínmanasā rathyā̀-  -iṣirā́ havanaśrútā  víbhiś cyávānam aśvinā  ní yātho ádvayāvinam  mā́dhvī máma śrutaṃ hávam

translation.text: Watchful in spirit, born on cars, impetuous, listing to his cry, Aṣvins, with winged steeds ye speed down to Chyavâna void of guile. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वां॑ नरा मनो॒युजोऽश्वा॑सः प्रुषि॒तप्स॑वः वयो॑ वहन्तु पी॒तये॑ स॒ह सु॒म्नेभि॑रश्विना॒ माध्वी॒ मम॑ श्रुतं॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ vāṃ narā manoyújaḥ-  -áśvāsaḥ pruṣitápsavaḥ  váyo vahantu pītáye  sahá sumnébhir aśvinā  mā́dhvī máma śrutaṃ hávam

translation.text: Hither, O Heroes, let your steeds, of dappled hue, yoked at the thought, Your flying steeds, O Aṣvins, bring you hitherward, with bliss, to drink. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वि॑ना॒वेह ग॑च्छतं॒ नास॑त्या॒ मा वि वे॑नतम् ति॒रश्चि॑दर्य॒या परि॑ व॒र्तिर्या॑तमदाभ्या॒ माध्वी॒ मम॑ श्रुतं॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: áśvināv éhá gachataṃ  nā́satyā mā́ ví venatam  tiráś cid aryayā́ pári  vartír yātam adābhyā  mā́dhvī máma śrutaṃ hávam

translation.text: O Aṣvins, hither come to us; Nâsatyas, be not disinclined. Through longing for the pious turn out of the way to reach our home. Lovers of sweetness, bear my call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒स्मिन्य॒ज्ञे अ॑दाभ्या जरि॒तारं॑ शुभस्पती अ॒व॒स्युम॑श्विना यु॒वं गृ॒णन्त॒मुप॑ भूषथो॒ माध्वी॒ मम॑ श्रुतं॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: asmín yajñé adābhyā  jaritā́raṃ śubhas patī  avasyúm aśvinā yuváṃ  gr̥ṇántam úpa bhūṣatho  mā́dhvī máma śrutaṃ hávam

translation.text: Ye Lords of Splendour, free from guile, come, stand at this our sacrifice. Beside the singer, Aṣvins, who longs for your grace and lauds you both. Lovers of sweetness, hear my call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अभू॑दु॒षा रुश॑त्पशु॒राग्निर॑धाय्यृ॒त्वियः॑ अयो॑जि वां वृषण्वसू॒ रथो॑ दस्रा॒वम॑र्त्यो॒ माध्वी॒ मम॑ श्रुतं॒ हव॑म्
verses.transliteration: ábhūd uṣā́ rúśatpaśur  ā́gnír adhāyy r̥tvíyaḥ  áyoji vāṃ vr̥ṣaṇvasū  rátho dasrāv ámartyaḥ  mā́dhvī máma śrutaṃ hávam

translation.text: Dawn with her white herd hath appeared, and in due time hath fire been placed. Harnessed is your immortal car, O WonderWorkers, strong and kind. Lovers of sweetness, bear my call.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ भा॑त्य॒ग्निरु॒षसा॒मनी॑क॒मुद्विप्रा॑णां देव॒या वाचो॑ अस्थुः अ॒र्वाञ्चा॑ नू॒नं र॑थ्ये॒ह या॑तं पीपि॒वांस॑मश्विना घ॒र्ममच्छ॑
verses.transliteration: ā́ bhāty agnír uṣásām ánīkam  úd víprāṇāṃ devayā́ vā́co asthuḥ  arvā́ñcā nūnáṃ rathyehá yātam  pīpivā́ṃsam aśvinā gharmám ácha

translation.text: AGNI, the bright face of the Dawns, is shining; the singers' pious voices have ascended. Borne on your chariot, Aṣvins, turn you hither and come unto our full and rich libation.

verses.sanskrit_deva: न सं॑स्कृ॒तं प्र मि॑मीतो॒ गमि॒ष्ठान्ति॑ नू॒नम॒श्विनोप॑स्तुते॒ह दिवा॑भिपि॒त्वेऽव॒साग॑मिष्ठा॒ प्रत्यव॑र्तिं दा॒शुषे॒ शम्भ॑विष्ठा
verses.transliteration: ná saṃskr̥tám prá mimīto gámiṣṭhā-  -ánti nūnám aśvínópastutehá  dívābhipitvé 'vasā́gamiṣṭhā  práty ávartiṃ dāśúṣe śámbhaviṣṭhā

translation.text: Most frequent guests, they scorn not what is ready: even now the lauded Aṣvins are beside us. With promptest aid they come at morn and evening, the worshipper's most blessed guards from trouble.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒ता या॑तं संग॒वे प्रा॒तरह्नो॑ म॒ध्यंदि॑न॒ उदि॑ता॒ सूर्य॑स्य दिवा॒ नक्त॒मव॑सा॒ शंत॑मेन॒ नेदानीं॑ पी॒तिर॒श्विना त॑तान
verses.transliteration: utā́ yātaṃ saṃgavé prātár áhno  madhyáṃdina úditā sū́ryasya  dívā náktam ávasā śáṃtamena  nédā́nīm pītír aśvínā́ tatāna

translation.text: Yea, come at milking-time, at early morning, at noon of day and when the Sun is setting, By day, by night, with favour most auspicious. Not only now the draught hath drawn the Aṣvins.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒दं हि वां॑ प्र॒दिवि॒ स्थान॒मोक॑ इ॒मे गृ॒हा अ॑श्विने॒दं दु॑रो॒णम् आ नो॑ दि॒वो बृ॑ह॒तः पर्व॑ता॒दाद्भ्यो या॑त॒मिष॒मूर्जं॒ वह॑न्ता
verses.transliteration: idáṃ hí vām pradívi sthā́nam ókaḥ-  imé gr̥hā́ aśvinedáṃ duroṇám  ā́ no divó br̥hatáḥ párvatād ā́  -adbhyó yātam íṣam ū́rjaṃ váhantā

translation.text: For this place, Aṣvins, was of old your dwelling, these were your houses, this your habitation. Come to us from high heaven and from the mountain. Come from the waters bringing food and vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सम॒श्विनो॒रव॑सा॒ नूत॑नेन मयो॒भुवा॑ सु॒प्रणी॑ती गमेम आ नो॑ र॒यिं व॑हत॒मोत वी॒राना विश्वा॑न्यमृता॒ सौभ॑गानि
verses.transliteration: sám aśvínor ávasā nū́tanena  mayobhúvā supráṇītī gamema  ā́ no rayíṃ vahatam ótá vīrā́n  ā́ víśvāny amr̥tā saúbhagāni

translation.text: May we obtain the Aṣvins' newest favour, and gain their health-bestowing happy guidance. Bring riches hither unto us, and heroes, and all felicity and joy, Immortals!

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रा॒त॒र्यावा॑णा प्रथ॒मा य॑जध्वं पु॒रा गृध्रा॒दर॑रुषः पिबातः प्रा॒तर्हि य॒ज्ञम॒श्विना॑ द॒धाते॒ प्र शं॑सन्ति क॒वयः॑ पूर्व॒भाजः॑
verses.transliteration: prātaryā́vāṇā prathamā́ yajadhvam  purā́ gŕ̥dhrād áraruṣaḥ pibātaḥ  prātár hí yajñám aśvínā dadhā́te  prá śaṃsanti kaváyaḥ pūrvabhā́jaḥ

translation.text: FIRST worship those who come at early morning: let the Twain drink before the giftless niggard. The Aṣvins claim the sacrifice at daybreak: the sages yielding the first share extol them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्रा॒तर्य॑जध्वम॒श्विना॑ हिनोत॒ न सा॒यम॑स्ति देव॒या अजु॑ष्टम् उ॒तान्यो अ॒स्मद्य॑जते॒ वि चावः॒ पूर्वः॑पूर्वो॒ यज॑मानो॒ वनी॑यान्
verses.transliteration: prātár yajadhvam aśvínā hinota  ná sāyám asti devayā́ ájuṣṭam  utā́nyó asmád yajate ví cā́vaḥ  pū́rvaḥ-pūrvo yájamāno vánīyān

translation.text: Worship at dawn and instigate the Aṣvins:nor is the worshipper at eve rejected. Besides ourselves another craves and worships: each first in worship is most highly favoured.

verses.sanskrit_deva: हिर॑ण्यत्व॒ङ्मधु॑वर्णो घृ॒तस्नुः॒ पृक्षो॒ वह॒न्ना रथो॑ वर्तते वाम् मनो॑जवा अश्विना॒ वात॑रंहा॒ येना॑तिया॒थो दु॑रि॒तानि॒ विश्वा॑
verses.transliteration: híraṇyatvaṅ mádhuvarṇo ghr̥tásnuḥ  pŕ̥kṣo váhann ā́ rátho vartate vām  mánojavā aśvinā vā́taraṃhāḥ-  yénātiyāthó duritā́ni víśvā

translation.text: Covered with gold, meath-tinted, dropping fatness, your chariot with its freight of food comes hither, Swift as thought, Aṣvins, rapid as the tempest, wherewith ye travel over all obstructions.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यो भूयि॑ष्ठं॒ नास॑त्याभ्यां वि॒वेष॒ चनि॑ष्ठं पि॒त्वो रर॑ते विभा॒गे स तो॒कम॑स्य पीपर॒च्छमी॑भि॒रनू॑र्ध्वभासः॒ सद॒मित्तु॑तुर्यात्
verses.transliteration: yó bhū́yiṣṭhaṃ nā́satyābhyāṃ vivéṣa  cániṣṭham pitvó rárate vibhāgé  sá tokám asya pīparac chámībhir  ánūrdhvabhāsaḥ sádam ít tuturyāt

translation.text: He who hath served most often the Nâsatyas, and gives the sweetest food at distribution, Furthers with his own holy works his offspring, and ever passes those whose flames ascend not.

verses.sanskrit_deva: सम॒श्विनो॒रव॑सा॒ नूत॑नेन मयो॒भुवा॑ सु॒प्रणी॑ती गमेम आ नो॑ र॒यिं व॑हत॒मोत वी॒राना विश्वा॑न्यमृता॒ सौभ॑गानि
verses.transliteration: sám aśvínor ávasā nū́tanena  mayobhúvā supráṇītī gamema  ā́ no rayíṃ vahatam ótá vīrā́n  ā́ víśvāny amr̥tā saúbhagāni

translation.text: May we obtain the Aṣvins' newest favour, and gain their health-bestowing happy ildance. Bring riches hither unto us, and heroes, and all felicity and joy, Immortals!

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वि॑ना॒वेह ग॑च्छतं॒ नास॑त्या॒ मा वि वे॑नतम् हं॒सावि॑व पतत॒मा सु॒ताँ उप॑
verses.transliteration: áśvināv éhá gachataṃ  nā́satyā mā́ ví venatam  haṃsā́v iva patatam ā́ sutā́m̐ úpa

translation.text: YE Aṣvins, hither come to us: Nâsatyas, be not disinclined. Fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वि॑ना हरि॒णावि॑व गौ॒रावि॒वानु॒ यव॑सम् हं॒सावि॑व पतत॒मा सु॒ताँ उप॑
verses.transliteration: áśvinā hariṇā́v iva  gaurā́v ivā́nu yávasam  haṃsā́v iva patatam ā́ sutā́m̐ úpa

translation.text: O Aṣvins, like a pair of deer, like two wild cattle to the mead: Fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अश्वि॑ना वाजिनीवसू जु॒षेथां॑ य॒ज्ञमि॒ष्टये॑ हं॒सावि॑व पतत॒मा सु॒ताँ उप॑
verses.transliteration: áśvinā vājinīvasū  juṣéthāṃ yajñám iṣṭáye  haṃsā́v iva patatam ā́ sutā́m̐ úpa

translation.text: O Aṣvins rich in gifts, accept our sacrifice to prosper it: Fly hither like two swans unto the juice we shed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अत्रि॒र्यद्वा॑मव॒रोह॑न्नृ॒बीस॒मजो॑हवी॒न्नाध॑मानेव॒ योषा॑ श्ये॒नस्य॑ चि॒ज्जव॑सा॒ नूत॑ने॒नाग॑च्छतमश्विना॒ शंत॑मेन
verses.transliteration: átrir yád vām avaróhann r̥bī́sam  ájohavīn nā́dhamāneva yóṣā  śyenásya cij jávasā nū́tanena-  -ā́gachatam aśvinā śáṃtamena

translation.text: As Atri when descending to the cavem called on you loudly like a wailing woman. Ye came to him, O Aṣvins, with the freshest and most auspicious fleetness of a falcon.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि जि॑हीष्व वनस्पते॒ योनिः॒ सूष्य॑न्त्या इव श्रु॒तं मे॑ अश्विना॒ हवं॑ स॒प्तव॑ध्रिं च मुञ्चतम्
verses.transliteration: ví jihīṣva vanaspate  yóniḥ sū́ṣyantyā iva  śrutám me aśvinā hávaṃ  saptávadhriṃ ca muñcatam

translation.text: Tree, part asunder like the side of her who bringeth forth a child. Ye Aṣvins, listen to my call: loose Saptavadhri from his bonds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: भी॒ताय॒ नाध॑मानाय॒ ऋष॑ये स॒प्तव॑ध्रये मा॒याभि॑रश्विना यु॒वं वृ॒क्षं सं च॒ वि चा॑चथः
verses.transliteration: bhītā́ya nā́dhamānāya  ŕ̥ṣaye saptávadhraye  māyā́bhir aśvinā yuváṃ  vr̥kṣáṃ sáṃ ca ví cācathaḥ

translation.text: For Saptavadhri, for the seer affrighted when he wept and wafled, Ye, Aṣvins, with your magic powers rent up the tree and shattered it.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथा॒ वातः॑ पुष्क॒रिणीं॑ समि॒ङ्गय॑ति स॒र्वतः॑ ए॒वा ते॒ गर्भ॑ एजतु नि॒रैतु॒ दश॑मास्यः
verses.transliteration: yáthā vā́taḥ puṣkaríṇīṃ  samiṅgáyati sarvátaḥ  evā́ te gárbha ejatu  niraítu dáśamāsyaḥ

translation.text: Like as the wind on every side ruffles a pool of lotuses, So stir in thee the babe unborn, so may the ten-month babe descend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यथा॒ वातो॒ यथा॒ वनं॒ यथा॑ समु॒द्र एज॑ति ए॒वा त्वं द॑शमास्य स॒हावे॑हि ज॒रायु॑णा
verses.transliteration: yáthā vā́to yáthā vánaṃ  yáthā samudrá éjati  evā́ tváṃ daśamāsya  sahā́vehi jarā́yuṇā

translation.text: Like as the wind, like as the wood, like as the sea is set astir, So also, ten-month babe, descend together with the after-birth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दश॒ मासा॑ञ्छशया॒नः कु॑मा॒रो अधि॑ मा॒तरि॑ नि॒रैतु॑ जी॒वो अक्ष॑तो जी॒वो जीव॑न्त्या॒ अधि॑
verses.transliteration: dáśa mā́sāñ chaśayānáḥ  kumāró ádhi mātári  niraítu jīvó ákṣato  jīvó jī́vantyā ádhi

translation.text: The child who hath for ten months' time been lying in his mother's side,– May he come forth alive, unharmed, yea, livingfrorn the living dame.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हे नो॑ अ॒द्य बो॑ध॒योषो॑ रा॒ये दि॒वित्म॑ती यथा॑ चिन्नो॒ अबो॑धयः स॒त्यश्र॑वसि वा॒य्ये सुजा॑ते॒ अश्व॑सूनृते
verses.transliteration: mahé no adyá bodhaya-  -úṣo rāyé divítmatī  yáthā cin no ábodhayaḥ  satyáśravasi vāyyé  sújāte áśvasūnr̥te

translation.text: O HEAVENLY Dawn, awaken us to ample opulence to-day Even as thou hast wakened us with Satyaṣravas, Vayya's son, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

verses.sanskrit_deva: या सु॑नी॒थे शौ॑चद्र॒थे व्यौच्छो॑ दुहितर्दिवः सा व्यु॑च्छ॒ सही॑यसि स॒त्यश्र॑वसि वा॒य्ये सुजा॑ते॒ अश्व॑सूनृते
verses.transliteration: yā́ sunīthé śaucadrathé  vy aúcho duhitar divaḥ  sā́ vy ùcha sáhīyasi  satyáśravasi vāyyé  sújāte áśvasūnr̥te

translation.text: Daughter of Heaven, thou dawnedst on Sunîtha Ṣuchadratha's son, So dawn thou on one mightier still, on Satyaṣravas, Vayya's son, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

verses.sanskrit_deva: सा नो॑ अ॒द्याभ॒रद्व॑सु॒र्व्यु॑च्छा दुहितर्दिवः यो व्यौच्छः॒ सही॑यसि स॒त्यश्र॑वसि वा॒य्ये सुजा॑ते॒ अश्व॑सूनृते
verses.transliteration: sā́ no adyā́bharádvasur  vy ùchā duhitar divaḥ  yó vy aúchaḥ sáhīyasi  satyáśravasi vāyyé  sújāte áśvasūnr̥te

translation.text: So, bringing treasure, dawn to-day on us thou Daughter of the Sky, As thou, O mightier yet. didst shine for Satyaṣravas, Vayya's son, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि ये त्वा॑ विभावरि॒ स्तोमै॑र्गृ॒णन्ति॒ वह्न॑यः म॒घैर्म॑घोनि सु॒श्रियो॒ दाम॑न्वन्तः सुरा॒तयः॒ सुजा॑ते॒ अश्व॑सूनृते
verses.transliteration: abhí yé tvā vibhāvari  stómair gr̥ṇánti váhnayaḥ  maghaír maghoni suśríyo  dā́manvantaḥ surātáyaḥ  sújāte áśvasūnr̥te

translation.text: Here round about thee are the priests who laud thee, Bright One, with their hymns, And men with gifts, O Bounteous Dame, splendid with wealth and offering much, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

verses.sanskrit_deva: यच्चि॒द्धि ते॑ ग॒णा इ॒मे छ॒दय॑न्ति म॒घत्त॑ये परि॑ चि॒द्वष्ट॑यो दधु॒र्दद॑तो॒ राधो॒ अह्र॑यं॒ सुजा॑ते॒ अश्व॑सूनृते
verses.transliteration: yác cid dhí te gaṇā́ imé  chadáyanti magháttaye  pári cid váṣṭayo dadhur  dádato rā́dho áhrayaṃ  sújāte áśvasūnr̥te

translation.text: Whatever these thy bands perform to please thee or to win them wealth, E'en fain they gird us round and give rich gifts which ne'er are reft away, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

verses.sanskrit_deva: ऐषु॑ धा वी॒रव॒द्यश॒ उषो॑ मघोनि सू॒रिषु॑ ये नो॒ राधां॒स्यह्र॑या म॒घवा॑नो॒ अरा॑सत॒ सुजा॑ते॒ अश्व॑सूनृते
verses.transliteration: aíṣu dhā vīrávad yáśaḥ  úṣo maghoni sūríṣu  yé no rā́dhāṃsy áhrayā  maghávāno árāsata  sújāte áśvasūnr̥te

translation.text: Give to these wealthy patrons fame, O affluent Dawn, with hero sons, To these our princes who have brought rich gifts ne'er to be reft away, highborn! delightful with thy steeds!

verses.sanskrit_deva: तेभ्यो॑ द्यु॒म्नं बृ॒हद्यश॒ उषो॑ मघो॒न्या व॑ह ये नो॒ राधां॒स्यश्व्या॑ ग॒व्या भज॑न्त सू॒रयः॒ सुजा॑ते॒ अश्व॑सूनृते
verses.transliteration: tébhyo dyumnám br̥hád yáśaḥ-  úṣo maghony ā́ vaha  yé no rā́dhāṃsy áśvyā  gavyā́ bhájanta sūráyaḥ  sújāte áśvasūnr̥te

translation.text: Bring lofty and resplendent fame, O thou munificent Dawn, to these Our wealthy patrons who bestow rich gifts on us of steeds and kine, high-born! delightful with thy steeds!

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त नो॒ गोम॑ती॒रिष॒ आ व॑हा दुहितर्दिवः सा॒कं सूर्य॑स्य र॒श्मिभिः॑ शु॒क्रैः शोच॑द्भिर॒र्चिभिः॒ सुजा॑ते॒ अश्व॑सूनृते
verses.transliteration: utá no gómatīr íṣaḥ-  ā́ vahā duhitar divaḥ  sākáṃ sū́ryasya raśmíbhiḥ  śukraíḥ śócadbhir arcíbhiḥ  sújāte áśvasūnr̥te

translation.text: Bring us, O Daughter of the Sky, subsistence in our herds of kine, Together with the sunbeams, with the shine of pure refulgent flames, highborn! delightful with thy steeds!

verses.sanskrit_deva: व्यु॑च्छा दुहितर्दिवो॒ मा चि॒रं त॑नुथा॒ अपः॑ नेत्त्वा॑ स्ते॒नं यथा॑ रि॒पुं तपा॑ति॒ सूरो॑ अ॒र्चिषा॒ सुजा॑ते॒ अश्व॑सूनृते
verses.transliteration: vy ùchā duhitar divaḥ  mā́ ciráṃ tanuthā ápaḥ  nét tvā stenáṃ yáthā ripúṃ  tápāti sū́ro arcíṣā  sújāte áśvasūnr̥te

translation.text: O Daughter of the Sky, shine forth; delay not to perform thy task. Let not the Sun with fervent heat consume thee like a robber foe, high-born! delightful with the steeds!

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒ताव॒द्वेदु॑ष॒स्त्वं भूयो॑ वा॒ दातु॑मर्हसि या स्तो॒तृभ्यो॑ विभावर्यु॒च्छन्ती॒ न प्र॒मीय॑से॒ सुजा॑ते॒ अश्व॑सूनृते
verses.transliteration: etā́vad véd uṣas tvám  bhū́yo vā dā́tum arhasi  yā́ stotŕ̥bhyo vibhāvari-  uchántī ná pramī́yase  sújāte áśvasūnr̥te

translation.text: So much, and more exceedingly, O Dawn, it suits thee to bestow, Thou Radiant One who ceasest not to shine for those who sing thy praise, highborn! delightful with thy steeds!

verses.sanskrit_deva: द्यु॒तद्या॑मानं बृह॒तीमृ॒तेन॑ ऋ॒ताव॑रीमरु॒णप्सुं॑ विभा॒तीम् दे॒वीमु॒षसं॒ स्व॑रा॒वह॑न्तीं॒ प्रति॒ विप्रा॑सो म॒तिभि॑र्जरन्ते
verses.transliteration: dyutádyāmānam br̥hatī́m r̥téna  r̥tā́varīm aruṇápsuṃ vibhātī́m  devī́m uṣásaṃ svàr āváhantīm  práti víprāso matíbhir jarante

translation.text: THE singers welcome with their hymns and praises the Goddess Dawn who bringeth in the sunlight, Sublime, by Law true to eternal Order, bright on her path, red-tinted, far-refulgent.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒षा जनं॑ दर्श॒ता बो॒धय॑न्ती सु॒गान्प॒थः कृ॑ण्व॒ती या॒त्यग्रे॑ बृ॒ह॒द्र॒था बृ॑ह॒ती वि॑श्वमि॒न्वोषा ज्योति॑र्यच्छ॒त्यग्रे॒ अह्ना॑म्
verses.transliteration: eṣā́ jánaṃ darśatā́ bodháyantī  sugā́n patháḥ kr̥ṇvatī́ yāty ágre  br̥hadrathā́ br̥hatī́ viśvaminvā́-  -uṣā́ jyótir yachaty ágre áhnām

translation.text: She comes in front, fair, rousing up the people, making the pathways easy to be travelled. High, on her lofty chariot, all-impelling, Dawn gives her splendour at the days' beginning.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒षा गोभि॑ररु॒णेभि॑र्युजा॒नास्रे॑धन्ती र॒यिमप्रा॑यु चक्रे प॒थो रद॑न्ती सुवि॒ताय॑ दे॒वी पु॑रुष्टु॒ता वि॒श्ववा॑रा॒ वि भा॑ति
verses.transliteration: eṣā́ góbhir aruṇébhir yujānā́-  -ásredhantī rayím áprāyu cakre  pathó rádantī suvitā́ya devī́  puruṣṭutā́ viśvávārā ví bhāti

translation.text: She, harnessing her car with purple oxen. injuring none, hath brought perpetual riches. Opening paths to happiness, the Goddess shines, praised by all, giver of every blessing.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒षा व्ये॑नी भवति द्वि॒बर्हा॑ आविष्कृण्वा॒ना त॒न्वं॑ पु॒रस्ता॑त् ऋ॒तस्य॒ पन्था॒मन्वे॑ति सा॒धु प्र॑जान॒तीव॒ न दिशो॑ मिनाति
verses.transliteration: eṣā́ vyènī bhavati dvibárhāḥ-  āviṣkr̥ṇvānā́ tanvàm purástāt  r̥tásya pánthām ánv eti sādhú  prajānatī́va ná díśo mināti

translation.text: With changing tints she gleams in double splendour while from the eastward she displays her body. She travels perfectly the path of Order, nor fails to reach, as one who knows, the quarters.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒षा शु॒भ्रा न त॒न्वो॑ विदा॒नोर्ध्वेव॑ स्ना॒ती दृ॒शये॑ नो अस्थात् अप॒ द्वेषो॒ बाध॑माना॒ तमां॑स्यु॒षा दि॒वो दु॑हि॒ता ज्योति॒षागा॑त्
verses.transliteration: eṣā́ śubhrā́ ná tanvò vidānā́-  -ūrdhvéva snātī́ dr̥śáye no asthāt  ápa dvéṣo bā́dhamānā támāṃsi-  uṣā́ divó duhitā́ jyótiṣā́gāt

translation.text: As conscious that her limbs are bright with bathing, she stands, as 'twere, erect that we may see her. Driving away malignity and darkness, Dawn, Child of Heaven, hath come to us with lustre.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒षा प्र॑ती॒ची दु॑हि॒ता दि॒वो नॄन्योषे॑व भ॒द्रा नि रि॑णीते॒ अप्सः॑ व्यू॒र्ण्व॒ती दा॒शुषे॒ वार्या॑णि॒ पुन॒र्ज्योति॑र्युव॒तिः पू॒र्वथा॑कः
verses.transliteration: eṣā́ pratīcī́ duhitā́ divó nr̥̄́n  yóṣeva bhadrā́ ní riṇīte ápsaḥ  vyūrṇvatī́ dāśúṣe vā́ryāṇi  púnar jyótir yuvatíḥ pūrváthākaḥ

translation.text: The Daughter of the Sky, like some chaste woman, bends, opposite to men, her forehead downward. The Maid, disclosing boons to him who worships, hath brought again the daylight as aforetime.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यु॒ञ्जते॒ मन॑ उ॒त यु॑ञ्जते॒ धियो॒ विप्रा॒ विप्र॑स्य बृह॒तो वि॑प॒श्चितः॑ वि होत्रा॑ दधे वयुना॒विदेक॒ इन्म॒ही दे॒वस्य॑ सवि॒तुः परि॑ष्टुतिः
verses.transliteration: yuñjáte mána utá yuñjate dhíyo  víprā víprasya br̥ható vipaścítaḥ  ví hótrā dadhe vayunāvíd éka ít-  mahī́ devásya savitúḥ páriṣṭutiḥ

translation.text: THE priests of him the lofty Priest well-skilled in hymns harness their spirit, yea, harness their holy thoughts. He only knowing works assigns their priestly tasks. Yea, lofty is the praise of Savitar the God.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वा॑ रू॒पाणि॒ प्रति॑ मुञ्चते क॒विः प्रासा॑वीद्भ॒द्रं द्वि॒पदे॒ चतु॑ष्पदे वि नाक॑मख्यत्सवि॒ता वरे॒ण्योऽनु॑ प्र॒याण॑मु॒षसो॒ वि रा॑जति
verses.transliteration: víśvā rūpā́ṇi práti muñcate kavíḥ  prā́sāvīd bhadráṃ dvipáde cátuṣpade  ví nā́kam akhyat savitā́ váreṇyaḥ-  -ánu prayā́ṇam uṣáso ví rājati

translation.text: The Sapient One arrays himself in every form: for quadruped and biped he hath brought forth good. Excellent Savitar hath looked on heaven's high vault, and shineth after the outgoing of the Dawn.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॑ प्र॒याण॒मन्व॒न्य इद्य॒युर्दे॒वा दे॒वस्य॑ महि॒मान॒मोज॑सा यः पार्थि॑वानि विम॒मे स एत॑शो॒ रजां॑सि दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता म॑हित्व॒ना
verses.transliteration: yásya prayā́ṇam ánv anyá íd yayúr  devā́ devásya mahimā́nam ójasā  yáḥ pā́rthivāni vimamé sá étaśo  rájāṃsi deváḥ savitā́ mahitvanā́

translation.text: Even he, the God whose going-forth and majesty the other Deities have followed with their might, He who hath measured the terrestrial regions out by his great power, he is the Courser Savitar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒त या॑सि सवित॒स्त्रीणि॑ रोच॒नोत सूर्य॑स्य र॒श्मिभिः॒ समु॑च्यसि उ॒त रात्री॑मुभ॒यतः॒ परी॑यस उ॒त मि॒त्रो भ॑वसि देव॒ धर्म॑भिः
verses.transliteration: utá yāsi savitas trī́ṇi rocanā́-  -utá sū́ryasya raśmíbhiḥ sám ucyasi  utá rā́trīm ubhayátaḥ párīyase-  utá mitró bhavasi deva dhármabhiḥ

translation.text: To the three spheres of light thou goest, Savitar, and with the rays of Sidrya thou combinest thee. Around, on both sides thou encompassest the night: yea, thou, O God, art Mitra through thy righteous laws.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒तेशि॑षे प्रस॒वस्य॒ त्वमेक॒ इदु॒त पू॒षा भ॑वसि देव॒ याम॑भिः उ॒तेदं विश्वं॒ भुव॑नं॒ वि रा॑जसि श्या॒वाश्व॑स्ते सवितः॒ स्तोम॑मानशे
verses.transliteration: utéśiṣe prasavásya tvám éka íd  utá pūṣā́ bhavasi deva yā́mabhiḥ  utédáṃ víśvam bhúvanaṃ ví rājasi  śyāvā́śvas te savita stómam ānaśe

translation.text: Over all generation thou art Lord alone: Pûshan art thou, O God, in all thy goings-forth. Yea, thou hast domination over all this world. Ṣyâvâṣva hath brought praise to thee, O Savitar,

verses.sanskrit_deva: तत्स॑वि॒तुर्वृ॑णीमहे व॒यं दे॒वस्य॒ भोज॑नम् श्रेष्ठं॑ सर्व॒धात॑मं॒ तुरं॒ भग॑स्य धीमहि
verses.transliteration: tát savitúr vr̥ṇīmahe  vayáṃ devásya bhójanam  śréṣṭhaṃ sarvadhā́tamaṃ  túram bhágasya dhīmahi

translation.text: WE crave of Savitar the God this treasure much to be enjoyed. The best, all-yielding, conquering gift of Bhaga we would gladly win.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अस्य॒ हि स्वय॑शस्तरं सवि॒तुः कच्च॒न प्रि॒यम् न मि॒नन्ति॑ स्व॒राज्य॑म्
verses.transliteration: ásya hí sváyaśastaraṃ  savitúḥ kác caná priyám  ná minánti svarā́jyam

translation.text: Savitar's own supremacy, most glorious and beloved of all, No one diminisheth in aught.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स हि रत्ना॑नि दा॒शुषे॑ सु॒वाति॑ सवि॒ता भगः॑ तं भा॒गं चि॒त्रमी॑महे
verses.transliteration: sá hí rátnāni dāśúṣe  suvā́ti savitā́ bhágaḥ  tám bhāgáṃ citrám īmahe

translation.text: For Savitar who is Bhaga shall send riches to his worshipper. That wondrous portion we implore.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒द्या नो॑ देव सवितः प्र॒जाव॑त्सावीः॒ सौभ॑गम् परा॑ दु॒ष्ष्वप्न्यं॑ सुव
verses.transliteration: adyā́ no deva savitaḥ  prajā́vat sāvīḥ saúbhagam  párā duṣvápnyaṃ suva

translation.text: Send us this day, God Savitar, prosperity with progeny. Drive thou the evil dream away.

verses.sanskrit_deva: विश्वा॑नि देव सवितर्दुरि॒तानि॒ परा॑ सुव यद्भ॒द्रं तन्न॒ आ सु॑व
verses.transliteration: víśvāni deva savitar  duritā́ni párā suva  yád bhadráṃ tán na ā́ suva

translation.text: Savitar, God, send far away all sorrows and calamities, And send us only what is good.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अना॑गसो॒ अदि॑तये दे॒वस्य॑ सवि॒तुः स॒वे विश्वा॑ वा॒मानि॑ धीमहि
verses.transliteration: ánāgaso áditaye  devásya savitúḥ savé  víśvā vāmā́ni dhīmahi

translation.text: Sinless in sight of Aditi through the God Savitar's influence, May we obtain all lovely things.

verses.sanskrit_deva: आ वि॒श्वदे॑वं॒ सत्प॑तिं सू॒क्तैर॒द्या वृ॑णीमहे स॒त्यस॑वं सवि॒तार॑म्
verses.transliteration: ā́ viśvádevaṃ sátpatiṃ  sūktaír adyā́ vr̥ṇīmahe  satyásavaṃ savitā́ram

translation.text: We with our hymns this day elect the general God, Lord of the good, Savitar whose decrees are true.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य इ॒मे उ॒भे अह॑नी पु॒र एत्यप्र॑युच्छन् स्वा॒धीर्दे॒वः स॑वि॒ता
verses.transliteration: yá imé ubhé áhanī  purá éty áprayuchan  svādhī́r deváḥ savitā́

translation.text: He who for ever vigilant precedes these Twain, the Day and Night, Is Savitar the thoughtful God.

verses.sanskrit_deva: य इ॒मा विश्वा॑ जा॒तान्या॑श्रा॒वय॑ति॒ श्लोके॑न प्र च॑ सु॒वाति॑ सवि॒ता
verses.transliteration: yá imā́ víśvā jātā́ni-  āśrāváyati ślókena  prá ca suvā́ti savitā́

translation.text: He who gives glory unto all these living creatures with the song, And brings them forth, is Savitar.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अच्छा॑ वद त॒वसं॑ गी॒र्भिरा॒भिः स्तु॒हि प॒र्जन्यं॒ नम॒सा वि॑वास कनि॑क्रदद्वृष॒भो जी॒रदा॑नू॒ रेतो॑ दधा॒त्योष॑धीषु॒ गर्भ॑म्
verses.transliteration: áchā vada tavásaṃ gīrbhír ābhíḥ-  stuhí parjányaṃ námasā́ vivāsa  kánikradad vr̥ṣabhó jīrádānuḥ-  réto dadhāty óṣadhīṣu gárbham

translation.text: SING with these songs thy welcome to the Mighty, with adoration praise and call Parjanya. The Bull, loud roaring, swift to send his bounty, lays in the plants the seed. for germination.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वि वृ॒क्षान्ह॑न्त्यु॒त ह॑न्ति र॒क्षसो॒ विश्वं॑ बिभाय॒ भुव॑नं म॒हाव॑धात् उ॒ताना॑गा ईषते॒ वृष्ण्या॑वतो॒ यत्प॒र्जन्यः॑ स्त॒नय॒न्हन्ति॑ दु॒ष्कृतः॑
verses.transliteration: ví vr̥kṣā́n hanty utá hanti rakṣáso  víśvam bibhāya bhúvanam mahā́vadhāt  utā́nāgā īṣate vŕ̥ṣṇyāvato  yát parjánya stanáyan hánti duṣkŕ̥taḥ

translation.text: He smites the trees apart, he slays the demons: all life fears him who wields the mighty weapon. From him exceeding strong fices e'en the guiltless, when thundering Parjanya smites the wicked.

verses.sanskrit_deva: र॒थीव॒ कश॒याश्वाँ॑ अभिक्षि॒पन्ना॒विर्दू॒तान्कृ॑णुते व॒र्ष्याँ॒३॒॑ अह॑ दू॒रात्सिं॒हस्य॑ स्त॒नथा॒ उदी॑रते॒ यत्प॒र्जन्यः॑ कृणु॒ते व॒र्ष्यं१॒॑ नभः॑
verses.transliteration: rathī́va káśayā́śvām̐ abhikṣipánn  āvír dūtā́n kr̥ṇute varṣyā̀m̐ áha  dūrā́t siṃhásya stanáthā úd īrate  yát parjányaḥ kr̥ṇuté varṣyàṃ nábhaḥ

translation.text: Like a car-driver whipping on his horses, he makes the messengers of rain spring forward. Far off resounds the roaring of the lion, what time Parjanya fills the sky with rain-cloud.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वाता॒ वान्ति॑ प॒तय॑न्ति वि॒द्युत॒ उदोष॑धी॒र्जिह॑ते॒ पिन्व॑ते॒ स्वः॑ इरा॒ विश्व॑स्मै॒ भुव॑नाय जायते॒ यत्प॒र्जन्यः॑ पृथि॒वीं रेत॒साव॑ति
verses.transliteration: prá vā́tā vā́nti patáyanti vidyútaḥ-  úd óṣadhīr jíhate pínvate svàḥ  írā víśvasmai bhúvanāya jāyate  yát parjányaḥ pr̥thivī́ṃ rétasā́vati

translation.text: Forth burst the winds, down come the lightning-flashes: the plants shoot up, the realm of light is streaming. Food springs abundant for all living creatures, what time Parjanya quickens earth with moisture.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यस्य॑ व्र॒ते पृ॑थि॒वी नन्न॑मीति॒ यस्य॑ व्र॒ते श॒फव॒ज्जर्भु॑रीति यस्य॑ व्र॒त ओष॑धीर्वि॒श्वरू॑पाः॒ स नः॑ पर्जन्य॒ महि॒ शर्म॑ यच्छ
verses.transliteration: yásya vraté pr̥thivī́ nánnamīti  yásya vraté śaphávaj járbhurīti  yásya vratá óṣadhīr viśvárūpāḥ  sá naḥ parjanya máhi śárma yacha

translation.text: Thou at whose bidding earth bows low before thee, at whose command hoofed cattle fly in terror, At whose behest the plants assume all colours, even thou Parjanya, yield us great protection.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दि॒वो नो॑ वृ॒ष्टिं म॑रुतो ररीध्वं॒ प्र पि॑न्वत॒ वृष्णो॒ अश्व॑स्य॒ धाराः॑ अ॒र्वाङे॒तेन॑ स्तनयि॒त्नुनेह्य॒पो नि॑षि॒ञ्चन्नसु॑रः पि॒ता नः॑
verses.transliteration: divó no vr̥ṣṭím maruto rarīdhvam  prá pinvata vŕ̥ṣṇo áśvasya dhā́rāḥ  arvā́ṅ eténa stanayitnúnéhi-  apó niṣiñcánn ásuraḥ pitā́ naḥ

translation.text: Send down for us the rain of heaven, ye Maruts, and let the Stallion's flood descend in torrents. Come hither with this thunder while thou pourest the waters down, our heavenly Lord and Father.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒भि क्र॑न्द स्त॒नय॒ गर्भ॒मा धा॑ उद॒न्वता॒ परि॑ दीया॒ रथे॑न दृतिं॒ सु क॑र्ष॒ विषि॑तं॒ न्य॑ञ्चं स॒मा भ॑वन्तू॒द्वतो॑ निपा॒दाः
verses.transliteration: abhí kranda stanáya gárbham ā́ dhāḥ-  udanvátā pári dīyā ráthena  dŕ̥tiṃ sú karṣa víṣitaṃ nyàñcaṃ  samā́ bhavantūdváto nipādā́ḥ

translation.text: Thunder and roar: the germ of life deposit. Fly round us on thy chariot waterladen. Thine opened water-skin draw with thee downward, and let the hollows and the heights be level.

verses.sanskrit_deva: म॒हान्तं॒ कोश॒मुद॑चा॒ नि षि॑ञ्च॒ स्यन्द॑न्तां कु॒ल्या विषि॑ताः पु॒रस्ता॑त् घृ॒तेन॒ द्यावा॑पृथि॒वी व्यु॑न्धि सुप्रपा॒णं भ॑वत्व॒घ्न्याभ्यः॑
verses.transliteration: mahā́ntaṃ kóśam úd acā ní ṣiñca  syándantāṃ kulyā́ víṣitāḥ purástāt  ghr̥téna dyā́vāpr̥thivī́ vy ùndhi  suprapāṇám bhavatv aghnyā́bhyaḥ

translation.text: Lift up the mighty vessel, pour down water, and let the liberated streams rush forward. Saturate both the earth and heaven with fatness, and for the cows let there be drink abundant.

verses.sanskrit_deva: यत्प॑र्जन्य॒ कनि॑क्रदत्स्त॒नय॒न्हंसि॑ दु॒ष्कृतः॑ प्रती॒दं विश्वं॑ मोदते॒ यत्किं च॑ पृथि॒व्यामधि॑
verses.transliteration: yát parjanya kánikradat  stanáyan háṃsi duṣkŕ̥taḥ  prátīdáṃ víśvam modate  yát kíṃ ca pr̥thivyā́m ádhi

translation.text: When thou, with thunder and with roar, Parjanya, smitest sinners down, This universe exults thereat, yea, all that is upon the earth.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अव॑र्षीर्व॒र्षमुदु॒ षू गृ॑भा॒याक॒र्धन्वा॒न्यत्ये॑त॒वा उ॑ अजी॑जन॒ ओष॑धी॒र्भोज॑नाय॒ कमु॒त प्र॒जाभ्यो॑ऽविदो मनी॒षाम्
verses.transliteration: ávarṣīr varṣám úd u ṣū́ gr̥bhāya-  -ákar dhánvāny átyetavā́ u  ájījana óṣadhīr bhójanāya kám  utá prajā́bhyo 'vido manīṣā́m

translation.text: Thou hast poured down the rain-flood now withhold it. Thou hast made desert places fit for travel. Thou hast made herbs to grow for our enjoyment: yea, thou hast won thee praise from living creatures.

verses.sanskrit_deva: बळि॒त्था पर्व॑तानां खि॒द्रं बि॑भर्षि पृथिवि प्र या भूमिं॑ प्रवत्वति म॒ह्ना जि॒नोषि॑ महिनि
verses.transliteration: báḷ itthā́ párvatānāṃ  khidrám bibharṣi pr̥thivi  prá yā́ bhū́mim pravatvati  mahnā́ jinóṣi mahini

translation.text: THOU, of a truth,O Pr̥ithivî, bearest the tool that rends the hills: Thou rich in torrents, who with might quickenest earth, O Mighty One.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्तोमा॑सस्त्वा विचारिणि॒ प्रति॑ ष्टोभन्त्य॒क्तुभिः॑ प्र या वाजं॒ न हेष॑न्तं पे॒रुमस्य॑स्यर्जुनि
verses.transliteration: stómāsas tvā vicāriṇi  práti ṣṭobhanty aktúbhiḥ  prá yā́ vā́jaṃ ná héṣantam  perúm ásyasy arjuni

translation.text: To thee, O wanderer at will, ring out the lauds with beams of day, Who drivest, like a neighing steed, the swelling cloud, O bright of hue.

verses.sanskrit_deva: दृ॒ळ्हा चि॒द्या वन॒स्पती॑न्क्ष्म॒या दर्ध॒र्ष्योज॑सा यत्ते॑ अ॒भ्रस्य॑ वि॒द्युतो॑ दि॒वो वर्ष॑न्ति वृ॒ष्टयः॑
verses.transliteration: dr̥ḷhā́ cid yā́ vánaspátīn  kṣmayā́ dárdharṣy ójasā  yát te abhrásya vidyúto  divó várṣanti vr̥ṣṭáyaḥ

translation.text: Who graspest with thy might on earth. e'en the strong sovrans of the wood, When from the lightning of thy cloud the rain-floods of the heaven descend.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र स॒म्राजे॑ बृ॒हद॑र्चा गभी॒रं ब्रह्म॑ प्रि॒यं वरु॑णाय श्रु॒ताय॑ वि यो ज॒घान॑ शमि॒तेव॒ चर्मो॑प॒स्तिरे॑ पृथि॒वीं सूर्या॑य
verses.transliteration: prá samrā́je br̥hád arcā gabhīrám  bráhma priyáṃ váruṇāya śrutā́ya  ví yó jaghā́na śamitéva cárma-  -upastíre pr̥thivī́ṃ sū́ryāya

translation.text: SING forth a hymn sublime and solemn, grateful to glorious. Varuṇa, imperial Ruler, Who hath struck out, like one who slays the victim, earth as a skin to spread in front of Sûrya.

verses.sanskrit_deva: वने॑षु॒ व्य१॒॑न्तरि॑क्षं ततान॒ वाज॒मर्व॑त्सु॒ पय॑ उ॒स्रिया॑सु हृ॒त्सु क्रतुं॒ वरु॑णो अ॒प्स्व१॒॑ग्निं दि॒वि सूर्य॑मदधा॒त्सोम॒मद्रौ॑
verses.transliteration: váneṣu vy àntárikṣaṃ tatāna  vā́jam árvatsu páya usríyāsu  hr̥tsú krátuṃ váruṇo apsv àgníṃ  diví sū́ryam adadhāt sómam ádrau

translation.text: In the tree-tops the air he hath extended, put milk in kine and vigorous speed in horses, Set intellect in hearts, fire in the waters, Siurya in heaven and Soma on the mountain.

verses.sanskrit_deva: नी॒चीन॑बारं॒ वरु॑णः॒ कव॑न्धं॒ प्र स॑सर्ज॒ रोद॑सी अ॒न्तरि॑क्षम् तेन॒ विश्व॑स्य॒ भुव॑नस्य॒ राजा॒ यवं॒ न वृ॒ष्टिर्व्यु॑नत्ति॒ भूम॑
verses.transliteration: nīcī́nabāraṃ váruṇaḥ kávandham  prá sasarja ródasī antárikṣam  téna víśvasya bhúvanasya rā́jā  yávaṃ ná vr̥ṣṭír vy ùnatti bhū́ma

translation.text: Varuṇa lets the big cask, opening downward, flow through the heaven and earth and air's midregion. Therewith the universe's Sovran waters earth as the shower of rain bedews the barley.

verses.sanskrit_deva: उ॒नत्ति॒ भूमिं॑ पृथि॒वीमु॒त द्यां य॒दा दु॒ग्धं वरु॑णो॒ वष्ट्यादित् सम॒भ्रेण॑ वसत॒ पर्व॑तासस्तविषी॒यन्तः॑ श्रथयन्त वी॒राः
verses.transliteration: unátti bhū́mim pr̥thivī́m utá dyā́ṃ  yadā́ dugdháṃ váruṇo váṣṭy ā́d ít  sám abhréṇa vasata párvatāsas  taviṣīyántaḥ śrathayanta vīrā́ḥ

translation.text: When Varuṇa is fain for milk he moistens the sky, the land, and earth to her foundation. Then straight the mountains clothe them in the rain-cloud: the Heroes, putting forth their vigour, loose them.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मामू॒ ष्वा॑सु॒रस्य॑ श्रु॒तस्य॑ म॒हीं मा॒यां वरु॑णस्य॒ प्र वो॑चम् माने॑नेव तस्थि॒वाँ अ॒न्तरि॑क्षे॒ वि यो म॒मे पृ॑थि॒वीं सूर्ये॑ण
verses.transliteration: imā́m ū ṣv ā̀surásya śrutásya  mahī́m māyā́ṃ váruṇasya prá vocam  mā́neneva tasthivā́m̐ antárikṣe  ví yó mamé pr̥thivī́ṃ sū́ryeṇa

translation.text: I will declare this mighty deed of magic, of glorious Varuṇa the Lord Immortal, Who standing in the firmament hath meted the earth out with the Sun as with a measure.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इ॒मामू॒ नु क॒वित॑मस्य मा॒यां म॒हीं दे॒वस्य॒ नकि॒रा द॑धर्ष एकं॒ यदु॒द्ना न पृ॒णन्त्येनी॑रासि॒ञ्चन्ती॑र॒वन॑यः समु॒द्रम्
verses.transliteration: imā́m ū nú kavítamasya māyā́m  mahī́ṃ devásya nákir ā́ dadharṣa  ékaṃ yád udnā́ ná pr̥ṇánty énīr  āsiñcántīr avánayaḥ samudrám

translation.text: None, verily, hath ever let or hindered this the most wise God's mighty deed of magic, Whereby with all their flood, the lucid rivers fill not one sea wherein they pour their waters.
