verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒र्य॒म्यं॑ वरुण मि॒त्र्यं॑ वा॒ सखा॑यं वा॒ सद॒मिद्भ्रात॑रं वा वे॒शं वा॒ नित्यं॑ वरु॒णार॑णं वा॒ यत्सी॒माग॑श्चकृ॒मा शि॒श्रथ॒स्तत्
verses.transliteration: aryamyàṃ varuṇa mitryàṃ vā  sákhāyaṃ vā sádam íd bhrā́taraṃ vā  veśáṃ vā nítyaṃ varuṇā́raṇaṃ vā  yát sīm ā́gaś cakr̥mā́ śiśráthas tát

translation.text: If we have sinned against the man who loves us, have ever wronged a brother, friend, or comrade, The neighbour ever with us, or a stranger, O Varuṇa, remove from us the trespass.

verses.sanskrit_deva: कि॒त॒वासो॒ यद्रि॑रि॒पुर्न दी॒वि यद्वा॑ घा स॒त्यमु॒त यन्न वि॒द्म सर्वा॒ ता वि ष्य॑ शिथि॒रेव॑ दे॒वाधा॑ ते स्याम वरुण प्रि॒यासः॑
verses.transliteration: kitavā́so yád riripúr ná dīví  yád vā ghā satyám utá yán ná vidmá  sárvā tā́ ví ṣya śithiréva deva-  -ádhā te syāma varuṇa priyā́saḥ

translation.text: If we, as gamesters cheat at play, have cheated, done wrong unwittingly or sinned of purpose, Cast all these sins away like loosened fetters, and, Varuṇa let us be thine own beloved.

verses.sanskrit_deva: इन्द्रा॑ग्नी॒ यमव॑थ उ॒भा वाजे॑षु॒ मर्त्य॑म् दृ॒ळ्हा चि॒त्स प्र भे॑दति द्यु॒म्ना वाणी॑रिव त्रि॒तः
verses.transliteration: índrāgnī yám ávathaḥ-  ubhā́ vā́jeṣu mártyam  dr̥ḷhā́ cit sá prá bhedati  dyumnā́ vā́ṇīr iva tritáḥ

translation.text: THE mortal man whom ye, the Twain, Indra and Agni, help in fight, Breaks through e'en strongly-guarded wealth as Trita burst his way through reeds.

verses.sanskrit_deva: या पृत॑नासु दु॒ष्टरा॒ या वाजे॑षु श्र॒वाय्या॑ या पञ्च॑ चर्ष॒णीर॒भी॑न्द्रा॒ग्नी ता ह॑वामहे
verses.transliteration: yā́ pŕ̥tanāsu duṣṭárā  yā́ vā́jeṣu śravā́yyā  yā́ páñca carṣaṇī́r abhí-  indrāgnī́ tā́ havāmahe

translation.text: The Twain invincible in war, worthy to be renowned in frays, Lords of the Fivefold. People, these, Indra and Agni, we invoke.

verses.sanskrit_deva: तयो॒रिदम॑व॒च्छव॑स्ति॒ग्मा दि॒द्युन्म॒घोनोः॑ प्रति॒ द्रुणा॒ गभ॑स्त्यो॒र्गवां॑ वृत्र॒घ्न एष॑ते
verses.transliteration: táyor íd ámavac chávas  tigmā́ didyún maghónoḥ  práti drúṇā gábhastyor  gávāṃ vr̥traghná éṣate

translation.text: Impetuous is their strength, and keen the lightning of the mighty Pair, Which from their arms speeds with the car to Vr̥itra's slayer for the kine.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता वा॒मेषे॒ रथा॑नामिन्द्रा॒ग्नी ह॑वामहे पती॑ तु॒रस्य॒ राध॑सो वि॒द्वांसा॒ गिर्व॑णस्तमा
verses.transliteration: tā́ vām éṣe ráthānām  indrāgnī́ havāmahe  pátī turásya rā́dhaso  vidvā́ṃsā gírvaṇastamā

translation.text: Indra and Agni, we invoke you both, as such, to send your cars: Lords of quick-coming bounty, ye who know, chief lovers of the song.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ता वृ॒धन्ता॒वनु॒ द्यून्मर्ता॑य दे॒वाव॒दभा॑ अर्ह॑न्ता चित्पु॒रो द॒धेंऽशे॑व दे॒वावर्व॑ते
verses.transliteration: tā́ vr̥dhántāv ánu dyū́n  mártāya devā́v adábhā  árhantā cit puró dadhe-  -áṃśeva devā́v árvate

translation.text: These who give increase day by day, Gods without guile for mortal man, Worthy themselves, I honour most, Two Gods as partners, for my horse.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ए॒वेन्द्रा॒ग्निभ्या॒महा॑वि ह॒व्यं शू॒ष्यं॑ घृ॒तं न पू॒तमद्रि॑भिः ता सू॒रिषु॒ श्रवो॑ बृ॒हद्र॒यिं गृ॒णत्सु॑ दिधृत॒मिषं॑ गृ॒णत्सु॑ दिधृतम्
verses.transliteration: evéndrāgníbhyām  áhāvi havyáṃ śūṣyàṃ  ghr̥táṃ ná pūtám ádribhiḥ  tā́ sūríṣu śrávo br̥hád  rayíṃ gr̥ṇátsu didhr̥tam  íṣaṃ gr̥ṇátsu didhr̥tam

translation.text: The strength-bestowing offering thus to Indra-Agni hath been paid, as butter, purified by stones. Deal to our princes high renown, deal wealth to those who sing your praise, deal food to those who sing your praise.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र वो॑ म॒हे म॒तयो॑ यन्तु॒ विष्ण॑वे म॒रुत्व॑ते गिरि॒जा ए॑व॒याम॑रुत् प्र शर्धा॑य॒ प्रय॑ज्यवे सुखा॒दये॑ त॒वसे॑ भ॒न्ददि॑ष्टये॒ धुनि॑व्रताय॒ शव॑से
verses.transliteration: prá vo mahé matáyo yantu víṣṇave  marútvate girijā́ evayā́marut  prá śárdhāya práyajyave sukhādáye  taváse bhandádiṣṭaye  dhúnivratāya śávase

translation.text: To Vishṇu, to the Mighty whom the Maruts follow let your hymns born in song go forth, Evayamarut; To the impetuous, strong band, adorned with bracelets, that rushes on in joy and ever roars for vigour.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ये जा॒ता म॑हि॒ना ये च॒ नु स्व॒यं प्र वि॒द्मना॑ ब्रु॒वत॑ एव॒याम॑रुत् क्रत्वा॒ तद्वो॑ मरुतो॒ नाधृषे॒ शवो॑ दा॒ना म॒ह्ना तदे॑षा॒मधृ॑ष्टासो॒ नाद्र॑यः
verses.transliteration: prá yé jātā́ mahinā́ yé ca nú svayám  prá vidmánā bruváta evayā́marut  krátvā tád vo maruto nā́dhŕ̥ṣe śávo  dānā́ mahnā́ tád eṣām  ádhr̥ṣṭāso nā́drayaḥ

translation.text: They who with might were manifest, and who willingly by their own knowledge told it forth, Evayamarut. Maruts, this strength of yours no wisdom comprehendeth: through their gifts' greatness they are moveless as the mountains.

verses.sanskrit_deva: प्र ये दि॒वो बृ॑ह॒तः शृ॑ण्वि॒रे गि॒रा सु॒शुक्वा॑नः सु॒भ्व॑ एव॒याम॑रुत् न येषा॒मिरी॑ स॒धस्थ॒ ईष्ट॒ आँ अ॒ग्नयो॒ न स्ववि॑द्युतः॒ प्र स्य॒न्द्रासो॒ धुनी॑नाम्
verses.transliteration: prá yé divó br̥hatáḥ śr̥ṇviré girā́  suśúkvānaḥ subhvà evayā́marut  ná yéṣām írī sadhástha ī́ṣṭa ā́m̐  agnáyo ná svávidyutaḥ  prá syandrā́so dhúnīnām

translation.text: Who by the psalm they sing are heard, from lofty heaven, the strong, the brightly shining Ones, Evayamarut; In whose abode there is no mightier one to move them, whose lightnings are as fires, who urge the roaring rivers.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स च॑क्रमे मह॒तो निरु॑रुक्र॒मः स॑मा॒नस्मा॒त्सद॑स एव॒याम॑रुत् य॒दायु॑क्त॒ त्मना॒ स्वादधि॒ ष्णुभि॒र्विष्प॑र्धसो॒ विम॑हसो॒ जिगा॑ति॒ शेवृ॑धो॒ नृभिः॑
verses.transliteration: sá cakrame maható nír urukramáḥ  samānásmāt sádasa evayā́marut  yadā́yukta tmánā svā́d ádhi ṣṇúbhir  víṣpardhaso vímahaso  jígāti śévr̥dho nŕ̥bhiḥ

translation.text: He of the Mighty Stride forth strode, Evayamarut, out of the spacious dwelling-place, their home in common. When he, himself, hath yoked his emulous strong horses on heights, he cometh forth, joy-giving, with the Heroes.

verses.sanskrit_deva: स्व॒नो न वोऽम॑वान्रेजय॒द्वृषा॑ त्वे॒षो य॒यिस्त॑वि॒ष ए॑व॒याम॑रुत् येना॒ सह॑न्त ऋ॒ञ्जत॒ स्वरो॑चिषः॒ स्थार॑श्मानो हिर॒ण्ययाः॑ स्वायु॒धास॑ इ॒ष्मिणः॑
verses.transliteration: svanó ná vó 'mavān rejayad vŕ̥ṣā  tveṣó yayís taviṣá evayā́marut  yénā sáhanta r̥ñjáta svárociṣaḥ-  sthā́raśmāno hiraṇyáyāḥ  svāyudhā́sa iṣmíṇaḥ

translation.text: Like your tremendous roar, the rainer with light flashing, strong, speeding, hath made all tremble, Evayamarut, Wherewith victorious ye, self-luminous, press onward, with strong reins, decked with gold, impetuous and well-weaponed.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒पा॒रो वो॑ महि॒मा वृ॑द्धशवसस्त्वे॒षं शवो॑ऽवत्वेव॒याम॑रुत् स्थाता॑रो॒ हि प्रसि॑तौ सं॒दृशि॒ स्थन॒ ते न॑ उरुष्यता नि॒दः शु॑शु॒क्वांसो॒ नाग्नयः॑
verses.transliteration: apāró vo mahimā́ vr̥ddhaśavasas  tveṣáṃ śávo 'vatv evayā́marut  sthā́tāro hí prásitau saṃdŕ̥śi sthána  té na uruṣyatā nidáḥ  śuśukvā́ṃso nā́gnáyaḥ

translation.text: Unbounded is your greatness, ye of mighty power: may your bright vigour be our aid, Evayamarut; For ye are visible helpers in the time of trouble: like fires, aglow with light, save us from shame and insult.

verses.sanskrit_deva: ते रु॒द्रासः॒ सुम॑खा अ॒ग्नयो॑ यथा तुविद्यु॒म्ना अ॑वन्त्वेव॒याम॑रुत् दी॒र्घं पृ॒थु प॑प्रथे॒ सद्म॒ पार्थि॑वं॒ येषा॒मज्मे॒ष्वा म॒हः शर्धां॒स्यद्भु॑तैनसाम्
verses.transliteration: té rudrā́saḥ súmakhā agnáyo yathā  tuvidyumnā́ avantv evayā́marut  dīrghám pr̥thú paprathe sádma pā́rthivaṃ  yéṣām ájmeṣv ā́ maháḥ  śárdhāṃsy ádbhutainasām

translation.text: So may the Rudras, mighty warriors, Evayamarut, with splendid brilliancy, like fires, be our protectors; They whose terrestrial dwelling-place is wide-extended, whom none suspect of sin, whose bands have lofty courage.

verses.sanskrit_deva: अ॒द्वे॒षो नो॑ मरुतो गा॒तुमेत॑न॒ श्रोता॒ हवं॑ जरि॒तुरे॑व॒याम॑रुत् विष्णो॑र्म॒हः स॑मन्यवो युयोतन॒ स्मद्र॒थ्यो॒३॒॑ न दं॒सनाप॒ द्वेषां॑सि सनु॒तः
verses.transliteration: adveṣó no maruto gātúm étana  śrótā hávaṃ jaritúr evayā́marut  víṣṇor maháḥ samanyavo yuyotana  smád rathyò ná daṃsánā-  -ápa dvéṣāṃsi sanutáḥ

translation.text: Come in a friendly spirit, come to us, O Maruts, and hear his call who praises you, Evayamarut. Like car-borne men, one-minded with the mighty Vishṇu, keep enmity far from us with your deeds of wonder.

verses.sanskrit_deva: गन्ता॑ नो य॒ज्ञं य॑ज्ञियाः सु॒शमि॒ श्रोता॒ हव॑मर॒क्ष ए॑व॒याम॑रुत् ज्येष्ठा॑सो॒ न पर्व॑तासो॒ व्यो॑मनि यू॒यं तस्य॑ प्रचेतसः॒ स्यात॑ दु॒र्धर्त॑वो नि॒दः
verses.transliteration: gántā no yajñáṃ yajñiyāḥ suśámi  śrótā hávam arakṣá evayā́marut  jyéṣṭhāso ná párvatāso vyòmani  yūyáṃ tásya pracetasaḥ  syā́ta durdhártavo nidáḥ

translation.text: Come to our sacrifice, ye Hnly Ones, to bless it, and, free from demons, hear our call, Evayamarut. Most excellent, like mountains in the air's raid-region, be irresistible, ye, Wise, to this man'a hater.
